story:
About Fit To Recover:

With support from the Petzl Foundation, Momentum Indoor Gym and Nadesan Beck PC, FTR is building a Salt Lake City bouldering wall for those in recovery from drug and alcohol addiction.

Established in 2014, Fit To Recover (FTR), Salt Lake City's only sober gym, is built on the promise to make a difference in the recovery and physical fitness communities by bringing them together into one group with shared goals. At FTR, we support each other's recovery through physical activity, gatherings, creative endeavors such as music, and the art that decorates our gym walls.

Saturday morning Boot Camp at the FTR Gym and Community Center

In January of 2015, one hundred and fifty of us opened this fabulous gym and community center so we could continue our physical activities and community support during the cold Salt Lake City winter. The open space you see below is where we will build our bouldering wall this Fall, to help those in recovery reach their goals of continued recovery. The bouldering wall is more than a metaphor; the strength, discipline, flexibility and endorphin flows of climbing are all critical components of a successful recovery plan.

Before- Marci has promise and hope for this bare FTR wall.

After- Please help us fill the void with our bouldering wall!

Our Goal:

My name is Marci. I am a founding member of the FTR community, the Bouldering Wall project coordinator, and a passionate climber. I struggled for several years battling a drug addiction. I have been sober for 3 years. Exercise and the love of the outdoors is a huge part of my recovery. Fit To Recover is a place I go that helps me stay sober and enjoy life with friends in recovery. FTR already offers many different classes from Yoga to CrossTraining; I want to add bouldering to the schedule.

I have found joy in climbing and it has been a creative outlet in my life. When I am climbing, the outside world does not matter; I am in the moment. My mind is only thinking of my next step. Climbing is a physical and mental challenge. The peace and freedom that come when climbing, words cannot describe- but other climbers know it is true. These feelings are something I want others in the FTR community to feel. 

Help us build the FTR Bouldering Wall and  the FTR Community

What We Need & What You Get

We need: A wall, crash mats, insurance and incredible experiences for those in recovery. Our bouldering wall does not require ropes or harnesses, will be 12-feet high, and will be well-matted to ensure safety. A bouldering wall is built with simplicity and strategy in mind, with handholds and toeholds that rivet attention, and inclines that offer various challenges. The crash mats are thick and expensive, as needed to protect our novice and experienced climbers. Even though our instructors are excellent climbers, the insurance costs are substantial and covered by this fundraiser.

You'll Get: Our thanks, and your choice of Perks. Here is our featured Climbing shirt perk, Reach High: Climb Strong.


You'll Also Get: Our thanks and a tax deduction. The Petzl Foundation has pledged $6,000 toward building our bouldering wall as a match for donations we can raise from our community. Any donation from you  will be a huge help and will help us reach our goal. Every dollar helps, and every referral will move us toward our goal. As a 501(c)3 organization (EIN 47-0998466),  your donation is tax deductible to the full extent permitted by law.

The Impact:

The FTR Bouldering Wall will introduce those in recovery to potentially life-changing experiences from which they can always find comfort and challenge, by themselves or within the FTR Community. Come autumn, our new converts and experienced rock climbers will embrace the Utah granite outdoors, while continuing to use the wall indoors for training and improving their technique. The FTR Bouldering Wall will help us get through the snows of winter and the hottest heat of summer. The wall will also be a doorway to the beautiful outdoor climbing experiences available here in Utah.

Our Bouldering Wall will also attract new members to Fit To Recover, and building the FTR community is still our highest goal. We want to add climbing to our current offerings- a nutrition program, a community garden, team sports, meeting spaces, creative writing/music production, yoga, cross training, dance, and other physical activity programs. The FTR community vibe comes from members swapping their passions and introducing each other to new ways of maintaining recovery- bouldering deserves to be part of these exchanges.

Help these folks experience Utah granite!

Risks & Challenges

People think that rock climbing is dangerous and this is an issue we need to address. We will do so by providing thorough skill-dependent training and experienced spotters, and the community encouragement through which we face all new FTR experiences. As confidence grows, so will our bouldering community. With these safeguards in place, our insurance provider has agreed to extend our insurance coverage to include bouldering activities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t donate to our cause at this time, please share our campaign with your friends who are climbers, and people you know who know the value of supporting those in recovery. They will understand the remarkable peace and focus that comes from climbing, and may be able to contribute to share those feelings with future climbers within the FTR Community. What a wonderful feeling it is to introduce people to something that you love, and that will give pleasure and confidence to people for the rest of their lives.

Drug and alcohol addiction affect many people and families across the world. We are a diverse group, each individual is unique and following a personal path to recovery. We celebrate our good days together and are always there to help each other through the bad days. Our physical fitness is measured by progress toward individually-set goals. We “compete” against ourselves, and not against each other. We want to help individuals that seek a way to improve their recovery through exercise and fitness. Help us make a difference, and help us help others reach up to achieve success. Thank you, from TeamFTR.


Special thanks to Max Forrest for sharing his video skills, Katie Redinger for sharing her graphic skills and Katrina Loken for her awesome photograph contributed in support of FTR.

story:
Who We Are

We are Brett and Paul - two tech industry stalwarts finding happiness and comfort in the kitchen, whether it be cooking, eating or hosting!

We met on the job at a video game company and immediately bonded over nerdy food things like sous vide machines, freeze drying ice cream and making homemade sausage. Eventually we started entering competitions as a team, with Brett's organized and whip-cracking wife Shrie as our project manager. Turns out... we're kinda good at this cooking thing.

We've won multiple chili, queso and mac and cheese cook-offs here in Austin in the last couple of years as The Cream Team. Now it's high time we up the ante by taking our homegrown culinary skills on the road to the World Food Championships in Vegas this November!


What We Need

Traveling for competitions and cooking with fancy pants ingredients can be a pricey endeavor. We're saving up cash now, but could really use some help to get things rolling. Our goal of $1000 isn't enough to pay for our trip, but it will help offset the costs tremendously. Here are our total approximated costs:

  • Driving expenses ($800 - gas, hotel, food) for trip to Vegas and back; we're going to be carrying some specialized kitchen equipment, so flying is a no-go
  • Lodging ($700 - hotel, fees) two rooms for three nights while we're there plating up awesomeness
  • General 'being there' expenses ($1000 - food, fun) food, last minute needs, incidentals, slot machines
  • Cooking and grocery supplies ($500 - specialty cooking supplies, ingredients, kitchen equipment) to make our food taste better than everyone else's

    Total: $3000
Your contribution will go towards operating costs - getting us there and back in one piece, hopefully returning with a huge new trophy. ANY money we can raise will go strictly towards paying for our trip and supplies for this trip only.


    Risks & Challenges

    We're local foodies, snatching up all the contest winnings we can, but we are realistic enough to know that there will be A LOT of people competing in Vegas. Really talented people.

    • We realize we may not win anything. This is not ideal, but an outcome we're willing to face as long as we get some really valuable experience, make a few influential contacts, and learn a lot along the way. Oh, and fun. We'll have some of that.
    • We will be competing with heavyweights. Many of the people trying their luck and skills in Vegas are professional chefs or have written cookbooks. A good amount, though, are home-taught cooks toiling away just for the fun of it, like us.

    Some things are working in our favor though....

    • Our insane track record. We haven't entered a food competition yet that we didn't win... if not the judge's choice, we nabbed people's choice or the overwhelming category winning prize.
    • We've got skillz. We may be amateurs, but we've got the chops to put out some durn tasty plates of food. I mean, queso ice cream... we created that, we won with it, and it was amazing.

      'Austin's best queso crowned at Mohawk's Quesoff IV'
      'Who is Austin's Big Cheese?'
      'Say Cheese'
      'The Cream Team Strikes Again'

    How You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute dollars to help us out, and we get that. If you can't hand over that paper, you can give us a shout out on social networks! If you need a hint, you can share the following message about us:

    "My friends, self-taught home cooks The Cream Team, are traveling to Las Vegas to compete in the World Food Championships! But they need a little help from you. See what they're about, and how you can help make their gastronomical dreams come true: http://igg.me/at/cream-team"

    Tell your friends and family about us any way you can, even if it's just regular email. You can even use the handy dandy sharing tools available to you on this IndieGogo page (underneath the big pic at the top).



    Stay in Touch

    Stay apprised of our progress and chat us up via social media at @bspangler, @pczarkowski and @shrielenee.

story:
Why Mahogany Philly?

For nearly three years Mahogany Philly has worked to nurture community in the city of Philadelphia.  We now have over 1400 members and will soon be hosting our 300th event.  Today we ask you to help keep our organization strong, and help us to reach our long term goal of opening a community center.

What We Need & What You Get

Our aim is to raise $2250 in time for the 3rd anniversary of Mahogany Philly.  This amount will help us to cover Meetup.com fees, website costs, and prevent MP Directors from placing event deposits on their personal debit and credit cards.  This will also allow us to take the first step toward opening a community center.

What’s in it for you?  We hope that you will give out of your love for Mahogany Philly.  We are also offering a few perks!

The Impact

Mahogany Philly makes a difference to the Philadelphia community every day.  Our members volunteer together, set goals, exercise, socialize.  This is a force for good, and we want to keep it going strong! 

Risks & Challenges

Like all organizations, we face risks and challenges with regard to growing Mahogany Philly.  How do we nurture a tight knit community while continuing to grow?  Who will support our effort to build a thriving community center? 

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to support Mahogany Philly in other ways?  Please consider sharing this campaign with friends and family.  You don’t have to be a member of Mahogany Philly to understand the value.

story:
“If you were to take a corn seed and plant it in the ground, and water it, it will eventually germinate and grow.  If you were to take a stone and place it on top of the seed it would go round and round and round and eventually die.  If you were able to remove that stone the plant will be able to grow and become what was intended.” Colin Salisbury

Hi, my name is Colin Salisbury, Founder and President of Global Volunteer Network (GVN).  At GVN we are passionate about enriching people's lives by breaking the poverty cycle, however to do that we first need to remove the barriers that are preventing communities from reaching their full potential.  The team and I have come up with a pretty unique and innovative model we think will revolutionise the way we connect, share, and exchange as human beings to help put an end to poverty once and for all. It’s called the GVN PoD!

Thanks for reading and I hope you will join us and be a part of this amazing journey.

What is a GVN PoD?

The GVN PoD is an architecturally designed community innovation centre that brings together individuals and organisations from around the world who are dedicated to social and environmental change.

The PoDs provide a platform for innovation, engagement, and creativity in the work of artists, research teams, grassroots organizations, international NGOs, educational institutions, community groups,  medical outreach teams, universities, musicians, students, volunteers, social entrepreneurs ... (you get the idea!).


Design

The architecture of our PoD reflects the cultural feel of the landscape with an emphasis on sustainability and respect for the environment.  Features of the center will include Adobe bricks & stone, solar water heat & electric power, natural lighting, natural ventilation, water tanks, green houses, tree seed orchard & nursery, resource conservation, composting and vegetable gardens.

Impact

The PoDs facilitate open, ongoing learning and exchange between PoD members and the local community. They provide purpose designed spaces for training and workshops, research and product development, music and arts, areas to learn organic farming and horticulture, and rooms for treatment and outreach.

The GVN PoD will be planted with love, be nurtured, and grow as if from a seed pod.  It will be a place for people to come together in a supportive environment to create, learn arts, business, social skills, share their talents, conduct research and outreach, and become leaders in their own communities.

What We Need

We have the vision and the network. Now we just need $25,000 to take the first step and make it a reality! When you make a donation to the GVN PoDs you will be directly contributing to the first stage of the building process which includes an extensive in-country feasibility study with community consultation and participation.  The learnings from this research will help plant the seeds for the PoDs idea to germinate and grow in line with the local communities needs and ideas.

What's in it for you?  Donors will receive:

Every donor receives a perk from us, whether you donate $10 (Every little bit helps!) or $20,000 (You're an angel and we love you!). Check out the list on the right hand side of this page to pick your perk! We’ll also be posting regular photo and written updates to IndieGoGo, Facebook, and our website so you can watch the GVN PoD grow.

Will I get a tax receipt for my donation?

If you choose to receive one of our perks for your donation, you will not receive a tax receipt.

If you choose to make a contribution without receiving a perk, you will receive a receipt. If you are from United States then you will be able to use this receipt for tax purposes as the GVN Foundation is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt non-profit organization in the United States. Donors from all other countries will need to check the rules and regulations of their country to find out whether their receipt can be used for tax purposes.

More about Global Volunteer Network and GVN Foundation?

The Global Volunteer Network (GVN) offers volunteer service opportunities in community projects in 22 countries throughout South America, Africa and Asia. Over the past 8 years we have built up strong ties with grassroots organizations throughout the world, and placed 13,500+ volunteers.

GVN Foundation, the non-profit arm of GVN, provides financial assistance and helps implement sustainable development projects to local community organisations we support. Whether that is building a school for orphans of HIV/AIDS or providing emergency food supplies to victims of natural disasters, GVN Foundation work to provide communities with the resources they need. The GVN Foundation was granted Special consultative status by the United Nations Economic and Social Council in July, 2009.

Looking for more Info? To find out more about Global Volunteer Network and GVN Foundation, please visit our website:  [w] http://www.globalvolunteernetwork.org/  or send any questions to [e]  info@volunteer.org.nz

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm the co-pastor of Stand & Be Counted Worship center.  My husband and I have been pastoring for the past nine years and our church is going.  I'm asking for donations cause our church is small and need help in financing this building project we facing right now.
 
We are expanding and don't have the funds to complete the project cause most of the people who is apart of the church do not have jobs.

What We Need & What You Get

The church need about $5,000 to complete the project but it's on going cause we are trying to expand even more and get the building next to us for our youth center.  But we said one building at a time but we really beed your help.
 
All funds are tax dedutible.

The Impact

This will impact the communty and the church, cause it will enable us to continue to feed the hungry on third saturdays and educate the comunity on drug abuse and violence in the area.

Thank you for your help and God Bless you.
story_txt:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm the co-pastor of Stand & Be Counted Worship center.  My husband and I have been pastoring for the past nine years and our church is going.  I'm asking for donations cause our church is small and need help in financing this building project we facing right now.
 
We are expanding and don't have the funds to complete the project cause most of the people who is apart of the church do not have jobs.

What We Need & What You Get

The church need about $5,000 to complete the project but it's on going cause we are trying to expand even more and get the building next to us for our youth center.  But we said one building at a time but we really beed your help.
 
All funds are tax dedutible.

The Impact
This will impact the communty and the church, cause it will enable us to continue to feed the hungry on third saturdays and educate the comunity on drug abuse and violence in the area.
Thank you for your help and God Bless you.

story:
I am a student at California State University, Sacramento. I am a Recreation Therapy major and I am hoping to raise money to hold an event for local needy children on November 10. We need money for supplies which include cookies, frosting, raffle prizes, decorations, art supplies, etc.

 

Your donation will help bring a smile to children who could use it.

 

NOTE: You will be donating to three students at the California State University of Sacramento to hold an event for needy children. All left over prodeeds will be donated to a local non-profit.

story:
So simple yet so difficult, run or walk a 5k carrying 25 pounds of of foodstuff plus your own water supply over different types of terrain.  It is tougher than "Tough Mudder", more challenging than the "Spartan Run".

You can help the Courage Games plan, organize and implement five Regional Ruck Runs in November, 2013 and a Championship Ruck Run in December, 2013. Entrants will be issued rucksacks (backpacks) filled with 25lbs of foodstuff and run/walk a 5km cross country course at night. These runs will benefit local food banks, select veteran service organizations and the 2nd Annual Courage Games' Medical Symposium on "Neurogenesis and Exericse - Its Effect on PTSD/TBI"

The goals of the 2013 Courage Games’ Ruck Runs are:

  • To give the entrant a feel for what our servicemen and women carry on their backs everyday in Afghanistan and Iraq.
  • To supply a local food bank(s) that cater homeless veterans with tons of non-perishable foodstuff.
  • To financially support select veteran organizations that directly assist the servicemember and his/her family as well as victims of the Boston Marathon.
  • To support the Courage Games’ Medical Symposium on “Neurogenesis and Exercise - Its Effect On PTSD/TBI”.
  • To bring members of select PTSD/TBI support groups to the medical symposium.  

COURAGE GAMES - RUCK RUN - GENERAL INFO

INTRODUCTION

  • All entrants will be provided with a sealed rucksack wrapped in a glow cord and filled with 25 pounds of foodstuff.
  • Individuals/Teams will run/walk a 5km Cross Country course carrying the 25 pounds of foodstuff and their own water supply.
  • At the end of the race entrants will deposit the foodstuff into bins provided by a local food bank.
  • Run will happen at night in rain, hale, sleet or snow.

DIVISIONS

  • Individual Open & Age Group
    • Male
    • Female
  • Team
    • Open Male - 6 entrants - all score
    • Open Female - 6 entrants - all score
    • Open Co-ed - 3 male & 3 female - all score
    • Group I, II, III - Male, Female & Co-Ed

ENTRY FEE

  • INDIVIDUAL
    • $80 - You will receive a Backpack (a $35 value), 25 pounds of foodstuff (a $20 value) & T-shirt.
  • TEAM
    • $400 - Each member will receive a Backpack (a $35 value), 25 pounds of foodstuff (a $20 value) & T-shirt (a $5 value) and a commemorative dogtag. 

INDIVIDUAL AGE GROUPS

OPEN        - All Ages

Group I      - 0 to 19

Group II     - 20 to 24

Group III    - 25 to 29

Group IV    - 30 to 34

Group V     - 35 to 39

Group VI    - 40 to 44

Group VII   - 45 to 49

Group VIII  - 50 to 54

Group IX    - 55 to 59

Group X     - 60 to 64

Group XI    - 65 & Up

 TEAM AGE GROUPS (Male, Female & Co-Ed)

  • Open        - All Ages
  • Group I     - Ages 0 to 34
  • Group II    - Ages 35 to 64
  • Group III   - Ages 65 & Above

 AWARDS

  • REGIONAL OPEN (Individual & Team) 
    • 1st Place - RT airfare and 2 hotel nights in South Florida for 1st Place Open Individual (Men & Women) and 1st Place Open Team (Male, Female & Coed)
    • 2nd thru 10th Plqce distinctive medals
  • REGIONAL AGE GROUP (Individual & Team)
    • 1st, 2nd & 3rd Place - Distinctive medals. 
    • 4th thru 10th Plqce distinctive medals.
  • FLORIDA CHAMPIONSHIP  OPEN (Individual & Team)
    • 1st Place - 5 day Caribbean cruise from South Florida and RT airfare to South Florids for 1st Place Open Individual (Men & Women) and 1st Place Open Team (Male, Female & Coed)
    • 2nd & 10th Place - Distinctive medals. 
  • FLORIDA CHAMPIONSHIP AGE GROUP (Individual & Team) 
    • 1st, 2nd & 3rd Place - Distinctive medals. 
    • 4th thru 10th Plqce distinctive medals
  • TEAM SCORING - Sum of all six individual finishing places

SITES & DATES

  • NORTHEAST        REGION I   -  TBD - NOV, 2013
  • ATLANTIC COAST REGION II   - TBD - NOV, 2013
  • SOUTHWEST       REGION III  - TBD - NOV, 2013
  • NORTHWEST       REGION IV  - TBD - NOV, 2013
  • MOUNTAIN          REGION V  - America The Beautiful Park, Colorado Springs, CO - NOV, 2013
  • CHAMPIONSHIP - Dania Beach, FL - DEC, 2013

story:
SMUGGLERS PROOF Scotch Whisky - born from the desire to share the beauty of  what a Single Scotch Whisky can be. With your help, I can complete the production of the first batch and have it imported for distribution in Canada and the United States. To achieve this, I need your help to finalize the production with the distillery, bottling, labeling, packaging, shipping, customs and warehouse storage in United States and Canada.

How your Pledge Works
To accomplish this, the goal is to raise $25,000. I’ve created some amazing rewards to thank you for your generosity.

The Story
For the last 8 years, I’ve had a love affair with Scotch Whisky, exploring its richness and complexities. I decided to develop a brand of Scotch Whisky due to a debate that was ongoing about the quality of whisky at various social events, I was determined to provide some satisfaction and enjoyment of a quality drink of Scotch Whisky for future events around the city and that is how the birth of Smugglers Proof came to life. Smugglers Proof is a unique brand of Scotch Whisky with special packaging. I especially love the moment when the brand is introduce to someone and to see the wonderful reaction from them.


Work ongoing and completed

• Carefully selecting an award-winning distiller to create the highest quality product that is completely aligned with the  mission of this brand.

• Completed work on designing a modern decanter bottle and packaging.

• Securing difficult and stringent approvals in the United States and Canada. 

• Got a number of approvals. 



The Plan
With your support, we can put SMUGGLERS PROOF Single Malt Scotch Whisky in the hands of people worldwide. The project is currently in the final stages and we are ready to start bottling our special 15 year and 20 year old Scotch Whisky.


How Will the Funds be used
The main portion of funds received from our supporters will go towards bottling costs, freight and taxes. The goal of this project is for the initial run of 600 bottles.

A very aggressive sales campaign will begin to make sure the first batch is sold quickly and a second larger batch can be ordered and enjoyed. In exchange for your generous support, there are a number of rewards to enjoy as a sponsor that include impressive recognition awards and gifts.

story:
This campaign has ended.

Lumenator is available here.

Special thanks to all of our funders! We couldn't do it without you.

Power Panel & Power Panel Plus+

Thin. LED.

Light. Bright.

Go. Anywhere.

This is a follow up for our highly successful original power panel campaign on Indiegogo. Thank you all so much for all of your support!

The Power Panel now comes in 3 flavors:

Power Panel (PP) - Standard Power Panel with battery and no AC power or other accessories.

Power Panel (PP) PRO - Power Panel with AC power and many accessories.

Power Panel (PP) Plus+ - Upgraded Power Panel with Barn Doors, Stackability and many accessories.

Power Panel is also available at a special bundle price as multi-light and multi-accessory kits (2x, 3x, etc.).

Please make your perk choice on the right.


Note to International Customers: We will supply you with the correct plug for your respective region when ordering. We carry plugs for US, UK, EU and AU.

 

The Go Anywhere, Do Anything LED light at a price you won't believe!

Thanks for checking out our Power Panel project! Here at ColorRight, we've been making awesome white balance tools and flash diffusers for over 5 years. We've even won awards for our ColorRight PRO line of color balance tools. Recently, we raised almost $60K for our Lumenator project.

Now, we want to introduce you to the Power Panel. So far, we have made 3 working prototypes of this revolutionary type of LED panel light that works for both photo and Video. The Power Panel light is an ultra thin LED panel (.6 inches) that has gobs of power (approximately 6000 lumens, 500 Watt Light Bulb). Power Panel is also the very first rectangular LED panel to use LEDNatural technology for ultra soft light without the hassle of a softbox. At just over 2 pounds this panel is your Go Anywhere, Do Anything lighting solution. 

The Power Panel is amazing, but we need your help to make it a reality. We are leveraging a lot of the technology and knowledge we gained from our Lumenator project in the Power Panel, so we don't need to raise as much money to make the Power Panel a reality, but we still need lots of help! We are still a small family run company. We believe these LEDNatural LED products are the best we have ever made.

Your Impact & Our Future Plans

We think Power Panel and Lumenator are the future of photo & video lighting. By contributing you are making a difference in the lives of photographers and videographers everywhere. The Power Panel and Lumenator projects have the potential to totally up-end all our pre-conceived notions about what LED lighting can do, and where it can go. With the success of Power Panel and Lumenator we plan to introduce additional products utilizing our LEDNatural technology.

We believe the Power Panel and Lumenator represent the first products in a true 2nd wave of LED lighting technology. We can't wait to see where you take the Power Panel or what you do with it once you get there.

We can't get there without you. Please help us get the word out, by telling your family and friends and through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram etc. This site has convenient links for most social sites right here on this page.

Thank you so much for supporting the future of photo and video lighting with your contribution!

Please choose your perk using the links to the right.


Power Panel vs. LED lights


Power Panel Plus+

story:
Who We Are

My name is Josh Jackson, owner of J. Jackson: Mobile Mixologist. We are a private bartending service headquartered in Nashville, TN. Our passion is delivering a thoughtful, creative, fun and polished imbibing experience for our clients. It has been only one year since we first launched this service and already we have created a sizable list of enthusiastic and satisfied private, corporate and wedding clients.

Now it is time to develop our service even further, creating greater value for our clients and their guests. Our goal is to purchase a SmartBar, a portable, customizable bar that would enable us to better serve our clients and take their event to an exciting new level

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help! We are looking to raise 8,000 dollars to make this goal come to life. Roughly 80% of your contributions will go to obtaining the bar with the remainder going to paying the fine folks at Indie Go Go and purchasing the perks for you, our backers.

Speaking of perks....We want to express our deepest appreciation to our backers by giving you a taste of the J. Jackson: Mobile Mixologist experience. Your personal "Thank You" will come in the form of V.I.P. parties, hand-made bottled punches, mixology lessons, or even your very own official cocktail! Check out the full list and see what resonates most with you.

Other Ways You Can Help

The holiday season is fast approaching. All kinds of challenges can come up. We understand. Some of us just won't be able to contribute financially right now. But don't worry! You can still help! If you catch the vision, spread the word! Utilize Facebook and Twitter, and take advantage of IGG's own sharing tools. We greatly appreciate your help!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Marcos Mendez. This studio has been my dream since I was a kid where I would "host" my own radio show from my grandparents home in a South Texas barrio. I would interview my sister, my grandmother, my grandfather, and my aunt...anyone that would let me really.  I would record interviews into a handheld recorder onto analog audio cassettes. I'm ready to move into the digital communication realm and specifically podcasting.

Broken Dam Studio will become the project of a lifelong dream to communicate with a larger audience. We will produce professional podcasts that will highlight stories, music, and ideas that we will share with our networks.

Last year I unsuccessfully attempted to crowd fund a podcast project. This time will be different. I have reevaluated my approach,  researched the art of podcasting, researched equipment needs, and I am attempting to expand the scope of the project but decreasing the funding need. Instead of focusing on one podcast I am moving forward to create an entire podcast NETWORK with a tighter, more reasonable, budget. Together we can make this project a reality.

"What is a podcast?"

Some of you may be familiar with podcasting and others of you may not. Generally podcasts are "online radio on-demand." Podcasts can be listened to using a smartphone app or via a computer or laptop. The medium is relatively new and many media organizations are now turning to podcasts to reach their audience. National Public Radio is a large player in the podcast arena. Shows like This American Life, Snap Judgement, and RadioLab reach large numbers of consumers and podcasting is quickly becoming a preferred vehicle to share information and ideas. 

"Why now? Why podcasts?"

Today is a very crucial time for podcasting. Podcasters create content that is being shared on social media (Facebook, Twitter, reddit, etc.), video sharing sites (Twitter, Vimeo, etc.), and traditional media outlets like radio and television. From non-ficton, short-form storytelling and old-time radio shows to music shows and science shows the scope and content created through this medium is limitless. 

Recently appointed NPR President and CEO Jarl Mohn was recently interviewed by Maria Hinojosa, host of the NPR program Latino USA. He explained that NPR will be focusing heavily on increased diversity in their programming to allow the network to represent our ever evolving society. Broken Dam Studio will be a vehicle to help develop the diverse content and content creators (hosts) that will soon fill a need for natinal companies like NPR and other content seekers.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking $1500 to purchase all of the items required to assemble a mobile podcast studio. With that $1500 I will purchase the following items:

  • Zoom H5 Digital Recorder
  • Mackie 1202VLZ4 Audio Mixer
  • (3) Dyamic Microphones
  • (2) Condenser Microphones
  • (3) Boom Microphone Stands
  • (3) 6 ft. XLR Microphone Cables
  • (2) 3 ft. - 1/8 in. TRS Cables 
  • (4) Hi-Fi DJ Headphones
  • ARTcessories Headphone Amp
  • 1-year Website Hosting Membership - Squarspace
  • 1-year Podcast Hosting Membership - Libsyn
  • Reaper Digital Audio Workspace (Audio Mixing Software)
"What will I get for backing the project?"
Many of the "perks" that you will receive are outlined in the PERKS section for this project. However, some of the "perks" that you will find there are:
  • Opportunities to guest host a podcast
  • Handwritten thank you notes
  • swag (t-shirts, koozies)
  • acoustic house concerts
  • ...and more
"What happens if you don't reach your goal?"
This is why I've chosen Indiegogo as my crowd funding platform. If I do not reach the goal I will still have access to the funds that you have so generously provided and THE STUDIO WILL SURVIVE. I will use what is raised to get the studio started. The Studio will be paired down to the most important pieces of equipment which are the microphones, the cables, and the podcast hosting site. The other items will be added as soon as I am able to raise enough money to purchase them. We only have 30 days to reach our goal, but I am very confident that we will hit the goal early. When we surpass the goal I can start to review the current equipment list and continue to upgrade the microphones and cables to ensure the best possible recording conditions are available for our content creators. You only have one time to make a flawless impression for the podcast audience. 
The Impact

This project impact will be two-fold. First, the Studio will give content creators access to professional level equipment and a commitment from me to provide quality programming. Together we will release content into the ether with the hope that the topics covered will resonate with a large and ever growing population.

Secondly, the Studio will bring recognition to our community and to the unique and talented members of the community. Your stories, your music, your legacy - they can all be shared with the WORLD. 

In my research I have found that podcasters that have found their story unique come to realize that there are many other people around the globe that share their sentiments or have similar stories but have never shared it with others. Podcasts and podcast creators give strength to their peers and their community. 

Risks & Challenges

Here is an incomplete list of challenges:

  • Time: The daily grind has been described by some podcasters as a Sisyphyean  task, but hard work is always worth the effort. Consumers of podcasts - of which I am one - want consistency in their programming. This means that the content must be released in a timely fashion on a set schedule. If they do not stick to the schedule consumers will quickly loose interest and move on to someone else's podcast.
  • Learning Curve: I have never produced a show or run a studio. But, I've been a musician for the better part of 20 years. I'm a vocalist that also plays guitar and saxophone. While I have only been running sound as a hobby for less than 3 years for local bands and private concerts I'm ready to take on this challenge starting now. Over the last year, In addition to my experience with live sound, I've been studying up on recording techniques and podcast production. I'm well prepared for this project to hit the ground right now.
  • Marketing: You will be our audience. We need to reach you. This project is the start of a great thing and we will need to use all of our resources to reach each one of the people that will benefit from hearing our podcasters messages. Social media, word-of-mouth, cross-podcast collaboration and many other options will make this project successful.
  • Content: (New, Fresh, and Exciting) Content is King. We will need to keep our podcasters up-to-date on trends and how their audience is reacting to specific content that they are creating. If we put out stale content, that is not relevant now consumers will drop the podcast and seek out others that are delivering new, fresh, and exciting.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for checking out my campaign. I hope that my story and my vision is clear in this presentation. If you are able to donate to the campaign I would greatly appreciate it. Know that your donation will be used to strengthen our community and all that live in it. 
If you are moved by this project but are unable to donate monetarily does not mean you cannot help me reach my goal. YOU are still an import part of this project. Please share this link on your social media sites and with your friends and relatives.  You can also utilize Indiegogo functionality and share this project with the Indie gogo Share Tools! Each time you share this project I am that much closer to finding a way to make my DREAM a REALITY!
Finally, I've been asked in the past, "What would you want to be if money was no object?" I've always answered that I would choose the path of a Travel Channel host. This project is keeping me honest to my answer to that question.
I sincerely thank you for your time.

-Marcos
story_txt:
Short Summary My name is Marcos Mendez. This studio has been my dream since I was a kid where I would "host" my own radio show from my grandparents home in a South Texas barrio. I would interview my sister, my grandmother, my grandfather, and my aunt...anyone that would let me really.  I would record interviews into a handheld recorder onto analog audio cassettes. I'm ready to move into the digital communication realm and specifically podcasting.
Broken Dam Studio will become the project of a lifelong dream to communicate with a larger audience. We will produce professional podcasts that will highlight stories, music, and ideas that we will share with our networks.
Last year I unsuccessfully attempted to crowd fund a podcast project. This time will be different. I have reevaluated my approach,  researched the art of podcasting, researched equipment needs, and I am attempting to expand the scope of the project but decreasing the funding need. Instead of focusing on one podcast I am moving forward to create an entire podcast NETWORK with a tighter, more reasonable, budget. Together we can make this project a reality.
"What is a podcast?"
Some of you may be familiar with podcasting and others of you may not. Generally podcasts are "online radio on-demand." Podcasts can be listened to using a smartphone app or via a computer or laptop. The medium is relatively new and many media organizations are now turning to podcasts to reach their audience. National Public Radio is a large player in the podcast arena. Shows like This American Life, Snap Judgement, and RadioLab reach large numbers of consumers and podcasting is quickly becoming a preferred vehicle to share information and ideas. 
"Why now? Why podcasts?"
Today is a very crucial time for podcasting. Podcasters create content that is being shared on social media (Facebook, Twitter, reddit, etc.), video sharing sites (Twitter, Vimeo, etc.), and traditional media outlets like radio and television. From non-ficton, short-form storytelling and old-time radio shows to music shows and science shows the scope and content created through this medium is limitless. 
Recently appointed NPR President and CEO Jarl Mohn was recently interviewed by Maria Hinojosa, host of the NPR program Latino USA. He explained that NPR will be focusing heavily on increased diversity in their programming to allow the network to represent our ever evolving society. Broken Dam Studio will be a vehicle to help develop the diverse content and content creators (hosts) that will soon fill a need for natinal companies like NPR and other content seekers.   What We Need & What You Get I am seeking $1500 to purchase all of the items required to assemble a mobile podcast studio. With that $1500 I will purchase the following items: 
Zoom H5 Digital Recorder
Mackie 1202VLZ4 Audio Mixer
(3) Dyamic Microphones
(2) Condenser Microphones
(3) Boom Microphone Stands
(3) 6 ft. XLR Microphone Cables
(2) 3 ft. - 1/8 in. TRS Cables 
(4) Hi-Fi DJ Headphones
ARTcessories Headphone Amp
1-year Website Hosting Membership - Squarspace
1-year Podcast Hosting Membership - Libsyn
Reaper Digital Audio Workspace (Audio Mixing Software)

"What will I get for backing the project?"
Many of the "perks" that you will receive are outlined in the PERKS section for this project. However, some of the "perks" that you will find there are:

Opportunities to guest host a podcast

Handwritten thank you notes

swag (t-shirts, koozies)
acoustic house concerts
...and more

"What happens if you don't reach your goal?"
This is why I've chosen Indiegogo as my crowd funding platform. If I do not reach the goal I will still have access to the funds that you have so generously provided and THE STUDIO WILL SURVIVE. I will use what is raised to get the studio started. The Studio will be paired down to the most important pieces of equipment which are the microphones, the cables, and the podcast hosting site. The other items will be added as soon as I am able to raise enough money to purchase them. We only have 30 days to reach our goal, but I am very confident that we will hit the goal early. When we surpass the goal I can start to review the current equipment list and continue to upgrade the microphones and cables to ensure the best possible recording conditions are available for our content creators. You only have one time to make a flawless impression for the podcast audience. 
The Impact
 This project impact will be two-fold. First, the Studio will give content creators access to professional level equipment and a commitment from me to provide quality programming. Together we will release content into the ether with the hope that the topics covered will resonate with a large and ever growing population.
Secondly, the Studio will bring recognition to our community and to the unique and talented members of the community. Your stories, your music, your legacy - they can all be shared with the WORLD. 
In my research I have found that podcasters that have found their story unique come to realize that there are many other people around the globe that share their sentiments or have similar stories but have never shared it with others. Podcasts and podcast creators give strength to their peers and their community. 
  Risks & Challenges
Here is an incomplete list of challenges:

Time: The daily grind has been described by some podcasters as a Sisyphyean  task, but hard work is always worth the effort. Consumers of podcasts - of which I am one - want consistency in their programming. This means that the content must be released in a timely fashion on a set schedule. If they do not stick to the schedule consumers will quickly loose interest and move on to someone else's podcast.
Learning Curve: I have never produced a show or run a studio. But, I've been a musician for the better part of 20 years. I'm a vocalist that also plays guitar and saxophone. While I have only been running sound as a hobby for less than 3 years for local bands and private concerts I'm ready to take on this challenge starting now. Over the last year, In addition to my experience with live sound, I've been studying up on recording techniques and podcast production. I'm well prepared for this project to hit the ground right now.
Marketing: You will be our audience. We need to reach you. This project is the start of a great thing and we will need to use all of our resources to reach each one of the people that will benefit from hearing our podcasters messages. Social media, word-of-mouth, cross-podcast collaboration and many other options will make this project successful.
Content: (New, Fresh, and Exciting) Content is King. We will need to keep our podcasters up-to-date on trends and how their audience is reacting to specific content that they are creating. If we put out stale content, that is not relevant now consumers will drop the podcast and seek out others that are delivering new, fresh, and exciting.


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for checking out my campaign. I hope that my story and my vision is clear in this presentation. If you are able to donate to the campaign I would greatly appreciate it. Know that your donation will be used to strengthen our community and all that live in it. 
If you are moved by this project but are unable to donate monetarily does not mean you cannot help me reach my goal. YOU are still an import part of this project. Please share this link on your social media sites and with your friends and relatives.  You can also utilize Indiegogo functionality and share this project with the Indie gogo Share Tools! Each time you share this project I am that much closer to finding a way to make my DREAM a REALITY!
Finally, I've been asked in the past, "What would you want to be if money was no object?" I've always answered that I would choose the path of a Travel Channel host. This project is keeping me honest to my answer to that question.
I sincerely thank you for your time.-Marcos

story:
Short Summary

We are three Elon University gentlemen who adopted a lovely kitten we now call A$AP Muffins. We adopted her from the animal shelter near our school with the intention of giving her a better life. It is the shelter's policy to medically evaluate all animals before offering them up for adoption, and to spay the animal before releasing her to adoptive parents. All of this is understandable, but a negligent procedure and poor medical evaluation landed us with one sick kitten. When she was picked up, there was paper work claiming she was perfectly healthy, and had passed a medical examination. The shelter was only willing to acknowledge that Muff had some conjunctivitis, and recommended us to give her eye drops 2 times a day. 

We took Banana Nut home and she was loving it. She had her own room and had 1000x more space to be the curious kitten she is. Lemon Poppyseed loved all the company and attention at our house, even falling asleep amongst her new friends while we had people over. She had normal cycles of energy, giving us both playtime and downtime to enjoy her company in our home. We were a family. 

A couple days later, a lump formed near her stitches, so we made an appointment at the vet. Poor Blueberry had developed an umbilical hernia, left undiagnosed by the shelter, and another hernia in her stomach that was a direct result of a reckless procedure before her release. After being at the vet for an hour, we had received a call from the doctor. Muffins would have had only days to live if we did not bring her in. We heard more bad news from the vet- we would need two surgeries. The vet also informed us that Chocolate Chip had a virus, Feline Distemper, that can only be contracted at birth, and that's what the shelter called "conjunctivitis." Not only was the vet appalled that she was spayed so young, but was appalled that they would let someone have a new kitten with something that could kill them within a week. 

We have hope because we have a passionate vet, but this is going to take a toll on our ability to take care of Muffins in the future if we pay so much right after her adoption. We humbly ask for any donation to help us afford Muffins' surgeries. We will provide a happy home for our soon-to-be healthy kitten. No donation is too small. Thank you for your consideration.


WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SAVE OUR MUFFINS.


What We Need 

- We need approximately $500.00 to cover the expenses of the surgeries

- If we do not reach our goal, all money raised will 100% go to saving Muffins life

- Any money we receive that is over our goal, will go to pay the vet


What You Get

Helping to save A$AP Muffins life, you get:

  • A personalized cute picture of Muffins
  • A personalized Christmas card from the Muffins, and the Lodge.
  • Description of where the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal.

The Impact

Saving this precious kitten, Muffins, life

  • We will be the happiest 3 gentleman with our healthy Muffins back
  • Help save an animals life
  • Helping bring Muffins back home


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: (if this happens to be you)

  • Help us spread the word
  • Ask friends and family
  • Share this page!

story:
My name is Bill Morse. 

I work with an amazing group of Cambodian men and women who clear landmines and unexploded ordnance in Cambodia.

AND WE NEED YOUR HELP - RIGHT NOW!


In 2003 I met a man named Aki Ra, an ex-child soldier, who was clearing landmines with a stick and a pair of pliers.  I started a charity to support his work - the Landmine Relief Fund.  Today Aki Ra has a landmine clearance team, Cambodian Self Help Demining (CSHD), made up of 25 men and women, some of them ex-child soldiers themselves.   They clear landmines in rural, 'low priority' villages in Cambodia. To date they have:

  • cleared over 90 mine fields
  • returned over 1,600,000 square meters of land to local villagers
  • put over 13,000 people back on land that was killing them

But landmines are only part of the problem.  Millions of old bombs, mortar rounds, and unexploded ammunition litter this poor country.

And they kill and maim people who were not even born when they were left in the ground.

We need your help to help those who cannot help themselves.


EXPLOSIVE ORDNANCE DISPOSAL (EOD)

In 2014  the Landmine Relief Fund funded EOD Team 1. 

In the first 7 months they:

  • destroyed 553 UXOs
  • destroyed 109 fuses for UXOs
  • destroyed 250 pounds of small arms ammunition
  • destroyed 70 landmines
  • checked and cleared 550 square meters of land
  • gave landmine and UXO awareness classes to over 1,500 villagers

This has been one of the most extraordinarily effective programs we have ever done.  We need to, we must, start a second team.


THE CAMPAIGN TO ADD EOD TEAM 2

  • We need to raise $100,000 to put EOD Team 2 in the field for 12 months.  This will cover all the costs of salaries, transportation, maintenance, food, medical, lodging, equipment repair, training aids, etc.
  • We can get the funding to buy the equipment: $50,000  -                               IF we have the funding to operate the team.
  • We have training available in Cambodia to get this team up and running -     If we have the funding to operate the team.

            TODAY IS YOUR CHANCE TO 

               BE PART OF A SOLUTION


9 PEOPLE WERE KILLED OR WOUNDED (WORLDWIDE) EVERY DAY IN 2014 BY MINES & UXOs

If this were happening at home we would end this problem immediately.  Why do we let it continue in Cambodia?

Here is your chance to make a difference right now! 

Take a stand and be part of the solution!

No donation is too small.

story:
• Years ago, there were many small local coffee shops. One by one, they disappeared. I want to open one of my own, a cool place where poets can read at open mics & sell their books. Where local artists can have gallery wall space to sell consignment pieces. Where local singers  can preform and sell their CDs. A place of my own, that you'll love to come to.

The Impact

  • I'll be able to  hire up to 10 people
  • I'll be selling direct trade coffee, which will help benefit South American farmers
  • There will be opportunities for local artists, performers, and poets to sell their wares


Risks & Challenges

The challenge is raising the funds and the risk is losing it all, but we'll never know unless we try. So let's do this!

Other Ways You Can Help

Tweet, retweet, share this with friends on Facebook and other social networking sites to help to get the word out.

story:
The VERY FIRST vegan restaurant, social and education center in the whole country!
The MOST IMPORTANT step for developing veganism in Armenia!

You could be a revolutionary seed of veganism, peace, health, and harmony in the middle east. 
Help us to bring this gift to our country and post Armenia on VEGAN MAP. 
Please share and contribute, become this BIG change with us!!!

______________________________________
WHAT IS VEGIT?

Vegit is going to be the very first vegan eating corner in Yerevan, Armenia, which aims not only to show the diversity of vegan cuisine but also to promote an ethical treatment to animals, sustain a clean environment and, of course, encourage a healthy lifestyle. 

                                                


THE STORY BEHIND

Being a vegan for almost eleven years and acting as a devoted member of Armenian vegan community, as well as establishing the biggest organization of animal rights protection in Armenia (facebook.com/dingoteam), we finally realized that it was the right time for Armenia to have a vegan restaurant.

Even though the tendency of veganism is growing, there has never been a single vegan restaurant in the whole country that could spur the vegan philosophy and promote a healthy lifestyle. So we decided to be the changes we wanted see in our country. This will be a dream come true for us, and it will advocate a new approach to life, spread kindness and love of animals throughout an entire society. 

The main goal of our restaurant is to foster the increase of conscience in our society in every way possible. It will also act as a supporter and promoter to carry out different programs by Armenian vegans, bring about any events on vegan matter and charity acts for free.

VEGIT'S KITCHEN

The basis of our kitchen is not only vegan food but we also emphasize the art of eating ecologically clean food. Our food sources will only be fresh products from local farmers. The cooking will never be done through any unhealthy means, such as microwaving, frying, etc. Following the saying “you are what you eat,” the aim of our cuisine is to make the new developing cells of our costumers cleaner through our healthy and kind food. Our kitchen will be so tasty that even non vegans will love to visit us and have a satisfying and fulfilling meal that will provide them with energy and good mood. 


WHY YOU SHOULD HELP US

We have already successfully established and developed the most active and the biggest stray animals protection organization in Armenia. We created it from nothing and now it is spreading love towards animals in the conscience of our society day by day. Through the last eleven years, this idea has ripen, and now we are ready to realize it. The biggest aim of our project is to share the idea and culture of a healthy life, and the beauty of human-animal relationship.

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

 Having written a very detailed business plan, we found out that we need $60.000 to begin the project. We have raised $20.000 ourselves and have won $10.000 from the Small and Medium Entrepreneurship Development Nation Centre in Armenia as the best beginner business project. 

Right now we are missing only $30.000.

By donating even the smallest amount, you will support a whole country to support the vegan movement and have the first veggie eating corner.  Your name will be on the thank you list of those, who will always be remembered as the supporters of the biggest and first vegan project in Armenia.


                                 THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR TIME 
                                            LIVE HAPPY AND HEALTHY

                                                                     :)

story:
Hi Everybody!


My name is Balu Major from Hungary, Budapest.

I play Freestyle Frisbee and I am European and World Freestyle Frisbee Champion.

About this sport:
Freestyle frisbee players use the nail delay to set up all kinds of frisbee tricks - you will see in my video - like rolls, brushes, tips, pulls, and catches, but many of these maneuvers can be introduced into basic catch and throw. 
Anyone can learn how to freestyle and it can be done anywhere, for example in Budapest! Freestyle frisbee has expanded all across the world. 
Learn how to play and help us spread the jam!

Over the past few years I have been chasing a dream. The World Championship in USA IN NEW YORK CITY!

This journey started from my early experiences as 15 year old freestyler. Throughout this adventure I have been able to travel all around the country, in Europe and have been very fortunate to compete against some of the best players in the world.I have had the great fortune to have many supportive friends and family, teammates who helped make this opportunity possible, and i couldn't be more thankful for them for this.But now, this is about something else. This is about making the impossible possible, trying to conquer the world title.

As you can imagine the high cost of high performance training in Europe and other centers of the world along with( food, travel,,registration, accomodation), supplements and of course the tournament itself will certainly create a large financial burden on all of the loved ones who have helped me so far. As such, i'd very much appreciate any help from outsiders, any donation given by you will make me one step closer to my dream!

Thank you very much!

Balu Major
story_txt:
Hi Everybody!


My name is Balu Major from Hungary, Budapest.
I play Freestyle Frisbee and I am European and World Freestyle Frisbee
Champion.
About this sport:
Freestyle frisbee players use the nail delay to set up all kinds of frisbee
tricks - you will see in my video - like rolls, brushes, tips, pulls, and
catches, but many of these maneuvers can be introduced into basic catch and
throw. 
Anyone can learn how to freestyle and it can be done anywhere, for example in
Budapest! Freestyle frisbee has expanded all across the world. 
Learn how to play and help us spread the jam!
Over the past few years I have been chasing a dream. The World Championship
in USA IN NEW YORK CITY!

This
journey started from my early experiences as 15 year old freestyler. Throughout
this adventure I have been able to travel all around the country, in Europe and
have been very fortunate to compete against some of the best players in the
world.I have had the great fortune to have many supportive friends and family,
teammates who helped make this opportunity possible, and i couldn't be more
thankful for them for this.But now, this is about something else. This is about
making the impossible possible, trying to conquer the world title.
As you can imagine the high cost of high performance training in Europe and
other centers of the world along with( food, travel,,registration,
accomodation), supplements and of course the tournament itself will certainly
create a large financial burden on all of the loved ones who have helped me so
far. As such, i'd very much appreciate any help from outsiders, any donation
given by you will make me one step closer to my dream!
Thank you very much!

Balu Major

story:
Problem

Approximately 15,000 people are currently incarcerated in New Jersey[1] – nearly 1000 in Middlesex County[2]. This year alone over 10,000 people will be released from New Jersey correctional facilities[3]. Without assistance, statistics show that 68% will be re-incarcerated within three years of their release[4].  And within 5 years of release, 84.1% of individuals who were age 24 or younger at release will be re- arrested[5].

We cannot forget that people who are incarcerated are brothers, sisters, mothers, fathers, sons and daughters. Incarceration isolates people from these vital relationships and disintegrates family and community structure, meaning individuals are often transitioning back into unstable or difficult situations.

NeighborCorps Re-Entry Services wants to change this dismal reality, starting in Middlesex County.

How NeighborCorps Re-Entry Services is Helping

Re-building relationships and connecting people post-release to people and services that can help and support them is vital to breaking the cycle of incarceration. Studies show that mentorship, rebuilding relationships, and successes in educational and employment experiences are transformational. Individuals in post-release mentorship programs are 39% less likely to become re-incarcerated and two times as likely to find employment while enrolled in a mentorship program[6]. This is what NeighborCorps does.

NeighborCorps bridges the often seemingly-insurmountable gap between release and successful reintegration into society by partnering with released individuals and supportive community members to walk the rocky road of re-entry together.  Each participant receives a dedicated mentorship team of three volunteer Navigators to create goal-centered action plans that address common barriers to successful re-entry, such as employment, housing, education and vocational training, mental health and substance abuse treatment, and repairing broken relationships.

Join Us

Please help NeighborCorps provide vital support and mentorship to people recently released in Middlesex County. County funding represents only a portion of NeighborCorps annual operating budget. While we receive many in-kind donations such as office space and Wi-Fi, NeighborCorps relies on the generosity of people like you to bring high-quality, research-based programming to people in our community.

Donate today! Your one-time, tax deductible donation or monthly contribution will be put into action:

·  A $35 donation will fund NeighborCorps phone service for one month;

·  $85 will cover printing costs for one month;

·  $200 will fund staff and volunteer transportation to the jail and to mentoring sessions in the community for 2 months;

·  $500 will help fund salary for our talented and dedicated staff;

·  $1000 will cover the costs associated with volunteer training and community outreach for the year;

·  $2000 will purchase a much-needed office computer and printer for program staff.

NeighborCorps Re-Entry Services is a program of Churches Improving Communities (CIC), a non-profit community development corporation that supports service and advocacy programs such as, food pantries and soup kitchens, temporary and permanent housing for the homeless, assistance to immigrants and the formerly incarcerated, ESL classes, disaster relief, and programs to assist seniors and youth. All CIC projects are non-religious, non-discriminatory, and are open to the public. Learn more at www.improvingnj.org .


[1]https://www.drugpolicy.org/sites/default/files/New_Jersey_Jail_Population_Analysis_March_2013.pdf

[2] http://www.co.middlesex.nj.us/Government/Departments/PSH/Pages/adultcorrections_home.aspx

[3] https://www.drugpolicy.org/sites/default/files/New_Jersey_Jail_Population_Analysis_March_2013.pdf

[4] http://www.nij.gov/topics/corrections/recidivism/pages/welcome.aspx

[5] http://www.bjs.gov/index.cfm?ty=pbdetail&iid=4986

[6] A 2007 report by the U.S. Department of Labor, Mentoring Ex-Prisoners: A Guide for Prisoner Reentry Programs

story:
My name is Patrick Joyce, I'm a father of three, an inventor, and I have MND/ALS.

The eyedrivomatic project aims to give independent mobility back to electric wheelchair users who thought they had lost it forever. A combination of software and hardware, eyedrivomatic allows users to control their wheelchairs using only their eyes. It is an entirely open project, meaning that all the plans and software will be available free online, for anyone to use - the idea being, that a non technical person, without special skills or tools, could build one themselves for under £100. Eyedrivomatic is now at the working prototype stage. It works really well - but could be so much better. It has been funded thus far by myself, but now I'm looking for funding to take it to the next stage.

Where will your money go?

This whole project is not for profit, and all the team members are unpaid volunteers. The money will mostly go on 3d printing supplies and electronic parts. Both the hardware and the eyegaze reliability need improving, which will use a lot of 3d printing plastic. Also, we want to make four more eyedrivomatic prototypes, so we can enlist four more MND sufferers as product testers. When the prototypes are as good as they can be, we will publish everything online. At that point we will need to publicise the project – because eyedrivomatic can't help anybody if they don't know it's available. To prepare for this, we want to get eyedrivomatic t-shirts made for the team members to wear for appearing in promotional videos.

How it all began...

I was hit with the initial idea in 2013, and am leading the project. I have an electric wheelchair, and an eyegaze system for controlling my computer, both provided by the NHS. Eyegaze technology is only intended for operating a computer and communicating, not for driving the chair. So when you lose the use of your hands, you are expected to rely on carers if you want to move anywhere. I found that idea extremely dispiriting, and resolved to do something about it.

As I don't actually own either the wheelchair or the eyegaze equipment, my solution was to make something that would interface with the wheelchair mounted computer and physically move the wheelchair's joystick. Crucially this would mean not making any modifications to the loaned hardware, and could work with any wheelchair and eyegaze combination.

The eyedrivomatic system is made up of two parts, an 'electronic hand' which fits over the wheelchairs joystick, and a 'brain box' containing the electronic workings. The brain box receives it's instructions from software on the pc - which the user controls with their eyes. The brain box then talks to the electronic hand, which has two servo motors that physically move the joystick.

To really make a difference, it needs to be cheap, and fairly easy for people to construct themselves. In an ideal world it will end up as an inexpensive manufactured product as well, something we aim to pursue later on. I also want to investigate the possibility of using a web cam to track eye movement for people without access to eyegaze.

Eyedrivomatic has the potential to help thousands of people at a bleak period in their lives. And it's not just MND/ALS sufferers either. Any quadriplegic with control of their eyes would benefit. With adequate funding we can perfect eyedrivomatic within a couple of months and get it out to the people who need it. Any money raised over our target will go to improving the system further and providing eyedrivomatic systems to people in need. Please help us.

We are also interested to hear from any disabled eyegaze users who would like to get involved with the project. If you would like to get an eyedrivomatic system, or just want to help, then let us know. People with 3d printers or programming skills would be particularly welcomed.
