story:
Sovereign Remedies above all is hospitality.  It is comfort. It is nostalgic yet new.  It is an honest product for an honest price.  It is for the love of the craft and for the love of gathering friends. It is neither stuffy nor slack but respectful.  It marries the past with the present, the country with the city.  It is local artists and local food.  It is a place for travelers to rest, for the young to explore, for the old to share the past, for the lovers to love, and for the imbibers to drink in, and for all to celebrate life.

It is a sun filled café, a botanical rich craft cocktail bar, a place of curious learning, and Community Supported Agriculture all in one room. It is what you get when a bartender, a baker and a farmer find the perfect space in downtown Asheville NC.

RSA?

Working with Patchworks Urban Farms, we kick off Asheville’s first “Restaurant Supported Agriculture” program.  An RSA is a pledge to share the risks and uncertainties of farming, and commits to design a menu based on truly supporting responsible farming practices.  Our strategy is to allow the farmer full reign in creating food systems based on the needs of the land, soil, and water, rather than requiring the farmer to sacrifice "good farming" for the current market demands.   This means our menu will really express the current happenings on the farm along with the old-time methods of "hedging our bets" by preserving, fermenting, curing, and freezing in times of surplus.

What we have achieved so far:

We have found the perfect space in the growing city of Asheville and signed a lease.  We have worked with some very talented local artists to design and build all of our furniture (we're half way done!).  We have driven over a thousand miles during the past few months to purchase the lion share of our equipment from restaurant auctions and Craigslist ads.  And we have been pickling, freezing and drying the early bounties of the farm to prepare for this fall! Every day we get a little closer.

Why contribute some of your hard earned money?

Not only do you help us launch our dream, your contribution is PAID FORWARD!  Yes! For every dollar we raise to make this beautiful space we will in turn over the next 5 years, pay-forward the value of this campaign by sharing our space, our talents and our products to help other groups and individuals in need.  As a contributor, you are invited to follow our blog and see all this at work.   

Why help us?

By contributing to the campaign, you will help:

-  Build this vision of hospitality, fine beverages, locally built furniture, and  conscious food.

-  Create a truly meaningful connection between farms and restaurants that takes into account all the risks, uncertainties, and variability of growing food while practicing truly sustainable farming practices.

-  Re-connect the act of drinking with the deep roots of plants, herbs, artisans, and history; while bringing back to life the restorative properties of the ingredients in spirits, broths, wines, coffees, and teas.

-  Create a resource that will in turn support local businesses, non-profits and charities through our pay-it-forward policy, and educational outreach efforts.

We have worked the front lines of the hospitality business for years and have helped many people find success in creating and managing their businesses.  We now have the opportunity to create our very own vision of perfection, one that we can build with our craft, conscience, and our community as the driving force.  Small business loans are hard to come by these days, especially in the category of restaurants while the number one reason restaurants fail is due to the lack of opening capital.

Our family has shown so much support in helping us succeed with this vision. They've provided enough startup capital through investments and personal loans to make this a reality and we ask for your help in raising the last bit of funds to get us there!

We just need this kick start to get the gears in gogo motion and we will be able to do all these things!

Why you can believe in us….

Charlie has worked in the bar biz throughout  the past 20 years, starting as a way to support a career in dance and then falling in love with the craft of making a perfect cocktail consisting of well sourced ingredients.  After opening a successful nightclub with two friends in Portland Oregon, he worked at opening 7 more programs through his 8-year stay, including the Clyde Common in the Ace Hotel (listed in David Wonderich’s “Best Bars”).  Followed by the Amigo Room in the Palm Springs Ace Hotel featured in Detail Magazine’s Top Ten Hotel Bars in the world. Sovereign Remedies is a way to combine many years of creating/running successful programs with a true passion for the history and craft of making incredible drinks.

Leah has spent the past decade working in almost every facet of the “service industry”. From doula work to kitchen work Leah has made working with people and for the betterment of people an extremely fulfilling career path. Born and raised in Asheville North Carolina, a sense of adventure and desperation led her to the weird wild world of the Netherlands, where---for the love of cooking, fine Dutch tulips and a surly Dutch gentleman---Leah found herself working under the tutelage of Italian chef, restaurateur and power house Margarita Rossi. For the better part of the 2000’s Leah called both Utrecht, the Netherlands and Boston, Massachusetts her home and during this time soaked up as much local food and culture as humanly possible. When the call of the Appalachian Mountains became too strong and the migration home began Leah would start the process of marrying all the wonderful traditions she had picked up along the way.

Sunil is a farmer, permaculturist, and an avid cook, cheese maker, and baker. Having studied cultural anthropology, he traveled extensively through Asia and spent three years as an English teacher in Japanese schools. Back in the states, he studied natural farming methods and worked for farmers in California, West Virginia, New Jersey, and Oregon. Sunil has collected many skills from growing 4-season biodynamic vegetables, to managing a grass-fed dairy herd, making artisanal raw milk cheese, baking for production in a commercial wood-fired oven, natural building, and helping maintain permaculture sites. Hailing from Pennsylvania, he managed a large CSA there for 4 years. In that time, the farm expanded a quarter acre plot to a 12-acre working farm. In January 2013, he relocated to Asheville to be site manager and coordinate the launch of the Urban Farm School at the Ashevillage Institute.  This year Sunil has launched Patchwork Urban Farms, a multi-plot farm in Asheville. 

What you are helping to fund.

Our total budget is:

 $43,000 Construction

 $34,000 Equipment

 $19,000 Décor

 $28,000 Opening operations and supplies

 $124,000

And through savings and family loans we have raised:

 $101,000 

Leaving us with only $23,000 to reach our budget!

Your contribution will give us what is needed to get us open, but we deeply believe in a sharing economy and we'll hook you up with some awesome perks:

$10 Thanks for being a friend.  An enthusiastic high-five and your name on our wall of friends and website.  Updates on our RSA program. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$35 Be in the know.

Receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes.  And updates on our RSA program.

Your name on our wall of friends and our website. Updates on our RSA program.

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$45 Dress up your drinks at home.  

4 leather Sovereign Remedies coasters. 

You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward

$75 Remedies for your home.

A Sovereign Remedies Handcrafted Tonic Set, a sample of four.

4oz bottle of the Spring Sarsaparilla Tonic,4oz bottle of the Summer Gentian tonic, 4oz  bottle of the Fall Apple Tonic and 4oz bottle of the Winter Spiced Tonic (enough to make 36 drinks). In a beautiful package for pick up at the bar or shipped to our friends afar.

You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward!

$80 Friend from the start.

Tickets to our Grand opening VIP Cocktail party for you and a guest. 

 

You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$100 Invested Friend.

Get 4, $25 gift certificates for yourself or friends -- one for each season. 

You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$150 SR apparel.

Limited edition wax cotton Sovereign Remedies apron. 

 You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$225 Where everybody knows your name.

Your name on one of our barstools.  Be forever honored as a founding friend!  You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$333 Become a Star-tender!  

1. Get a crash course in the craft of cocktail with Charlie.

2. Collaborate on a menu for your very own "Star-tender" shift behind the bar at Sovereign Remedies. 

3. Plus an employee discount for the entire of week your shift!

You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$500 Custom Hand Crafted Bar Stools.

A sneak peak at the prototype (the back brace will be of Brazilian Walnut!)

Set of two beautiful hand made bar stools.  Locally designed and crafted by Par and Iron Maiden Studios. You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$1,000 The entertainer!

Private Cocktail Party for you and 25 friends.  OR treat your favorite Asheville group, organization, or company to a party!  Hors d'oeuvres and drinks specially created for you and your guests.  You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

$5,000 Your own seat at the bar.

Always have a seat at the bar.  We'll make a special stool with your name on it, stored away for your visit.  And receive an employee discount for life!  You receive a yearly digital book of some of our favorite cocktail and food recipes, And updates on our RSA program. Your name on our wall of friends and our website. 

***And know that your gift will be paid forward! 

https://mountainx.com/food/sovereign-remedies/

http://www.citizen-times.com/story/entertainment/dining/2014/05/14/new-asheville-bar-will-go-seed-glass/9084339/

A special thanks to Parker Reid for the many hours in creating the video.

And to Benjamin Bruckman for sharing his thoughts and equipment.

And to Matt and Drew at The Bull and Beggar (for many reasons).

Music by Screen House Music http://screenhousemusic.bandcamp.com

story:
Money in Politics

What WE THE PEOPLE Can Do About It

Everyone knows that special interests have far too much influence over lawmakers. Since those elected in a corrupt system are unlikely to reform themselves, the question becomes what can people outside the system do to effectively address a problem that impacts so many aspects of our lives?

Just complaining about it, paying no attention to it or circulating online petitions that have little chance of being enacted will not solve this problem.

It is time for some fresh thinking on political reform

We are developing an exciting new two-step approach to reform. First, we're making it much easier for voters to see the identities of the biggest contributors to the candidates and ballot measures they'll be voting on.

The Supreme Court has made it clear that they will not permit any meaningful restrictions on campaign contributions, and so revealing the sources of those contributions to voters is now more important than ever.

We’ve also begun construction on an online grid to connect candidates and voters everywhere, for free. Having a no-cost platform for candidates to reach  an unlimited number of voters will enable more citizens who are not wealthy or indebted to special interests, to run for office.


Phase One – Making It Easy to See Who Is Contributing to Whom

Currently, it is much too difficult for voters to see who is financing political campaigns. Finding this data requires accessing multiple or difficult-to-use government websites, or utilizing search engines more appropriate for journalistic or academic research.

Most voters have busy lives and simply do not have the time to conduct such research, and so we’re making it easy to see this vital information.

We’re extracting useful data from cumbersome government websites and other online resources that track campaign contributions, which few voters know about or would have the time to consult even if they did.

We’ll collate, combine, and summarize this data in user-friendly ways that are easy to understand.


Just by entering their zip code, voters will be able to quickly see the following information for each candidate and ballot measure we cover.

  • Listings of their top 20 contributors
  • Highlighting the top 20 contributors
  • Contributions sorted by size
  • Contributions sorted by source (Individuals, Political Action Committees, Political Parties, and Independent Expenditures)

Phase Two – Connecting Candidates and Voters at No Cost

High campaign costs leave candidates dependent on special-interest contributions. One of the largest expenses is advertising, but only because there is no single website where candidates know they can reach most voters. Nor is there a site where voters can hear directly from the candidates they’ll be voting on.

NextGenElect will fill this void by becoming the nation's first "Election Supersite", connecting voters and candidates, at no cost to either.

We'll invite every candidate on the ballot for the races we cover to tell voters about themselves by way of a video statement.

All in one place, voters will be able to watch these video statements, see who is financing the candidates' campaigns, and view their ratings from diverse groups.

We’ll make similar information available for both the proponents and opponents of ballot measures.

What you won’t find on NextGenElect is any partisanship or bias. We will NOT endorse any individual candidate, political party, or ideology.


When, Where, and How We'll Do It

We'll begin Phase One this fall in California by providing the campaign finance data on candidates for all statewide races, for both the proponents and opponents of all statewide ballot measures, and for the candidates for all state legislative offices. 

For future elections, we'll provide this data on candidates for federal offices, local races (whenever that information is available), and for candidates and ballot  measures in other states.

Phase Two, the free online platform for candidates will be ready for use in the 2016 elections, when the nation will elect a new president. We'll again begin in California and expand coverage to other states as quickly as resources permit. 

The goal is to build a nationwide online infrastructure that makes this information available for every candidate and ballot measure in the country.

Our extensive marketing will raise the public profile of all participating campaigns, thus reducing the need for them to raise large amounts of individual contributions or to depend on spending from outside groups and SuperPacs. 

Further, the NextGenElect concept of creating a level online political playing field is by no means limited to the United States. It can be exported and will work well in other countries, particularly those with emerging democracies.

 

Have We Done This Before?

Yes we have and on some good-sized stages. From 2006 – 2010, we developed and ran a predecessor program based on the same concepts called NextGenPolitics. It was used primarily by ABC-TV network-owned stations in California.

Watch the brief 2006 debut video introduction of NextGenPolitics for ABC7-TV, San Francisco.


Click here to learn more about NextGenPolitics.

The program was popular with voters and candidates, particularly those who were lesser-known and did not have the financial resources to pay for expensive paid advertisements.

We learned a lot from that experience and are ready to take this no-cost way of connecting candidates and voters to the next level.


Have You Created Any Other Innovative Applications?

Yes! Our team at NextGenElect has a track record of innovation. One example is our trailblazing work in professional baseball using digital video and predictive statistical analysis (Watch the ESPN SportsCenter Story below.)


We've done it off the field too. When most pollsters conducted exit polls and crowd research using clipboards and paper surveys, we led the way in using tablets, long before iPads had even been invented. (Watch this fun ABC7-TV news story about the Great Mustard Poll for the San Francisco Giants.)


We have been an industry leader in conducting reliable online research, and incorporating video and other media into the online survey process.


How Your Contribution Will Be Put To Work

The funds raised will be used to:

  • Build the web infrastructure
  • Collect and collate the campaign finance data
  • Finance outreach efforts to make voters aware of the website

The initial amount of funding sought is the minimum we feel is necessary to provide coverage of the California election contests and ballot measures we described for this November's General Election.

Raising additional funds will allow us to accelerate and broaden our outreach efforts to introduce voters and candidates to NextGenElect, and expand its coverage more quickly.


Additional Revenue Sources

We see several sources of revenue to support further development of the website, expand its coverage, and cover operating expenses in future years:

  • Sponsorships and grants
  • Donations from individuals
  • Advertising revenue
  • Fees paid by news organizations who use our resources
To maximize our reach, we would like to work with as many news organizations as possible, even at little or no cost, if we can raise sufficient funds elsewhere.

NextGenElect will be a lean operation. We’ll use great programmers and other professionals that we’ve worked with before, and recruit new talent willing to work at patriotic rates or on a volunteer basis.

Our commitment to building a useful election resource will endure even if we don't reach our funding goal. We have a backup plan to reduce or phase in some features and/or cutback in certain areas, if necessary.


What's in it For Contributors?

We have some fun perks but the biggest thing most people will get out of contributing to NextGenElect is the satisfaction of knowing they are helping to enact meaningful change in America.

Even those who can’t help financially can still make a valuable contribution by helping us get the word out about NextGenElect via Indiegogo's Share Tools, social networking, or just plain word of mouth.

NextGenElect will demonstrate what crowdsourcing can accomplish by bringing an innovative idea to fruition and driving its ultimate success!


Getting the Word Out

While our goals are noble, we are realistic about the sustained and creative effort it will take to attract and engage a large audience.

Beyond our sharing and networking plans, we'll promote NextGenElect in many other ways including:

  • Enlisting news organizations to use and credit our resources
  • Gaining free publicity from news stories and public appearances we will shamelessly solicit
  • Developing catchy promotional spots and asking ad agencies, public relations and production companies to help us at little or no cost
  • Creating and continually updating a music video with new segments we add from submissions by users and, occasionally, celebrities (you never know who might show up in the next version).

We'll work hard to establish footholds in several key vertical markets.

One group we really want to engage is younger people, and one way we'll do this is through campus newspapers. Many universities also run programs that emphasize the importance of voting and being engaged in civic affairs.

NextGenElect will be a great resource to share with students and teachers, groups who can also help spread the word and be a source for volunteers.

To further diversify and increase our user base, we'll also reach out to get non-English language news organizations to use NextGenElect. The site will be translated into as many languages as demand and resources permit. 


Measuring Success

We’re confident that NextGenElect will be a success!

Initially, just having an unbiased and informative election resource will clearly benefit voters who use it.

After that, as we generate increased web traffic, success will build on itself and attract even more users. Once that critical mass is achieved, candidates who do not participate in NextGenElect will do so at their own political peril.

If candidates who would not have run for office because of fundraising demands decide to take the plunge because of the free exposure NextGenElect will provide, we will be doing the job we envision.

And if even one candidate eschews traditional fundraising for the benefits NextGenElect offers and that candidate is elected, we think the political floodgates will open and others will take the same approach.

Perhaps the greatest impact NextGenElect can have is transforming prolific fundraising from a political strength into a political liability by providing more transparency.

Future Features

We want to expand the capabilities of NextGenElect that will benefit voters both at election time and year-round.

We'll provide to links to government websites that will allow users to register to vote, request an absentee ballot, or conduct other election activities.

We will also provide links and content to help prospective candidates take the necessary steps to run for public office.

Other election-oriented resources we plan to develop include online debates between candidates or between the proponents and opponents of ballot measures, as well as candidate forums in which voters can participate.

We will also develop online educational content to help people improve their basic knowledge of our political system and how they can most effectively impact it.

We'll try fun quizzes, contests, or anything else that can help voters become better informed and more engaged in civic affairs.

Wrapping Up

Yes, many people don’t pay attention to news about politics, and some don't even bother to vote because they feel helpless about a dysfunctional system that doesn't represent their interests.

But if enough of us are willing to invest even a very modest amount of our time and energy (and a few bucks), we can make our democracy more vibrant and functional. And NextGenElect will prove how crowdsourcing can be used to address even seemingly intractable problems.

Let's be clear; our success is not predicated on expectations of some great renaissance of civic engagement in the United States. Most Americans simply have other interests and are not wired that way.

But there is a broad consensus that something needs to be done to elect representatives who are more concerned with the public interest than special interests. This intense public desire for greater political integrity creates the perfect environment for NextGenElect to take off and thrive.

We hope you'll agree and will support our efforts to revitalize our democracy. Together we can bring about great change. Thank you!


Meet Our Team

More lunch pail than flashy, we are a committed group of professionals who care deeply about our country and believe there is something we the people can do to help make government more responsive to its citizens.

We are very experienced in voter engagement and have deep backgrounds in software development, public opinion polling, teaching, journalism, marketing and communications.

We have the skills, experience and passion to make this happen!


Richard Hertz - Team Leader

Richard has been developing voter-engagement and other software applications, as well as conducting polls for news organizations, public agencies, non-profits, and business clients for over 30 years.

An expert in voter behavior who has conduced hundreds of original surveys on public policy issues, he also practices his voter engagement skills part-time as a Lecturer in Political Science at Sonoma State University.  


Karl Scheff - Database Master

Karl is a database expert with decades of experience working with large, complex databases spending much of that time as an education research and evaluation consultant with the California Department of Education.

He is particularly adept at unraveling chaotic or poorly documented databases, merging data from multiple sources, and presenting complex or voluminous information in ways that are easy to understand.


Donald Dixon - Educator/Evaluation Specialist

Don is a Professor Emeritus of Political Science at Sonoma State University. He is also a well-respected educational consultant who has worked with top-level management at the California Department of Education, the California Schools Boards Association, and other entities.

As both a teacher and education evaluation expert, Don brings a wealth of experience at presenting content about politics and elections (not everyone's favorite subjects) in unbiased and informative ways.


William Endicott - Journalsm Advisor

Bill has held key editorial and reporting positions with the Los Angeles Times and the Sacramento Bee where he served as Capitol Bureau Chief and Deputy Managing Editor.

As a veteran political journalist, he provides an invaluable perspective on how to present information about politics and elections in a fair and engaging manner.


Jack Wiens - Artist in Residence

Jack is an accomplished artist who has worked in publishing, freelancing, and who has exhibited in many galleries and shows. He is also a professional counselor with over 30 years of experience in private practice.

His illustrations are an important part of our strategy to present serious content in entertaining ways. Jack's drawings are literally worth a thousand words, which most people appreciate not having to read.  


Karen Ragan-George - Marketing Muse

Karen is an extraordinary marketing person who knows how to reach diverse audiences, a skill she honed in key roles at Warner Brothers Entertainment.

Her ability to connect with people of all age groups and backgrounds will serve us well in building a large, broad-based audience.


David R. Ragan-George - Wordsmith

David is an accomplished professional author. He has authored many projects for the "Star Trek" franchise, including a television story and more than a dozen novels. 

His writing and editing talents are extremely helpful in transforming our ideas into clear, engaging prose. He is also a talented programmer, whose skills and knowledge are helpful for our technical needs.


Mike Weir - Business Advisor

Mike is a long-time sales and marketing executive with Hewlett-Packard. As the head of marketing for multi-billion dollar divisions at HP, he is used to thinking big and working in international markets.

His business acumen and worldwide marketing experience will help ensure that NextGenElect achieves its great potential both in the U.S. and abroad.


Fred Golden - Financial Advisor

Fred is a CPA and business development expert who has helped many start-ups and large businesses manage their financial affairs.

His assistance with creating a workable financial model and business plan will help make certain that NextGenElect is set up and run in a sustainable way.


Doug Greenwood - Front End System Specialist

Doug is a multi-talented system designer and integrator. He specializes in creating intuitive user interfaces that are easy to navigate.

His Alpen Software company provides creative IT business solutions for businesses ranging in size from non-profits to Fortune 500 companies.


Igor Zlimen - Back End System Specialist

Igor is an outstanding programmer and software designer. He specializes in creating database systems that deal with large quantities of dynamic data.

A PhD in Nuclear Physics, he looks at numbers a little differently than the rest of us and creates applications that are unusually efficient.

Money in PoliticsWhat WE THE PEOPLE Can Do About It
Everyone knows that special interests have far too much influence over lawmakers. Since those elected in a corrupt system are unlikely to
reform themselves, the question becomes what can people outside the system do to effectively address a problem that impacts so many aspects of our lives? 
Just complaining about it, paying no attention to it or circulating online petitions that have little chance of being enacted will not solve this problem.It is time for some fresh thinking on
political reformWe are developing an exciting new two-step approach to reform. story: Hello! I'm trying to raise money to pay for a house. The house is for BenBen, a friend of mine and also a local Philippino YPDR worker. The house will be an upgrade from a shelterbox tent! We are hoping to order materials and start building next week and it should take about a week to complete. Thanks to everyone for donating and making a real difference to my friends lives. Cheers!
story_txt: Hello! I'm trying to raise money to pay for a house. The house is for BenBen, a friend of mine and also a local Philippino YPDR worker. The house will be an upgrade from a shelterbox tent! We are hoping to order materials and start building next week and it should take about a week to complete. Thanks to everyone for donating and making a real difference to my friends lives. Cheers!

story:
UPDATE

I have been matched to my first choice! I will be working with an organization called Marang House that accomodates underprivileged children with chronic illnesses and provides them with an environment for recovery that is unmatched in local hospitals. They are currently in financial distress and need short and long-term strategies to get them out this dire situation. I will be working with a fellow NexGen MBA student on finding ways to save the organization from bankruptcy and keeping it afloat. Even though the task seems daunting, I feel extremely privileged to be chosen for this project. I am looking forward to meeting Pieter Ernest patron of the house, the Marang board of directors and staff, and most importantly the kids for whom this organization was created.

A Short Autobiography

During my third year of undergraduate studies I heard a talk that changed the trajectory of my life for the 9 years to come. The talk was on ‘Tissue Engineering’, a field concerned with creating living tissues in the lab using the patients’ own cells in order to replace diseased or malfunctioning tissues. I knew right away that this was the future of medicine. Patients will no longer have to wait for months or years to get an organ transplant, but will get one that is uniquely theirs, within a matter of weeks. I was so intrigued by this field that I went on to do my Masters and PhD (McGill University) in Biomedical Engineering with focus on engineering cardiovascular and neural tissue. I published 7 research papers, filed 2 US patents, presented in 10 conferences, and received 12 awards. You can check out this link to learn more about my PhD research in just 3 minutes (I am the last speaker).

I am also an entrepreneur with a passion for teaching and mentoring. I believe that personal growth is essential to academic success. With 11 years of mentoring and 8 years of tutoring experience under my belt, I started Pioneers Tutoring in 2012 to provide a unique approach to tutoring using mentoring principles.

Just as the tissue engineering talk had an impact on my career trajectory, being introduced to emzingo and learning about their vision for the future of social consulting and leadership development is about to do the same. I was recently accepted as a NeXGen Fellow to South Africa in order to provide consulting for a social impact project. This opportunity will allow me to utilize the problem solving and analytical skills I have developed during my graduate studies to provide unique and feasible solutions concerning a social issue. I have not been assigned a project yet, but it will be either in the education or healthcare space; two areas I am very passionate about.



I am also very passionate about helping others and giving back to society. In the collage shown at the beginning are pictures of me at camp with intellectually disabled and deaf youth from the garbage village in Cairo, Egypt. That experience taught me that compassion has the power to heal and restore.

I have been a change-maker in the fields of science, education and philanthropy, and now I would like be change-maker in the social impact space. With your help that can be possible.

Financial Situation

Since I just completed my PhD at McGill, I have almost no sources of income at the moment. The Kullberg Foundation generously offered me a scholarship of $2000 to cover half the program fees, which are $3950 in total. I was also given $1950 as a gift from my family to cover the remaining program fees. However, I still need money to pay for my plane ticket from Montreal to Johannesburg (~ $2000 - $2500) and for food/drink/other essentials in Johannesburg (~$2000 for 2 months).

In total, I will need $4500 to be able to go to South Africa.

Ways to Help

Of course, you can help me financially which I will be very grateful for. However, I will also be very glad if you can help me out by spreading the word about this campaign and sharing it with family and friends. Thank you so much!

During my third year of undergraduate studies I heard a talk that
changed the trajectory of my life for the 9 years to come. The talk was on ‘Tissue
Engineering’, a field concerned with creating living tissues in the lab using
the patients’ own cells in order to replace diseased or malfunctioning tissues.
I knew right away that this was the future of medicine. Patients will no longer
have to wait for months or years to get an organ transplant, but will get one
that is uniquely theirs, within a matter of weeks. I was so intrigued by this
field that I went on to do my Masters and PhD  (McGill University) in Biomedical
Engineering with focus on engineering cardiovascular and neural tissue. I
published 7 research papers, filed 2 US patents, presented in 10 conferences,
and received 12 awards. You can check out this link  to learn more about my PhD
research in just 3 minutes (I am the last speaker). 
I am also an entrepreneur with a passion for teaching and mentoring. I
believe that personal growth is essential to academic success. With 11 years of
mentoring and 8 years of tutoring experience under my belt, I started Pioneers Tutoring in 2012 to provide a unique approach to tutoring using mentoring
principles. 
Just as the tissue engineering talk had an impact on my career trajectory,
being introduced to emzingo and learning about their vision for the future of
social consulting and leadership development is about to do the same. I was
recently accepted as a NeXGen Fellow to South Africa in order to provide
consulting for a social impact project. This opportunity will allow me to utilize
the problem solving and analytical skills I have developed during my graduate
studies to provide unique and feasible solutions concerning a social issue. I
have not been assigned a project yet, but it will be either in the education or
healthcare space; two areas I am very passionate about. 
I am also very passionate about helping others and giving back to society. In the collage shown at the beginning are pictures of me at camp with intellectually disabled and deaf youth from the garbage village in Cairo, Egypt. That experience taught me that compassion has the power to heal and restore.I have been a change-maker in the fields of science, education and philanthropy, and
now I would like be change-maker in the social
impact space. With your help that can be possible.
Financial Situation
Since I just completed my PhD at McGill, I have almost no sources of
income at the moment. The Kullberg Foundation generously offered me a scholarship
of $2000 to cover half the program fees, which are $3950 in total. I was also
given $1950 as a gift from my family to cover the remaining program fees. However, I
still need money to pay for my plane ticket from Montreal to Johannesburg (~
$2000 - $2500) and for food/drink/other essentials in Johannesburg (~$2000 for
2 months).
In total, I will need $4500 to be able to go to South Africa.
Ways to Help
Of course, you can help me financially which I will be very grateful
for. However, I will also be very glad if you can help me out by spreading the word
about this campaign and sharing it with family and friends. Thank you so much!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Christina Lehman and I am a student at Kalamazoo College working under Deborah Droppers at The Kalamazoo Experiential Learning Center to create a winter festival event at the Arcadia Creek Festival Place. As you know, the Arcadia Creek Festival Place is a very popular summer festival site that hosts Rib Fest, Blue’s Fest, and many other summer festivals. In the winter, however, the venue does not host many events. 

This disc golf event is unique because it is in the winter and reaches out to students looking for something free and fun downtown to do with their friends. When we held a similar event last fall we heard that students would love to play in the winter. Additionally, we have also heard that more passive programming downtown will help to build everyday traffic.

The Kalamazoo Experiential Learning Center is a 501(c) nonprofit organization where college interns work as consulting team members working within the community to provide place-making events, festivals, and fundraising events. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for a total of $550 to cover the costs of our event.

  • $350 is needed for renting Arcadia Creek Festival Place on the day of the event
  • $150 for the assembly of disc golf baskets 
  • $250 to compensate the college interns who are learning how to manage community events. for more information check out experientiallearningcenter.org
We feel that this investment is a smart place to put money because of the value will add to the downtown community. Our goal is to attract people to downtown and to build vibrancy, even in the winter months. 
We feel confident that we will reach our goal. However, if our goal is not met,  we will continue to ask for donations at the event so that we build a culture of supporting events that create community and passive use of public spaces downtown.

The Impact

This event will continue to increase the flow of traffic in downtown Kalamazoo in the winter months. An additional purpose of this event is to gauge the interest of the Kalamazoo community for outdoor winter events. Our goal is to have more interactive winter events at the Arcadia Creek Festival Place.
We held a similar disc golf event in the fall that had great success. Some of the feedback from the participants was to host a similar event in the winter. To meet these demands, we are excited to host this winter event. However, the funds are needed for the event rental and expenses. 
The Kalamazoo Experiential Learning Center is a learning environment and is involved in many events that will create placemaking opportunities for Kalamazoo.  The Urban Disc Golf event is one of many events that will provide excitement and interaction with our public spaces.   

Risks & Challenges

This is an event that is being run on a "shoestring" budget and we want to prove that it doesn't take a lot of money to host a great event.  But, this is an event that is run on minimal expenses.  For example, we would love to have a warming tent, heaters, and free hot chocolate.   But, do "real" disc golfers need it? 
Weather may also be an issue. In the event of severe weather we will reschedule. In the event of light to moderate weather there is a covered pavilion.  

Other Ways You Can Help

For more information about the event, please see our Facebook page at facebook.com/winterdiscgolf. 

For information on volunteering at the event, please see the Experiential Learning Center website at experientiallearningcenter.org. 

Thank you for supporting our downtown community. We hope to see you there!

story:
Chimera Arts is a collaborative studio space, or “makerspace”, in Sebastopol, California. 

We are a diverse group of artists, makers and inventors who share a common desire to create, share and learn from each other.  We provide the space, equipment and expertise needed to bring ideas to life – as well as helping people connect with collaborators to that end.

We've been operating out of a 300 square foot trailer for the past year or so and have just secured a lease on a great new 3000 square foot space.  This move will allow us to welcome more members with more shop space for co-working and fabrication. It would also give us the capacity to expand our current programs and implement many more that have been contingent on space, including youth programs, classes and workshops, and community partnerships with schools and arts organizations.

The new space is a blank slate.

We need to do finishing work, like cabinetry and electrical, as well as get more equipment in place for member use.

Your contribution will be used to pay for materials and labor to:

  • Run electrical to equipment and work areas.
  • Build worktables, storage areas, and room dividers.
  • Obtain welding equipment.
  • Buy folding chairs and such for presentations and classes.
  • Buy necessary safety equipment.
  • Build walls to enclose the woodworking area.
  • Enclose an area of the parking lot for working outside.
  • Add soundproofing to work areas.

Your support for this campaign will help us keep our momentum going. 

The community response to our vision has been overwhelming. Within 9 months of opening our doors in December 2013, our membership alone supported our expenses. At this time we:

  • Have become a 501c3 non-profit with a diverse community-minded board of directors. 
  • Have almost 60 members of all ages, 5 of whom are scholarship members. 
  • Have hosted 120+ interest-based meetup events.
  • Currently average 2 to 4 free public meetups a week focused on everything from 3D printing to jewelry making. 
  • Have had well over 2,000 people come through our space in the past year.
Please help us get the word out.

If you can't help us financially with this campaign there are other ways you can contribute.  We would really appreciate if you would help us get the word out about this campaign.  Tell your friends about us using Facebook, Twitter or other social media platform.  You may also use the Share tools on this page.  

Thank You

Sonoma County is home to a rich diversity of artists, makers, programmers, builders and inventors. Creativity and innovation constantly improve our communities. Local artists and artisans beautify our towns and the exploration of new technologies and the Do It Yourself culture helps to keep Sonoma County on the cutting edge of everything from robotics to industrial art to environmental sustainability. Providing resources for these types of endeavors is what inspired the founding of our organization.  

We truly appreciate your generous support.

story:
Welcome home.

I'm Sam, avid reader, dog mom, and most recently, entrepreneur. Let me tell you why you're here. I'll start at the beginning.

Just a girl and her books

Blue House Books is the product of a lifelong passion for stories. Ever since I was a child, I was writing and reading. From infuriating my brother because I was reading while walking slowly home from elementary school, to staying in last weekend because I couldn't put a book down. 

My love for books never ceased. After an education and short career as a journalist, I turned my love of stories into a degree. I earned a Master of the Arts in Publishing from Oxford Brookes University, the U.K.'s number one publishing program. After moving back to the States, I decided to stay in Kenosha, but there were no job opportunities in my field. So I decided to make one.

I have more than 10 years of experience in customer service and have been working for more than a year in gaining buying and admin experience. I have learned a great deal from two years of running Blue House Books as a pop-up retailer, and I am also talking with other indie bookstore owners to help fill in my gaps in knowledge of opening a full brick-and-mortar store.

Here's what we need

I am trying to raise $3,000. Here's where that money will go:

  • $500 for fixtures and shelving
  • $1,000 for book inventory
  • $500 for other merchandise
  • $1,000 for other expenses, such as licenses and permits

If I do not reach the full goal of $3,000, I will still expand my inventory, but will be required to remain as a pop-up bookseller for now.

Of course I would never ask you to give your money away for nothing! You'll find several incentives as a thank you for your contribution. Rewards range from advertising for corporations and small businesses to free books and discounts for individual contributors.

More than just a bookstore

At Blue House Books, we want more than just to sell you a product; you can go to Amazon or Barnes and Noble for that. We want to give you a custom experience, complete with personal recommendations and rewards for our loyal customers. We will also offer something our competitors can't: human interaction, and not just between a bookseller and a customer, but between a group of people bonding over stories.

We have some big plans:

  • Monthly book clubs for adults and teens, weekly book clubs for children
  • Live entertainment
  • Connect with local teachers and students studying education to host literary programs

And this is just the beginning.

We're up to the challenge

Of course there is one big risk: the business could completely fail. Although I don't like to focus on the negatives, it's important to acknowledge that there are risks and challenges:

  • Competition: there's always the risk that competition will put a store out of business, especially with retailers like Amazon competing for consumers' attention.
  • Expenses: rent, utilities, inventory, payroll, the list goes on. Starting a business is expensive!
  • Customers: or sometimes, lack of. There are dozens of businesses competing for consumers attention everyday, most of which are not direct competition, but they still take away from time the customer could be spending at my shop.

​​But we have a plan:

  • We are in the midst of a renaissance: of physical books, of Main Street American, and of people eager to support local businesses. Studies show that ebook sales are stagnant, and physical book sales are growing. Barnes and Noble is closing stores more than they are opening, while the opposite is true for indie bookstores. Communities are ready to support indie bookstores, especially in the successful and expanding Downtown Kenosha community.
  • By opening Blue House Books in a shared space, my overhead costs will be extremely low, allowing me to save profits.
  • Quality is often better than quantity. By provide exceptional service to our loyal customers, we will have a regular cashflow and access to the most effective form of advertising: word of mouth. And to help expand our clientele, we will continue to participate in pop-up events and host our own variety of events.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need more than just monetary support. If you want to help in other ways, here's what you can do:

  • Share our IndieGoGo page
  • Share our events on social media: Facebook.com/bhbkenosha, Instagram.com/bhbkenosha
  • Interact with us on social media: active posts get the most attention
  • And of course, spread the word! Tell your friends and family what we're trying to do, contact local businesses or individuals that may be interested in contributing, and invite everyone to our upcoming events!

THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

Share our IndieGoGo page
Share our events on social media: Facebook.com/bhbkenosha, Instagram.com/bhbkenosha
Interact with us on social media: active posts get the most attention
And of course, spread the word! Tell your friends and family what we're trying to do, contact local businesses or individuals that may be interested in contributing, and invite everyone to our upcoming events!

THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Nu lanserar Svenska Brukarföreningen (SBF) en solidarisk crowdfunding-kampanj för att hjälpa utsatta brukare i krisområdet runt Syrien-området.

Vid internationella kriser, som den vi ser idag, drabbas alltid brukare extra hårt och kommer sist i prioriteringen av tillgångar som läkemedel, mat, och sovplats. Det vill vi ändra på.

Denna kampanj är specifikt riktad mot brukare i och omkring Syriens största städer, Aleppo, Damaskus, och Homs.

Likt andra hjälporganisationer är tanken att hjälpa människor på plats, men hjälpinsatsen beror helt och hållet på hur mycket pengar vi kan samla in.

Vi planerar att tillsammans med brukarrörelsen MENANPUD bidra ekonomiskt till redan existerande nätverk, som Röda korset och Läkare Utan Gränser, för att möjliggöra denna insats.

MENANPUD står för Middle East and North Africa Network of/for People who use Drugs och är en stödförening av aktivister med egen erfarenhet av droger från MENA-regionen, dvs Mellanöstern och Nordafrika.

Målet med insamlingskampanjen är att samla in så mycket pengar som möjligt för att solidariskt hjälpa utsatta människor som använder droger.


Mer om MENANPUD:

http://www.menahra.org/en/about-menanpud


Mer om SBF:

http://www.svenskabrukarforeningen.se/om

story:
Short Summary

G'day - Farmer Gregie here.

The Dairy Industry in Australia, and in many other places around the world, is on its knees. Fresh Milk has been devalued by large multinational companies to the point where some milk is cheaper to purchase than bottled water, despite costing a whole lot more to produce. There are examples of local dairy communities decimated, with farming families having to walk away from their farms, their homes and livelihoods.

Yet this has a wider impact on all of us - our food security. The future availability of locally produced fresh milk is in jeopardy. With fewer dairy farmers able to sustain a living, there will be less fresh milk produced. Some states in Australia are already importing enormous volumes of fresh milk to meet demand. 

I have to speak out about this! Dairy farming runs deep in my veins - the Dennis family have been dairy farming since the 1800's. Even my Nan grew up on her family farm before marrying a dairy farmer - and so did my Mum! We consider it a privilege to produce and supply farm gate fresh, minimally processed milk to consumers.

I'm just one farmer out to make a difference. Crazy? Maybe - but I'm going to put my heart and soul into this and I need your help.

Join me on a campaign to change consumer decisions back in favour of local, family owned dairy farms - and away from the multinationals. In doing so, you'll help prevent more farmers going under, and ensure locally produced fresh milk is still available for our kids in the future.

The Campaign

I believe the gap between city and country has become wider. Fewer people work the land due to technological advances. Supermarkets offer aisles of plastic wrapped 'foods'. Milk is sold in white plastic bottles - there is no connection to the farmer who produces the milk. Consumers buy cheap milk without any sense of the effort that has gone into producing it.
I'd love to take back some control from the multinationals and educate consumers through two documentaries about the true value of fresh milk - and the effort, resources and commitment that goes into its production. I do believe that by creating awareness about milk production, we will together be building a social conscience that will bring about change.
I'm taking my message on a road tour through Northern New South Wales and Queensland. These trips will go ahead regardless of this campaign outcome, as my family business has already committed to their importance. The funding we are hopeful of raising is to enable us to capture my journey in documentary style, and spread my message far beyond the small number of people we will meet on the road. For this work we have enlisted the expertise and services Boomi Films.
Of critical value also is the educational component. We will create two documentaries about the importance of animal health and welfare, the production of milk and its value to society. One will be aimed at kids - 'The Life of a Dairy Cow', and the other at older kids/adults 'Sustainable Food Production in the 21st Century'.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to act now. I won't be chasing government funding or corporate endorsements. I'm putting my hopes in people power.

We would like to raise $120,000 to complete the filming of a series of events, road-trips, and educational documentaries over the coming eight months - in Queensland and New South Wales, and if possible, New Orleans - USA, where I'll be speaking at the 2016 International Dairy Meet. My time and effort will be provided free of charge. VIE Marketing, the company who helped launch Scenic Rim 4Real Milk, and Boomi Films - are providing their time at reduced rates.

We have gone for the Flexible Funding option - as the events we wish to cover will be prioritized. If our target is not fully achieved we will still have the opportunity to document the most important elements of our overall project. As mentioned, regardless of the outcome, I will still be doing the road trips and speaking at International Dairy Meet - I just hope we can do the documentaries so I can spread my message further! 

We fully intend to take you on this crazy ride and communicate with you along the way. Short video clips will be uploaded regularly to the 'Farmer Gregie' Youtube Channel as we go - so you can even get your kids involved! Then we will invite you to share our journey and message by attending a launch screening, or buying a copy of the documentaries - or coming onto our farm to say G'day!


The Impact

I will continue to speak out about the devastation being inflicted on the dairy industry by the multinationals, most of which appear to be solely driven by their bottom line. I care about producing fresh, high quality milk that can be sold locally. I want your kids to be able to buy fresh milk for their kids - from a local farmer, not trucked or shipped from 1,000's of kilometres away.

It's crazy to think that a single farmer can make a difference. Maybe I can't - but with your help, my voice will become your voice and we will share it with the world.

Family farms matter. Fresh food matters. The little bloke matters. A future with real milk matters. 

Please support my campaign.


Risks & Challenges

Many thought we took a huge risk in 2013, to break away from the security of our Internationally owned Milk Processing Company, and invest more than $1 Million in our own factory. Retailer after retailer assured us that 4Real Milk would not sell at the price we required...but they were prepared to take a punt on us. Our three biggest stockists today were amongst the doubters. 

Truth be known - the only risk we took was on you, the consumer! I prefer to think of it as a leap of faith...for which we are rewarded every day we stay alive in business. A heart felt THANK YOU is definitely in order! I knew you would come through - the desire for real milk, farm gate fresh, direct to local stores is too strong. 

Are you ready to take a risk on us - with us? Perhaps a leap of faith, that you will have helped reconnect our farmers with the consumers they produce food for? And in doing so, change purchasing decisions to ensure fresh, locally produced milk by family farms, remains a part of our kid's future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Since the GFC, it's been a tough road for many of us, as individuals, families and  businesses. I totally understand and respect the fact that you may not be in a position to support this project financially. There is every chance however that you may absolutely love what we're doing, and what we will achieve. 

You may have family members, close friends or associates who are better positioned to help and would want to - if only they knew. Please share with your networks, through Social Media or community groups - by email or text. It's as easy as starting a simple conversation and stimulating interest. We could not even put a dollar value on that kind of help!
story_txt:
Short Summary G'day - Farmer Gregie here.

The Dairy Industry in Australia, and in many other places around the world, is on its knees. Fresh Milk has been devalued by large multinational companies to the point where some milk is cheaper to purchase than bottled water, despite costing a whole lot more to produce. There are examples of local dairy communities decimated, with farming families having to walk away from their farms, their homes and livelihoods.
Yet this has a wider impact on all of us - our food security. The future availability of locally produced fresh milk is in jeopardy. With fewer dairy farmers able to sustain a living, there will be less fresh milk produced. Some states in Australia are already importing enormous volumes of fresh milk to meet demand. 
I have to speak out about this! Dairy farming runs deep in my veins - the Dennis family have been dairy farming since the 1800's. Even my Nan grew up on her family farm before marrying a dairy farmer - and so did my Mum! We consider it a privilege to produce and supply farm gate fresh, minimally processed milk to consumers.
I'm just one farmer out to make a difference. Crazy? Maybe - but I'm going to put my heart and soul into this and I need your help.
Join me on a campaign to change consumer decisions back in favour of local, family owned dairy farms - and away from the multinationals. In doing so, you'll help prevent more farmers going under, and ensure locally produced fresh milk is still available for our kids in the future.

The Campaign
I believe the gap between city and country has become wider. Fewer people work the land due to technological advances. Supermarkets offer aisles of plastic wrapped 'foods'. Milk is sold in white plastic bottles - there is no connection to the farmer who produces the milk. Consumers buy cheap milk without any sense of the effort that has gone into producing it.
I'd love to take back some control from the multinationals and educate consumers through two documentaries about the true value of fresh milk - and the effort, resources and commitment that goes into its production. I do believe that by creating awareness about milk production, we will together be building a social conscience that will bring about change.
I'm taking my message on a road tour through Northern New South Wales and Queensland. These trips will go ahead regardless of this campaign outcome, as my family business has already committed to their importance. The funding we are hopeful of raising is to enable us to capture my journey in documentary style, and spread my message far beyond the small number of people we will meet on the road. For this work we have enlisted the expertise and services Boomi Films.
Of critical value also is the educational component. We will create two documentaries about the importance of animal health and welfare, the production of milk and its value to society. One will be aimed at kids - 'The Life of a Dairy Cow', and the other at older kids/adults 'Sustainable Food Production in the 21st Century'.


What We Need & What You Get
 We need to act now. I won't be chasing government funding or corporate endorsements. I'm putting my hopes in people power.
We would like to raise $120,000 to complete the filming of a series of events, road-trips, and educational documentaries over the coming eight months - in Queensland and New South Wales, and if possible, New Orleans - USA, where I'll be speaking at the 2016 International Dairy Meet. My time and effort will be provided free of charge. VIE Marketing, the company who helped launch Scenic Rim 4Real Milk, and Boomi Films - are providing their time at reduced rates.
We have gone for the Flexible Funding option - as the events we wish to cover will be prioritized. If our target is not fully achieved we will still have the opportunity to document the most important elements of our overall project. As mentioned, regardless of the outcome, I will still be doing the road trips and speaking at International Dairy Meet - I just hope we can do the documentaries so I can spread my message further! 
We fully intend to take you on this crazy ride and communicate with you along the way. Short video clips will be uploaded regularly to the 'Farmer Gregie' Youtube Channel as we go - so you can even get your kids involved! Then we will invite you to share our journey and message by attending a launch screening, or buying a copy of the documentaries - or coming onto our farm to say G'day!

The Impact
 I will continue to speak out about the devastation being inflicted on the dairy industry by the multinationals, most of which appear to be solely driven by their bottom line. I care about producing fresh, high quality milk that can be sold locally. I want your kids to be able to buy fresh milk for their kids - from a local farmer, not trucked or shipped from 1,000's of kilometres away.
It's crazy to think that a single farmer can make a difference. Maybe I can't - but with your help, my voice will become your voice and we will share it with the world.
Family farms matter. Fresh food matters. The little bloke matters. A future with real milk matters. 
Please support my campaign.

Risks & Challenges
  Many thought we took a huge risk in 2013, to break away from the security of our Internationally owned Milk Processing Company, and invest more than $1 Million in our own factory. Retailer after retailer assured us that 4Real Milk would not sell at the price we required...but they were prepared to take a punt on us. Our three biggest stockists today were amongst the doubters. 
Truth be known - the only risk we took was on you, the consumer! I prefer to think of it as a leap of faith...for which we are rewarded every day we stay alive in business. A heart felt THANK YOU is definitely in order! I knew you would come through - the desire for real milk, farm gate fresh, direct to local stores is too strong. 
Are you ready to take a risk on us - with us? Perhaps a leap of faith, that you will have helped reconnect our farmers with the consumers they produce food for? And in doing so, change purchasing decisions to ensure fresh, locally produced milk by family farms, remains a part of our kid's future.
Other Ways You Can Help
 Since the GFC, it's been a tough road for many of us, as individuals, families and  businesses. I totally understand and respect the fact that you may not be in a position to support this project financially. There is every chance however that you may absolutely love what we're doing, and what we will achieve. 
You may have family members, close friends or associates who are better positioned to help and would want to - if only they knew. Please share with your networks, through Social Media or community groups - by email or text. It's as easy as starting a simple conversation and stimulating interest. We could not even put a dollar value on that kind of help!

story:
Flemish Fox Brewery & Craftworks, is a new brewery in Austin, Texas founded by Christine Celis, that will brew Belgian-style beers and ales for craft beer lovers. The brewery builds on the Celis family legacy, brewing the original witbier that Pierre Celis made in Hoegaarden as well as other award-winning craft beer recipes.

We are embarking on an important fundraising campaign to save historically significant brewing equipment and techniques.

You have an opportunity to make a mark on the craft beer industry with your contribution. Your gift will help us to relocate Pierre Celis’ original brewing equipment from Hoegaarden, Belgium to Austin, Texas.


Preserving an Important Beer Style

Hoegaarden, Belgium is the birthplace of Belgian witbier, which has been brewed in the village since 1445. The village has been synonymous with this aromatic, cloudy, witbier for centuries. In 1955 the last brewery in Hoegaarden that made witbier, Brasserie Louis Tomsin, closed for good when the brewer retired. Unfathomably, the region’s treasured witbier died with it.

Fortunately, that isn’t the end of the story. As the town and beer lovers across the country grieved for its loss, Pierre Celis, who had learned to make witbier at neighboring Tomsin, quietly began making home brew versions of it in 1965. On March 13, 1966, Celis singlehandedly revived the Hoegaarden witbier style in his brewery, Brouwerij De Kluis. Over the years, the cloudy witbier made with wheat, hops, coriander, and orange peel became world renowned and many breweries began making similar styles.

Pierre Celis later went on to found Celis Brewery in Austin, Texas, in 1992 and continued to make witbier.

The brewing equipment used to resurrect the style of beer remained in the original farmhouse in Belgium where he first brewed his witbier. The historic, weathered open mash tun, two copper kettles, an open fermenter, heat exchanger, and coolship hasn’t been used since 1979. Like the original witbier, it too could die.

We can save this extraordinary piece of brewing heritage dating back to the 1900s. Just as her father rescued witbier from extinction, Christine Celis is determined to save his legacy by bringing the original brewing equipment to install and display in the new Flemish Fox Brewery in Austin, Texas.

We need your help to preserve brewing heritage. 


A Monumental Task

Moving the 2-toncast-iron open mash tun and copper brew kettles from the brewery in Hoegaarden to Austin is a monumental task. The extensive process to reclaim the brew kettles involved chiseling it free from the brick and concrete in which it is encased with jackhammers. The roof and walls of the brewery had to be removed to allow space to pull out the brewing equipment using a massive construction crane. The very building itself had to be reinforced to allow it to sustain this excavation. The walls and roof will of course will have to be repaired as well.

We will restore the equipment with curative sandblasting processes and repair work. Following restoration, the copper kettles, mash tun and open fermenter will be packed in custom-made protective wooden crates to be shipped across the Atlantic to Texas.

It’s a project of historic importance not seen before in the village of Hoegaarden. The streets were blocked to allow for enormous trucks to transport the brewing equipment to the harbor for its long ocean voyage to the Port of Houston. Pierre Celis’ equipment will retrace the brewing journey that he took from Belgium to Texas.


A Hefty Price

The extensive project comes with a hefty price tag. It will cost $252,000 to save this equipment and install it in working order in the museum at Flemish Fox Brewery & Craftworks.  The costs involved include: 

  • Excavation of equipment - $25,000
  • Rental of the crane and trucks - $27,000
  • Storage - $5,000
  • Shipping over seas and by road - $25,000
  • Austin building retrofit - $150,000 
  • New bottling line - $15,000  
  • Foeders - $20,000  


You can Help Save a Brewing Legacy

Christine Celis isn’t undertaking this colossally difficult and expensive project to simply put the celebrated brew kettles in a museum. The mash tun and brew kettles will be refurbished and be put back into commission on special occasions at the new Flemish Fox Brewery to once again brew authentic beers in the true style that Pierre Celis revived in the village Hoegaarden in 1965.

You can have a hand in preserving the heritage of witbier’s brewing origins, and bring Belgian legacy to Texas. Your generous contribution will not only make sure historically significant equipment is preserved, but the very brewing techniques that are only feasible with this kind of equipment are likewise preserved.

With the equipment, Christine Celis will also bring the original yeast and brewing methodologies perfected in the early days in Hoegaarden to once again revive witbier in Austin for all to enjoy. This is a process rarely used outside of Belgium in modern brewing to continue a beloved style that deserves to be saved.

Flemish Fox Brewery will brew the original Belgian recipes from Pierre Celis in the restored equipment on special occasions. The brewery will make Belgian ales, as well as other Pierre Celis recipes that were never produced, in gleaming new state of the art brewing equipment on an ongoing basis.

Each contributor of $200 or more will be invited to brew in the original open mash tun, copper kettles, and fermenters, manually stirring the mash with wooden paddles. You will experience the equipment and the process of making the original Belgian style witbier just the way Pierre Celis did it.


Your Contribution Matters

We greatly appreciate your support and will reward all contributions with unique recognition items and experiences.  You not only have an opportunity to preserve brewing heritage, but you can also earn a hands-on experience of brewing beer in this equipment with a Master Brewer. We will have visiting Master Brewers from renowned craft breweries around the world for each session. 

Thank you for your help in preserving brewing heritage and ensuring the rebirth of Pierre Celis’ legacy. 


Flemish Fox in the News

http://www.mystatesman.com/news/lifestyles/food-cooking/celis-legacy-will-love-on-in-daughters-flemish-fox/nqhmp/

http://www.texasmonthly.com/eat-my-words/the-fl...

story:
Our Story                                                                          

Hello we are The Humphreys, The Inventors and Business Owners of CleanPrep. We started this company to raise money to pay for our children's colleges and we  are doing this campaign to jump start our business. Our goal is to make an american made product with high quality antimicrobial plastic. By contributing you will helps us achieve these goals and you will get an amazing product that you will be amazed by how many times you use it. 

What We Need & What You Get

We put our goal at $50,000 because that will buy us extra molds and bring  our price point down and It will allow us to buy our  product in bulk form. We also need money to hire people to help us run our social media sites and platform and to build our website. We have started our journey with a product and market analysis, and it scored very high through a company called Lambert and Lambert, which we highly recommend. Basically, that means this is a highly anticipated and marketable product. 
If we do not reach our goal everyone will still get the perks they pay for. This will happen because, we will still make our product out of the same material we will just have less product to jumpstart our business. To Break it down, Plan A  would be to reach our goal, make 8 molds and fulfill perks. Plan B would be to make 4 molds and still fulfill perks. Plan C would be to make one mold and fulfill perks and have another improved campaign. 
The CleanPrep offers 8 amazing perks to go along with our campaign. These perks range from a various amount of CleanPreps that you can receive. So, that means if you want to perchance a CleanPrep you can do so buy donating $25. BUT if you would like to receive more than one then you can donate more according to the amount of CleanPreps you would like. Because everybody knows 5 is better than 1. Also, you can save money on shipping and handling if you buy more at a time. Our perks are at a reduced introductory price,of $25. So, Indiegogo contributors are getting the best possible price of a CleanPrep available. The suggested retail price for our products are $29.99 per CleanPrep. That means Indiegogo customers are getting a $5 reduction price then retail consumers would when they appear in stores. You can also donate a lower donation of $5 or $10 and receive signed photo of the actors that are shown in our original and family produced videos that everyone has come to love. 
A SPECIAL SPECIAL!!
We love our Indiegogo contributors and we realize it's people like you who are helping small businesses, films, and projects in general all around the world get off the ground, so we would like to thank you for that. We are offering 5,000 CleanPreps at a reduced reduced price of $23!!! For Indiegogo contributors only!! 

The Impact 

As the inventors of CleanPrep we believe that we have created the missing link to cutting boards. We know we know, everybody's kids the cutest but the overwhelming response we have gotten when we show people, shows us that it is something people want. We believe in quality, and we believe quality should be number one. That is why we only make our products out of FDA approved, anti microbial plastic material. Because that is the highest quality we have to offer and we know will work perfect in your kitchens. 
There is a reason why people get there counter tops professionally cleaned. The bacteria growth from using dysfunctional cutting boards ( meaning cutting boards that spill) cause certain types of arthritis.

Risks & Challenges

We had our 4 children star as actors in our campaign video because we wanted to establish an organic and family friendly feel to our company. Verses hiring someone to make us a $10,000 professionally made video. We are not looking for investors in our company, we are looking for people who realize this is the most amazing cutting board they are ever going to buy. It was hard to keep the design simple, we have several designs, but we felt this would be the best seller due to our public surveys. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us buy sharing our links to your Facebook to get our word out there! We are also a repitable knife company to sponsor our company. Thank you very much!

story:
TUFF CHUCK is an Amazing Energy beverage made for Amazing People like YOU 

 

You will enjoy "Amazing Energy" when You use TUFF CHUCK 

 

 Steve Jobs once said: '' Great things are never done by one person, They're done by a Team of People". I would like humbly to ask you to join my Team and support TUFF CHUCK  

For three years, I have been working tirelessly to bring TUFF CHUCK from a simple dream to reality, the flavor is amazing,  Unique bottle design + remarkable energy blend. However, lot of unfinished work remains ex: Box packaging, some minor design and label tweaks, ordering Perks, working the logistic side of project...etc

         

TUFF CHUCK: Amazing Energy for Amazing People !

Zero Calories, Zero Sugar with Amazing Taste for a GREAT PRICE 

 

 

 

             Five stars quality stamp on every bottle and box 

.

- What should you -- expect ?

1. Amazing Positive Energy: 

TUFF CHUCK will give you Amazing Energy. TUFF CHUCK gets you going and rolling every time ! Whether you are going to work early morning, recovering your energy after lunch, staying up late to study or night partying with your friends "...TUFF CHUCK is the Answer  whenever You !  need that Extra Fast Energy Boost.

2. Amazing Taste: 

TUFF CHUCK has an Amazingly Smooth Berry Taste.

3. To crash or not-to-crash ?

When you drink regular energy drinks, You will get a good energy kick for  a few hours in part due to a heavy sugar presence but you will tend to crash later. It is as if you are taking energy from LATER to substitute for a NOW moment, which is a bad strategy... With TUFF CHUCK, You will get all the energy benefits without that Downside.

4. Sugar and Calories:

 Please check the calories and sugars on the back of a regular energy drink. They are a recipe for long term Health Disaster ! TUFF CHUCK has Zero Calories and Zero Sugar. With TUFF CHUCK You get all the energy benefits without that Downside.

5. Great Price: 

The cost for US customers is: $30 for 12 bottles of TUFF CHUCK with FREE SHIPPING. Box includes a nice pop out display 4x 3"

US shipping: FREE

You will also get many free rewards and a free surprise gift with your order of TUFF CHUCK

6. Charity, Do FEEL GOOD !

Our Team strongly believe in the voluntary giving of help to those in need. TUFF CHUCK will donate  2% of funds raised to St. Jude Children's Research Hospital

7. Lifestyle:

TUFF CHUCK is easy to carry (light weight 2oz), small enough to put in a handbag/purse for ladies and to carry on in your pockets (guys).

The beauty is You can drink half a bottle in Your early morning to get going and save the rest for later use as needed or for the next day.

Think of TUFF CHUCK as " Amazing Energy " on demand, so use it whenever you need an energy boost throughout your day !

8. Freshen UP !

 TUFF CHUCK is a healthier way to revitalize your body, refresh your breath and renew your energy. Simply shake bottle, twist cap and Enjoy !  It is time to " Turn On Your Mojo ! "

9. For International Customers:

The price is: $30 for 12 bottles of TUFF CHUCK Amazing Energy delivered anywhere in the world to your door ! The 12 bottle box includes a nice free pop out display 4x 3"

Canada shipping: $10  extra per box

Worldwide: $ 20 extra per box (Post office surcharge)

You will also get many free rewards and a free surprise gift with your order of TUFF CHUCK

Zero Calories, Zero Sugar with Amazing Taste for a GREAT PRICE
