story:
Gardens for Grand Rapids is a new project that seeks to address part of the problem of food insecurity throughout the city by offering; 1) free raised beds to households that want one, and; 2) to work with faith communities to transform their property into spaces for food production.

1. Raised Beds for Households - We are raising funds to cover the cost of building materials and soil. We will also construct the raise beds, deliver them and fill them with new soil for free for those experiencing food insecurity. 

If you or someone you know would like a raised bed, send us a message at jsmith@griid.org. 

We also welcome volunteers to help deliver the raised beds or those who want to donate building materials or plants for new growers. Please send a message if you'd like to volunteer.

2. Gardens for Faith Communities - We are willing to work with any faith community that wants to explore the possibilities around transforming their property into spaces of food production. Producing food might benefit their own congregational needs, be used in their food pantry, to offer more healthy items for people experiencing food insecurity, as an opportunity to invite neighbors to grow in the garden, as a youth project, or provide resources to other populations experiencing food insecurity. 

In addition, we can design a growing space, which could include vegetables, herbs, fruit bushes and fruit trees; Build raised beds or till land (depending on results from soil testing); Maintain the garden/growing space or teach others how to take care of a garden and offer the following workshops 

Food Justice - an examination of the current food system and how we can collectively practice food justice.

How to grow food - offers the basics on growing your own food, which includes how to plant, soil maintenance, water use, mulching, pest management, harvesting, seed saving and winterizing your garden.

Canning - how to can pickles, tomatoes, salsa, apple sauce, etc.

Using faith community kitchens for promoting food sharing and food justice.

If your faith community is interested, please contact us at jsmith@griid.org. 

As we move forward, we will post pictures and stories for both the raised bed for homes and the faith community food growing projects. We believe that everyone has a right to eat well and we are motivated by the principles of Food Justice with this new project. We believe in transparency and by asking for financial support and volunteers we want to demonstrate that it is possible to practice food justice through grassroots organizing.

We welcome your support and invite you to join us in making Gardens for Grand Rapids a vibrant reality.

story:
Do you know what the most democratic and sustainable work environment is? Would you believe it’s a worker owned cooperative (co-op).

Who we are

We are the employees at Spectrum Apparel Printing, and we have been given a golden opportunity that cannot be passed up. The owner of our shop, due to family needs, is unfortunately closing down the shop, and selling the equipment. However, he agreed to sell the shop and equipment to us for a very discounted price, and that we would be given first priority to buy the shop. Part of our agreement was that we become a legal worker owned co-op, and that we raise the necessary funds to purchase the equipment. Well, we just became a legal co-op, and We have until April 20th to raise the money to buy the shop, otherwise we miss our opportunity.  

Our screen printing shop is well established and has been around for over 8 years. We have a robust clientele, stellar web presence, a great location, and new state-of-the-art equipment. We are ready for taking on the challenge of running a screen printing shop.

   

What Your Contribution Does

We are looking for amazing people to be a part of this special project. Your contribution gives us the ability to purchase the entire shop and continue its operation uninterrupted. More importantly, your contribution has a direct impact on our place of work, our lives, our families, and the communities that we are attached to.

Building a POC owned worker co-op is a big deal and has a tremendous positive impact. We need your contribution today.

Sharing is caring, and if we all share this, like Care Bears, I am sure a rainbow will appear somewhere on our body. (humor)  

Background extended

We have been working in the print shop for some time now, we’re like a worker family, and because we are mix of undocumented, differently-abled, and formerly incarcerated people, we look out for each other like a family should.

Instead of letting the shop close down, and lose of source of employment and stability for our families, we all decided to form a worker owned co-op and buy the shop from our boss. Our boss was hella down for idea, and told us that he would sell us the shop for half of the total cost of what it was worth. It is very normal for Mid-sized prints shops to sell for around $140,000 - $180,000. But we are getting the shop for 58,000.

Yeah! $58,000 is a kick ass deal, considering we are getting like new equipment, a really awesome space, professional website and web presence, clientele, vendor relationships, and a creative open art space that we rent out to our local Bay Area community.

In these times of uncertainty (with Mr. 45), we can be certain that supporting this project to transform this print shop into a worker owned co-op is a definite way to secure our livelihoods, our families, and our communities.  

To our activist community

This is a Black owned shop, We want to keep it POC and Black owned as a Co-op. This is direct call to action for our People, and our White allies and accomplices. Our window of opportunity to buy the shop is running out. We need your contribution now. Or help spread the word and share this kick ass video.

story:
The Magic of Stargazen

My name is Dianne. I live at Stargazen Sanctuary, in the gorgeous woods of west central Wisconsin, where Miracles and Magic abound! Stargazen was created as a woodland nursery cum women's retreat, by my Beloved, Delightful partner, Raven, and me. Raven Transitioned from this earth while shoveling snow after a fierce storm. I found Her laying near the trailer She was digging out, as a surprise for me. I performed CPR on Her, ultimately with the help of two neighbors. . . and then, a team of paramedics.  After more than two hours of desperately attempting to revive Her, Raven went Home, enveloped by the energies of the Geminid meteor shower.

Losing my Eternal True Love, I fell into a deep, abiding, grief and despair.

Reviving Stargazen was further impeded when I sustained a head injury in September of 2014. I was struck in the back of my head by a load of plywood being navigated by a customer at our local building materials store. The customer fled as I lost consciousness, slung over my cart. The store denied culpability, and would not release the surveillance tapes. I was left with thousands of dollars of medical bills, not covered by my catastrophic insurance. As I worked to heal and pay the medical debt, I passionately reminded myself that Grace was more powerful than grief and trauma. That Trust is greater than fear. That Raven was watching over me.

I determined that I needed to revive my Life, and that included Stargazen. Stargazen is of my Soul. Part of me feels out of Balance because Stargazen is out of Balance.

With the Kind help of Friends, and my new Love, Janet,  we have begun revitalizing Stargazen. This is imperative! Over the years, MANY women have found Peace and Wholeness at Stargazen.  For some, it is their second Home.

There is a large pole barn, which has always been used for storage and a workshop. Remodeling the pole barn into a large group meeting and celebration venue is a perfect and necessary goal. We will add weddings to our menu, including LGBTQ ceremonies. The space will be upgraded with barn wood, luscious, old beams and industrial influences. We will add weddings to our events list. Stargazen is a Gorgeous landscape for Dreams and Love.  Lush gardens. Quaint dwellings. A rustic pavilion with Family-style dining tables. A vast, grassy mound, that includes a stage and ample space for Your tented event. We will accomplish this miraculous renovation during the winter months of 2016-17.  We will be ready to host Your "Dreams Come True" by May, 2017. It will be Magnificent!

Once the pole barn is reworked (and if our funding exceeds our goal), we will move on to finishing the RavenSoul Chapel. The skeletal structure of this building awaits its own "Day of Dawning." It, too, was abandoned due to grief. It is ready to Rise!!

Thank You for "hearing" my story and my "plea."  With the Deepest Humility and Gratitude, I am asking for Your help! The integrity of Your contribution will be an integral thread in the weave of our Resurrected Sanctuary. Please KNOW that I will ever-Honor Your generosity and Kindness. I cannot do this without EACH OF YOU. . .  <3

We would be forever grateful if you share this with others near and far! You can share directly from Indiegogo. Thank you!!!

story:
Gun Show Loophole Tour 2018

Tour Goals

Our third annual look at firearms in the U.S.A. through; Gun Shows, Gun Shops, Museums & Collections

We will travel across the Western United States, sharing the firearms owners experience

2018 Gun Show Loophole Tour

  • 8,000 Miles
  • 13 States
  • 60 Days on the road
  • ?? Gun Shops
  • 4+ Firearms Museums
  • 3+ Gun Shows

    We will;

    • Seek Out & Share Firearms Stories in the USA
    • Visit and review interesting, local Gun Shops
    • Attend Gun Shows all over the U.S.A.
    • Share interesting Guns & Firearms Collections
    • Visit & promote Firearms Museums & Historic Locations
    • Interview Gun Owners Rights Organization Members
    • Tour Manufacturers, Importers & Distributors
    • Encourage others to participate & contribute to Pro- 2nd Amendment efforts

    Backers & Perks

    We are interested in assistance finding & contacting all the best gun shops, gun collections, firearm museums, gun shows and ranges along our way

    We welcome financial help with Gas & Food 

    Here is how we will break down the perks & contributions. 

    Those who participate can decide where their funds will be used
    And backers will get our thanks & a custom patch in return for their support:

    • $2 for 2A - Thank You !
    • $5   - "Gas Money" - Thank You !!
    • $10 - "Tour Ticket Sticker" - Get your Ticket to the Gun Show Loophole Tour
    • $25 - "Van Pit Crew", Help with Gas, Repairs, Oil, Tires, etc & Get a Tour Patch 
    • $50 - "Call Shotgun", help us upgrade the van & Get all the Tour Stuff
    • $100 - "Gun Show Table", help us with table fees at shows &  Get MANY Patches

    First 10 supporters get a Special Limited Run Tour Perk !!

    Suggest a Stop on the Tour

    • $50 - Request a Featured Gun Shop, Gun Show, Museum or Gun Range
      We will do our best to visit every requested location,
      we WILL feature these locations during the tour (Even if they are not on our route)

    Stretch Goals

    • $1,600 = Gas for the Tour funded !! 
    • $3,000 = Food & Bills paid (Thank You)
        - And we can create the Tour Patch in PVC
    • $4,500 = Northwest Leg of the Tour
         - We go to Cody, WY & Seattle, WA & Oregon
    • $6,000 = NRA Show Leg of the Tour
         - We get to Salt Lake City, UT and the NRA Show in Dallas, TX
    • $7,500+ = Van Upgrades and Modifications, Cameras, Etc
    • $10,000+ = Would go to the next leg of the Tour
          "Gun RIghts Policy Conference & Back to Bannerman Castle"

    ​Funding Goals

    We plan to set up at gun shows along the way, selling our patches, decals & other merchandise. We will welcome any financial assistance to fund the trips expenses. 

    Here is how we will use funds that are raised

    • We will visit gun shows around the Western USA
    • Tour more Gun Shops,  Firearms Museums and interesting places across the USA
      (See partial list below)
    • Stretch Goal - 360 Camera
    • Stretch Goal - Drone Camera

    Expected Results

    We document our adventures on multiple platforms with various content:

    • GunShowLoopholeTour.com
    • Our daily LIVE show & podcast = the Daily Gun Show
    • Daily blogs & new articles on our websites devoted to Gun Shops, Gun Shows & Firearms 
    • You Tube Videos = Gun Websites 
    • Photographs on IG, Gun Channels & our websites
    • We will update and expand our maps & event calendars 
    • GunChannels.com, You Tube, iTunes, Facebook, Instagram & more

    We will: 

    • Travel across the USA
    • Add to our growing list of Gun Shop & Gun Show Visits and Reviews
    • Discover, Promote & Share Firearms Museums
    • Raise awareness of Recreational & Sport Shooting
    • Seek out U.S. firearms history
    • Share interesting private firearms collections
    • Visit & Tour Firearms Manufacturers, Importers & Distributors
    • Attend Machine Gun Shoots & other Shooting Events

    Destinations:

    We will travel as far as our funds can keep gas in the tanks. Some potential routes include locations we plan to visit on the tour (this list will grow)

    • Buffalo Bill Center of the West, WY 
    • John M. Browning Museum, Salt Lake City, Utah
    • J.M. Davis Firearms Museum, Oklahoma
    • Autry National Center of the American West, CA
    • NRA National Meeting, Dallas, TX
    • 2A Organizations (National, State & Local)
    • "Real" Surplus Stores
    • Interesting Gun Shops
    • As many Gun Shows as possible

     

    The Van

    Check out the van. We have posted LIVE chats as well as a series of video updates as we purchased, upgraded the Van. 

    Van Chats every Sunday Night. We talk about Van Life & Road Trips

    Follow along at Van13.com as we continue to modify and upgrade the van. 

    Risks & Challenges

    We WILL travel, how long we are able to continue will be a factor of how interested people are in our adventures. Risks are few for this campaign 

    • We have successfully completed over 20 crowdfunding projects. we have years of experience shipping the rewards (patches) so there is very little (no) risk 
    • The duration & scope of our travels will be determined by the success of this campaign

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people can't contribute, but they can still help a lot
    If this project is something you would like to see happen, 

    • Please help to get the word out & make some noise about this campaign.
    • Use the social media share tools above to share our campaign 

    Thank You !!

story:
THE MILLENNIAL TRAINS PROJECT (MTP) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization that leads crowd-funded transcontinental train journeys for diverse groups of young innovators (and virtual audiences) to explore America's new frontiers.

To get on board, applicants design a project to advance across the communities where our train stops and then race to be among the first 15 applicants on their selected train journey to reach their $5,000 crowdfunding goal. To learn more about the 2016 journeys click here. The applicant's project is described below.

Who I am:

My name is Leah, and I am a recent graduate that is passionate about empowering others. I am the founder of Business Women of the 415, a Lean In Circle in San Francisco made up of female professionals in business and finance-related careers. In my spare time I enjoy traveling, and have worked as an intern at the Grameen Bank in Bangladesh and volunteered at the Maya Mountain Research Farm in rural Belize.

Project Overview

Through the project Stepping Forward: Profiles of Millennial Women, I will engage with millennial women across the United States from a wide range of different fields, educational backgrounds, and geographic areas, and learn about their career paths, opportunities, and dreams. I will profile these women and share their stories to help young women from around the country learn about the opportunities that are available to them and help them identify what they want their future to look like and what they can do to step forward in their career.  

What We Need & What You Get

I am fundraising $5,000 to join the Millennial Train Project in traveling to Pittsburgh, Chicago, Kansas City, Albuquerque, and Los Angeles to profile young millennial women and share their stories. I will develop resources to help young women from around the country learn about the career opportunities that are available to them and help them identify what they want their future to look like.
.

Project Impact

Currently, there are few resources available for young women trying to explore their options; most career guides focus on professionals that are already well established, rather than just getting started, and generic advice about communication and leadership is harder to learn from than real-life examples and stories. Furthermore, as the workplaces and industries evolve, the opportunities for young women are changing, so advice from millennial women may be the most relevant. This project will create a guide for young women that are looking to build their career that will serve them as they are going through some of the most critical times of their life.

For my project, I will travel across the United States and meet with millennial women that are early on in their careers in a variety of different fields. The interviews will focus on three key aspects of career development:

  1. How did you find your career path? What twists and turns did you have along the way? What has your educational path been?
  2. What has your experience been working? What was your first job like, what did you learn, and what did it lead to?
  3. What are your aspirations? What are you doing now to get there?

I will make an effort to focus on as many different industries and types of work as possible to give readers a sense of different career options and to tell a wide range of experiences. The focus will be on women under the age of 30, with particular emphasis on the 22-25 age range.

The Outcome

The resources produced from this project will educate young women about different career options while simultaneously giving them advice about ways to reach their goals. By highlighting the stories of millennial women pursuing their dreams through a range of different career paths, this MTP project will allow young women to learn from peers that they may never have the chance to meet.

While traveling on the train, I will create blog posts throughout the journey following stops in each city and include some of the profiles of millennial women in that city. I will create an ebook that includes compilations of all of the interviews collected through the trip. The ebook will be searchable by industry, geography, education level, and age group, so that readers can easily find and focus on stories that resonate with them and are relevant to their life stage and situation. 

Risks & Challenges

It is a big undertaking to create comprehensive, useful resources. However, I am passionate about this topic and committed to the cause. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help me spread the word about this campaign.
  • If you are a millennial woman, I would love to interview you for this project!
  • Follow the blog and read the resources when they are published!
*If my campaign is among the first 15 to reach its $5,000 goal, all funds raised will go to MTP, which is a 501(c)3 organization. As such, they will be tax-deductible. These funds help to underwrite the costs of the journey and its associated programming, transportation, and hospitality costs. If I am not among the first 15 applicants to reach their crowdfunding goal, none of you, my supporters, will be charged.

story: This project was created with the idea of growing our local business into an international business. Over the past three years we have stumbled upon many unforeseen difficulties. The main one is liquidity. Our family heritage in Costa Rica is compromised and there is a very high risk of losing it. We want to invite you to support us, in order to save our heritage and develop our other Project which is large, but requires liquidity. We have learned that honesty is not enough to resolve the problem because we are creditor of large loans, and mortgages. THE IMPACT Our project will generate Jobs in the country, and will eventually provide scholarships for needy families. The funding we require is US$47,000 to continue our business. We have never thought about giving up because we have already invested more than seven times this amount, but we require liquidity to be able to continue Help us spread the campaign on social networks

story:
www.crystalcreekmoonshine.com


The Bootleggers

Born out of the Austin Hill Country and inspired by The Roaring ’20s, Shane and Sam are the only ingredients involved which weren't grown in Texas. The Crystal Creek distillery is bringing a new twist to an American classic with unique infusions like Serrano-Cucumber, Coffee-Pecan, Peach-Lavender, and Blackberry-Mint. 5% of the profits from bottles sales will be going towards supporting Austin based charity, A Glimmer of Hope.


                                                        Sam (left) & Shane (right)

Sam Wakefield: Co-founder, Master Mooner

This wild specimen is vital to our team. Inspired by the surge of craft spirits and missing the environment of his former brewery job in Boulder, CO, Sam brought the idea of distilling America’s classic spirit to Shane and it snowballed from there. While the craft movement began as a hobby, it has quickly developed into a passion  and from there, a way of life. 

Shane Berber: Co-founder, Chief of Mooning

This rare and beautiful creature is a true asset. Inspired to make an impact by a visit to Ethiopia, socially responsible business has always been at the top of his agenda. Shane likes to work hard and play hard, so the distillery lifestyle came naturally. Keep an eye out for him when downtown in Austin after the bats have taken flight.

                                 
            (Having a bit of fun at the distillery - and yes... we always wear those)


What We Need & What You Get

We are ready to bring our moonshine to the people. Help us get it there!

  • Funding will go directly into improving/purchasing equipment, allowing us to improve capacity and efficiency.
  • Our perks will get you anything from a kiss on the cheek, to your own personalized whiskey barrel (branded w/your name) in which it was aged.
  • Regardless of what we raise, this campaign will help CCM take all of the Crystal Creek products out into the market.

The Impact

Your support will not only impact us, but the community of local businesses we work with:

  • Our product is made from Texas grown ingredients like Goodflow Honey, and our infusions are also sourced from local farms and businesses.
  • In the time we have been open, we have managed to support not only A Glimmer of Hope, but also several other fantastic non-profits including: Divine Canines, Ronald McDonald House, Marbridge Foundation, Bikers Against Child Abuse, and many more. Charitable support will remain on the forefront of the Crystal Creek Mission.
  • Partnerships with local farms allow us to remove our waste product and provide them with high quality fertilizer for their land.

  •     


Risks & Challenges

Every day at the distillery comes with a unique set of challenges to overcome and we've got the scars to prove it:

  • While the competition is steep, we are uncompromising on quality when it comes to ingredients and practice. 
  • We've learned from the mistakes we've made, and are better prepared than ever to take our small business to the next phase.  
  • The Distilled Spirits world is filled with giants, but the craft movement has been growing exponentially with support for small and local business. The craft movement is the heart of why we have seen more and more support for businesses like ours.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get out to your local bars, restaurants and liquor stores. Remember, the consumer (you!) has all the power:

  • Some of the most valuable support you can give is by simply spreading the word to as many as you can.
  • Share our campaign with any and everyone! You never know who may be interested!
  • Do you know of any establishments supporting Craft or Local products? Let them know about Crystal Creek. If they reach out to us, we'll do the rest! 

                         



We really do appreciate your help and support.
Lots of love,
Shane and Sam

story:
UPDATE 2 - Forums & new TS are LIVE, first batch of perks being distributed!

Hey folks! It's time for another update! We've been working long & hard throughout January to make sure that the forums & TS are ready, as well as switched over to the new & improved servers!

The supporter forum badges & TeamSpeak icons will be distributed soon, and the artists have already contacted everyone receiving the portraits - which have all sold out now! Make sure to check your mails (spam folder included) so you don't miss anything!

We are keeping the donations on Indiegogo open throughout the entirety of February, so you can still get your perks, and after the popularity of the Champion & Legendary perks, we are contacting the artists to see if they'd be up for making more - or possibly reaching out to other artists as well!

Here are the forum & TS supporter badges:

Teamspeak

Forums


Thank you for your ongoing love & support!

~Lelling / Rok

UPDATE - GOAL REACHED & STRETCH GOAL!

Hey everyone! So we've reached our goal within days of starting the campaign! This means that the new servers & TeamSpeak are definitely a go! Now we're looking at our even bigger target - we estimate that if we reach our stretch goal of 1500€, it will cover the expenses for the website, servers, TeamSpeak & forums for the entirety of 2016! This'll mean we can focus on more events & community stuff and less on the funding side of things!

Let's make 1500€ happen folks!

~Lelling / Rok

OpenCommunity

Founded by two Guild Wars 2 guilds coming together with the idea of creating an open platform for gamers to connect & play games together, OpenCommunity is a safe & convenient place for people to connect & have fun.

We provide:

  • A website working as an information center for in-game (& otherwise) community events
  • A forum, allowing people to share experiences, hold discussions & hang out in a relaxed environment - with the startup we will launch a new forum with better features, readability & text
  • A TeamSpeak server with a wide array of channels - created on user-request & high user privileges, capable of connecting over 500 people at the same time

Why We Are Raising Funds

OpenCommunity is and always will be a completely open project, which means everyone is, and always will be able to use all of our features for free.

However, a TeamSpeak license & server to host it on require funding, and as the community grows, become more and more expensive. We are turning to the members of our community to help us out and pitch in.

What we're looking at is a TeamSpeak license and a rented dedicated server. The money we raise will help us get started - the TS license is a 1-year purchase of $300-$500, which will keep us running until 2017.

Any money raised over the expected amount will go towards making sure that OpenCommunity is stable and can exist for a long time.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help out in ways other than donating, that's ok too! Let your friends and co-gamers know about OpenCommunity and the stuff we do, get involved, or help incentivise others to donate in all sorts of creative ways!

However, a TeamSpeak license & server to host it on require funding, and as the community grows, become more and more expensive. We are turning to the members of our community to help us out and pitch in.
What we're looking at is a TeamSpeak license and a rented dedicated server. The money we raise will help us get started - the TS license is a 1-year purchase of $300-$500, which will keep us running until 2017.
Any money raised over the expected amount will go towards making sure that OpenCommunity is stable and can exist for a long time.

    Other Ways You Can Help If you'd like to help out in ways other than donating, that's ok too! Let your friends and co-gamers know about OpenCommunity and the stuff we do, get involved, or help incentivise others to donate in all sorts of creative ways!

story:
Hey Guys!

Thank you so much for stopping by! My name is Bethany Cole, Owner and Director of MomPlex in Tempe, Arizona. But those are both new titles for me. I'm also a mom of 2 boys, a wife, a full time student, and a Financial Coach. 

Before MomPlex, I worked from home while also being the only caretaker for my boys. I spent 10 to 15 hours a day juggling work, school, and my kids needs. Nothing got 100% of my attention, and I felt like I was failing at everything. We won't even talk about what my house looked like. 

Fast forward to now. In the morning, the boys and I get up and go to MomPlex. They go back to the toddler room, and I go out to the coffee shop to work. They are just down the hall, and I can check on them anytime I want. And I get to spend 4 hours a day getting work done. My homework gets done on time, I'm replying to clients the same day they are emailing me questions, and I get to be around other moms! I also get to squeeze in a yoga class once a week. 

And the best part is, when we get home, the kids are so tired from playing, that they take a long nap! I have time to clean the house. And when they wake up? They have my 100% undivided attention until bedtime because I got everything done at MomPlex!

MomPlex is the support system moms across the country need to be better moms, better spouses, better business owners, and better versions of themselves. Obviously, the big goal of spreading this idea across the country is several years away. For now, we are still trying to just get our flagship location up and running. That's where you come in! 

We have been open for 1 month, and we have got 6 members already! It will take 12 members to make MomPlex self sustainable, and 15 to 20 for us to able to start opening other locations. $8,000 would completely carry us through August 2017, giving us the resources to reach out to more moms, gain members, and begin planning our second location. 

So where do you come in? Well. It would take just $8 from 1000 moms for us to reach our goal, and we know that this is a goal we can easily reach with your help! We honestly believe that when we come together and support each other, moms can do absolutely anything. 

Where is your $8 going? Well, when you donate to MomPlex, you are:

  • Paying the moms we have hired to run the childcare. They get to bring their kids to work with them at no cost, and they get to take home a paycheck. This has been such a blessing to the moms who are working for us, but it is also our biggest operating cost. 
  • Providing business, marketing, and finance classes for moms and their growing businesses, so that they can start growing their businesses and take home more money! 
  • Putting a roof over our head. Even though we are operating out of a church (and they have been very supportive of us!), it is Arizona, and air conditioning isn't cheap. 

All of these costs are necessary in building the support system moms need, and we appreciate your contribution. If you can't donate, there are still ways to help!

  • Share this page. People can't donate if they don't know about it!
  • Like us on Facebook, follow us on Instagram
  • Email us your story. We would love to hear more stories from moms all over. You are not alone! Tell us how a MomPlex in your area would change your life.

Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our business and helping us grow!

story:
About Me

Hi everyone! As you may know, my name is Sandy, and I am going into my third year of architecture at the University of Maryland College Park. I decided to kick start my future in architecture this summer by helping others as well as helping myself! Although I volunteer during the school year for our local Habitat chapter, I wanted to get a sense of how things might be done in a city with conditions different than ours. Consequently, I applied and was accepted to be a team member on a two-week long build trip to Anchorage, AK at the end of August!

About Habitat for Humanity

Habitat for Humanity works to eliminate substandard housing for less fortunate members of its community by constructing neighborhoods of new Energy Star certified houses especially for low-income families. Just like in any other city, a portion of Anchorage’s population is less than affluent and may not have access to decent, affordable housing. Businesses and organizations, trade workers, donors, construction workers/contractors, volunteers, and the families themselves are all involved in the infrastructure and construction processes.

Why Does This Matter?

As an architecture student, I’m learning that an architect is responsible not only for creating beautiful structures but also for ensuring that they build practically and accessibly for the general public. This particular trip caught my attention as Anchorage presents a very special circumstance when it comes to providing a home to those in need – although its summer temperatures can reach a beautiful 70° F, wintertime temperatures can dip to below 0°. I believe that every person has the right to a home that will keep them safe, warm, and healthy. While I'm hoping to learn more about how to build a house and what kind of work goes into the construction processes, I'm also excited to see community health development first hand. Working alongside the people who will be beneficiaries of everyone's dedication is also an experience that builds strong connections and fosters a sense of friendship, responsibility, pride, and social awareness in all participants in the community.

So How About It?

Habitat for Humanity encourages its participants to spread awareness for its cause and also to cover part of their own trip costs by asking friends and family to donate payments that will go towards everything from construction materials to volunteer meals. Therefore, I welcome and am grateful for any donations that you would like to make towards sponsoring my project. Any amount is enormously appreciated, whether $20 or $200. I’ll try and keep you all updated in the forms of emails and photos detailing what I’ve learned, architecturally or socially!

Thank you for taking the time to consider my request and support this effort! If you know anyone who may be interested in contributing to my cause, please feel free to send them this link as well :) Best wishes to you all!

story:
Un projet exceptionnel

Le projet

Coquets, Originaux et pétillants sont les maîtres mots des vêtements Au Pays des Pullip !   Aidez nous à ouvrir notre boutique. Nous avons choisi la capitale car elle est accessible facilement de toute la France, nous permettant d’être plus proche de vous.

« Au Pays des Pullip » cherche à rendre accessible et à développer la communauté autour de sa marque. C’est ainsi qu’a émergé l’idée d’ouvrir une boutique sur Paris, encouragé dans cette voie par votre engouement pour nos créations.

 

Qui sommes nous ?

Au Pays des Pullip est l’association d’une mère et sa fille autour d’une passion commune : la couture. Cela fait cinq ans que nous vous offrons chaque année de nouvelles créations Pullip.

Le début de l’aventure commença par de la lingerie. Nos amis les Pullip ont besoin de leur petite culotte ! Maintenant, la boutique propose une ligne complète de vêtements : robes, t-shirts, pantalons, ensembles lolita et accessoires en tout genre,…

 Depuis l’an dernier, la mode est passée à une taille supérieure : Les BJD (MSD, YOSD et Puki fée), répondant à un désir d’épanouissement des fans.

Toujours à l’écoute de vos attentes, notre boutique s’est développée sur le projet de la BJD (MSD, YOSD et Puki fée) en vous proposant une nouvelle gamme de vêtements adaptés pour elles. Nous avons ainsi pu découvrir une nouvelle communauté et espérons pouvoir réunir les deux autour du même projet.

 

Pullip et BJD

La Pullip est une poupée articulée, créée en 2003 par l’artiste coréen Chunsang Chunha. Ces poupées de collections mesurent environ 30 cm, elles sont en vinyle. Vendues aux alentours de 150€ pour les modèles les plus courants, elles peuvent monter assez cher pour les versions les plus rares.

Chacune des Pullips sorties a sa propre personnalité et son monde attaché. Ainsi nous retrouvons l’univers de Rozen Maiden ou de Alice pour les plus connues… mais aussi des univers bien plus originaux ou touchants, comme celui de Hello Kitty…

Elles se caractérisent principalement par leur grosse tête et leurs grands yeux très expressifs, qui peuvent tourner à droite ou à gauche grâce à une petite manette derrière la tête. Elles peuvent également cligner des yeux.

 

Une Ball Jointed doll est une poupée articulée grâce à des boules. Elle est fabriquée en résine polyruéthane, une matière plastique assez chère, plus solide que la porcelaine, mais qui conserve un aspect délicat. Contrairement aux Pullip, les BJD ont une apparence et des proportions plus réalistes. Il existe une multitude de tailles de BJD :

  • Les tiny ou Puki fée : Ce sont des poupées de 10 à 35 cm de haut d’apparence très enfantine.
  • Les YOSD ou minigem : Modèles d’environ 30 cm.
  • Les MSD : Modèles compris entre 40 et 50 cm.
  • Les SD : Modèles compris entre 55 et 80 cm.

Il existe des exceptions et des créations d’artiste dans le monde des BJD. Nous pouvons ainsi retrouver des BJD animaux et créatures fantastiques aux couleurs innovantes.

 

Un lieu de découverte et de partage

Des rencontres goûters entre fans de Pullip et/ou de BJD seront organisés régulièrement afin de faire partager notre passion autour d’une part de gâteau et d’une tasse thé ! Prendre des photos de nos petites puces et échanger nos avis sur les nouvelles sorties.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Un projet d’atelier « aide à la customisation » et initiation à la manipulation des dolls seront mis en place une fois la boutique développée. Cela permettra d’éviter certaines mésaventures aux nouveaux passionnés.

Un espace détente et un atelier photo sera mis à votre disposition à la boutique.

Vous êtes créateur et vous souhaitez participer à l’aventure ? N’hésitez pas à nous contacter pour nous proposer vos produits : celine@aupaysdespullip.com

 

Objectifs

  • Un point de rendez-vous pour la communauté.
  • Etre à votre écoute de vos attentes et essayer d’y répondre au mieux.
  • Faire découvrir au plus grand monde notre univers.
  • Couvrir les grands événements culturels autour du Japon.
  • Permettre à nos fans d’avoir à disposition l’intégralité de nos collections en boutique.
  • Organiser des événements exceptionnels au sein de la boutique de façon régulière.

 Questions Réponses : 

A quoi va ressemblé la robe de la contribution à 20 et 25€?

Et bien la voila, pour le moment seulement un croquis mais fin juillet vous aurez le droit de voir le prototype fini ainsi que les 3 déjà acheter. Je rappel que ce modèle ne sera pas en vente et seulement livré au personne qui auront pris le temps de nous offrir les contributions correspondante.

 

Quel est la pullip à gagner au tirage au sort ?

la Pullip du tirage au sort sera déterminé en fonction du nombre de participant, plus il y a de participant, plus la doll vaudra cher. Pour le moment, il s'agit d'une hatsune miku custo nude et sans les pieces de fermeture des yeux.

Est ce que les robes créations à 20€ et 25€ sont différentes?

Non, elles seront identique, le prix est juste la pour favoriser les premières contributions. Etre dans les premiers est pour moi quelque chose de magique et j'avais envie de vous offrir une reduction spécial pour l'occasion.

Est ce que si je prend deux créations, elles seront identique?

Vous pourrez choisir soit d'avoir exactement la même soit de prendre deux couleurs différentes. Mais attention seul la couleur changera pas le reste, elles auront la même forme et les même décorations.

information sur les différentes contributions : 

LaPullip en tirage au sort sera tiré lors du LDOLL par un visiteur.

Pour nos amies belge qui souhaiterez participer, vous avez la possibilité de récupérer vos contreparties durant la Japan Expo Belgium.

Toutes les contreparties seront disponible sur nos stands à la récupération à partir du LDOLL.

La contribution bon d'achat de 10€ peut être cumuler, vous pouvez en prendre autant que vous voulez et vous pouvez l'utiliser à n'importe quel moment, même en convention et même sur des produits qui ne sont pas pour Doll. Nous sommes en plein développement de partenariat avec des créatrices d'accessoires pour humain et peluche. 

Dans la contribution Pullip, voici la liste des dolls qui seront disponible au choix :

- pullip : alte, shan ria, dorothy, ala, jaldet, ludmila, batgirl, nella, melissa, merl, neo angelique...

- isul : midnight deja vue, jimmy x, classical mad hatter.

-taeyang : timulus, rayne, horizon, tantus, hash

- dal :milch, magical pink chan, sakura, angelique pretty maretti, classical alice

-yoelume : la première.

 Où ira votre argent ?

Notre projet vous plait, vous avez envie de nous aider, voici où ira votre argent :

L’argent servira au démarrage de l’activité, cela inclut :

  • Matériel destiné à l’agencement de la boutique : vitrines, armoires, divers présentoirs, …
  • Matériel informatique et logiciel de gestion.
  • Mobilier et accessoires de décoration.
  • Les premiers articles de la boutique: pullip, perruques, obitsus, chaussures, vêtements, bijoux, t-shirts, accessoires,….
  • L’équipement de l’espace détente : machines à café, théières, vaisselles, …
  • Les frais d’installation : Location du local et travaux de décoration, de mise aux normes éventuels, mise sous sécurité, …
  • Les coûts des démarches administratives, premiers mois d’assurances, passage des examens professionnels.

 

Nous offrons de superbes contreparties en échange de votre engagement ; qui vont d’un ticket de tombola pour gagner une pullip à la privatisation de l’établissement pour un atelier customisation ou un anniversaire.

Si cette idée vous attire et que vous souhaitez voir exister la boutique « Au Pays des Pullip »,  aidez-nous en participant financièrement. En échange de votre participation vous recevrez des contreparties exclusives.

Les contreparties pourront être récupérées à la boutique, en convention et en dernier recours, envoyées par la poste. Ce choix nous permet de proposer de belles contreparties au meilleur prix tout en conservant une partie de l'argent pour le projet.

Une même personne peut choisir plusieurs contreparties différentes en versant les différentes sommes séparément.

 

D'autres manières de nous aider

N'hésitez pas à partager ce lien avec vos amis et à encouragez les à nous aider et à nous suivre
sur Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/aupaysdespullip?ref=hl
ou sur notre site internet : http://aupaysdespullip.com

Les coûts des démarches administratives, premiers mois d’assurances, passage des examens professionnels.
 
Nous offrons de superbes contreparties en échange de votre engagement ; qui vont d’un ticket de tombola pour gagner une pullip à la privatisation de l’établissement pour un atelier customisation ou un anniversaire.
Si cette idée vous attire et que vous souhaitez voir exister la boutique « Au Pays des Pullip »,  aidez-nous en participant financièrement. En échange de votre participation vous recevrez des contreparties exclusives.
Les contreparties pourront être récupérées à la boutique, en convention et en dernier recours, envoyées par la poste. Ce choix nous permet de proposer de belles contreparties au meilleur prix tout en conservant une partie de l'argent pour le projet.
Une même personne peut choisir plusieurs contreparties différentes en versant les différentes sommes séparément.
 
D'autres manières de nous aider
N'hésitez pas à partager ce lien avec vos amis et à encouragez les à nous aider et à nous suivre sur Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/aupaysdespullip?ref=hl ou sur notre site internet : http://aupaysdespullip.com

story:
Saucisse Gourmand...The Sausage Pie People

Have you ever had something so good you were willing to fight over it? When was the last time that item was food?

From the first time I introduced an Italian Sausage Pie people have asked me to describe the taste.  If you were to ask anyone that has ever tried one, you will get a lot of answers. My favorite will always be, “Just try one, they’re delicious.”
As a chef, the joy of creating an item that everyone enjoys, regardless of their palette, is amazing.

When I first found this recipe in my great-grandmother’s old cookbook, it made me smile. She had been a constant in my family and food had always been important. I didn’t know where she had obtained the recipe and it was strange that I couldn’t remember her ever making it.

My original sausage pie recipe is an adaptation of the one that I found. Oddly enough, I can’t remember ever eating this as a child. I’m sure I would have fond memories of that spectacular crust, hot and fresh from the oven.

I cannot tell you how many times I have been threatened, coerced and bribed for the recipe, but I kept listening to the little whisper that told me to keep this tasty  dish a secret.  What started out as taste this, try that, turned into learning not to walk away from a plate of this pie.  It's funny to watch the look of disappointment that comes with the knowledge that you were taken for your slice. 

Seventeen years after I found that recipe, a friend had the chance to taste what is now our Signature Saucisse Italiano. He coerced me into make him at least one a week. Under one condition, I had to charge him for them. Three months later, I had too many orders to fill and not enough time to fill them.  That was the inception of Saucisse Gourmand, Inc. 

My chicken recipe Signature Saucisse Poullet was a choice originally made, because my nephew couldn’t eat pork as a child. To date it almost equals the sausage as the #1 favorite. As for the taste, a simple chicken, vegetable, cheese and flaky pastry dish has a whole new meaning.

Our products are made with locally grown produce and we do not use any salt, pepper, spices or oils. As unbelievable as that sounds we have managed to create a product that tastes incredible.

Fortunately, our business that started on a plate has outgrown the confines of its environment. We are literally feeding a football team on a weekly basis on top of all our other orders and we are thinking about distribution. Right now we are looking to start with $5000.00 so that we can start expanding our current facility, move into a new one, or rent shared commercial space in the interim. We are ready to take on new customers, as we start taking small steps in that direction.

We are weighing the difference in cost between purchases of new equipment versus moving into a new commercial facility. With your help we are looking to make this cumbersome task a little easier. Along the way we want to feed as many people as possible. Please tell all your of friends about us and get your contribution in early so you can taste one of the most amazingly simple, yet delicious dinner pie you will ever taste. Then visit the website @ www.saucissegourmand.com and see what else we have to offer.

Saucisse Gourmand, Inc. 

We are The Sausage Pie People…Enjoy!!

story:
Television is the family business. My mother worked her way up from an intern to producer for PBS and my father used his artistic skills to become “That Paint Guy”; the painting version of Mrs. Fix-it. My brother uses his inherited skills for directing but I want to explore set and prop production.

Anyone who knows me knows I can’t keep my walls white. I’m always itching to paint the next big mural and eager to recreate sets I’ve seen on my favorite television shows and movies. The same is true for scrap pieces of wood; it’s difficult for me not to change something mundane into a prop recreation of a thing I’ve seen on TV.

For my girlfriend’s (and my wallet’s) sanity we’ve started to look at career options for my unusual habits. All roads led to Los Angeles. Not only is it the mecca of film production, but we have connections there that are irreplaceable in the business.

After posting my portfolio online I’ve received job offers good for September. Luckily, that’s when our lease is up on our Orlando home.

We just need a bit of help to uproot our lives and start all over in this new and exciting place.

The minimum that we’re looking at is $5,000

First things first: before we move we have to settle our debts to friends here.
Our roommate has been very generous in letting us stay with him on a credit system while we figure out our next move. We owe him quite a lot and although he’s fine with us paying him back over the years we couldn’t live with ourselves if we left before paying him back completely.

Next is moving fees. We’re spreading our dollars very thin by relying on friends along our route to house us every night, but it’ll still be a five-day journey full of gas costs and food bills.

Lastly, we have the living expenses for the first month. We're digging in our heels to get paying jobs as soon as possible, but we know how difficult the market is. We know we’re going to have to rely on support to make our car payment, insurance payment, food and lodging costs. And then, when we find an apartment, we’ll need to pay application fees, down payment, and first two months’ rent!

We know it’ll be difficult to do (and frankly, $5,000 isn’t enough) but we need to start somewhere. Anything worth doing is going to be difficult, but it helps to have support wherever you can find it.


Thank you for taking the time to read through this. Even if you can't send a dollar our way, you can help by sharing this on email, facebook, twitter, tumblr, or whatever your preferred social network is. Every single dollar is another ten miles in our tank so never feel like you aren't helping enough.

Thank you

story:
Life is About The Experiences.

We've started this mission with the hopes of enriching the lives of our members by providing their local cities and towns with a quality community engagement activity known as Mad Run Ventures!

We've designed a community interactive adventure that takes place right in your backyard. Best of all, CASH prizes for the winners!

How well do you know your community? 

MRV designs adventures around your town's local attractions. With the help of each community, we use landmarks and geographical attractions as checkpoints throughout the race.The more you know about your town, the faster you'll win the prizes.

This adventure can't be found on a screen.

A great adventure helps the mind to stay creative, the body to keep active, and allows the eyes enjoy the wonders all around.

It's race day! What you should you expect?

7:45 am - Arrive at the starting line.

8:00 am - First clue is announced: "Instead of a head rush from going across the country, you would have been in the (blank) rush during the time this place was first discovered for being so "quick",. 

8:45 am - Arrive to the second location
- Hike to the next clue approximately 2.6 miles of intermediate hiking 2 - 3 hours depending on pace to the clue and back.

Noon - Arrive at 3rd location, figure out what the clue wanted you to look for.

1pm - Arrive at 4th location find next clue on park trail. 

2pm - Arrive at finish line but have to find the final part of the clue to get credit. Then hangout with everyone who took the adventure and set up a fun evening with new friends. :)

So where is this being held?

The first event will be held in the San Jose, CA. area. There is 5 parks/trails lined up. All clues/puzzles are set to go. 

While the Indiegogog campaign is running we'll be working to set up the next the area for next month, which is San Francisco.

The following month we'll be flying to the east coast to start expanding areas on the east coast starting first in Boston Ma.

It’s more than just an adventure.

This is time with people close to you. This is seeing or revisiting memories you haven’t thought of in 5, 10, 20 or 30 years. Bring back together a group of friends you haven’t seen since college for a venture other than just drinks.

This started as just an idea and has become something that has a huge meaning in all our lives. We want to help people create and revisit the moments that stay with us for a lifetime.

Finally, what is it that we need to do, for these fun times and memories to begin?

YOU! All we need is you.

With your help, we need to:

Rent all the parks needed to host the first broadcasted event. (That includes 5 parks!)

Set up 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place prizes for the event.

Hire helping hands.

Marketing the race in local publications,

Get help to give back to your communities and charities.

Take this amazing idea and turn it into a reality for everyone to get a chance to enjoy.

Risks & Challenges

There is a chance that getting permits to work with certain parks will be trickier than others! But with creative thinking we will be able to make it happen!

For example 2 of the parks in San Jose were only available if there was a non profit hosting the event. For about 15 seconds we were stuck and said, "Well now what?".

Light bulb! Let's get a non profit to host our events and we'll donate a percentage of our earnings. All in all it was an added bonus, we get to give back to our communities and help fund a non profit program.


Being a start-up company, many of the non profits we initially contacted didn't have an interest in working with us. We were not deterred. After reaching out to about 75 non-profits in the local area, we got on board with Any Soldier.


We are prepared for setbacks, our amazing team has been running madly to prepare for the events. If there was anything to arise that we haven't yet seen, we'll view it as an adventure and get creative!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word.

Share us on Facebook.

Tweet our Link.

If you know bloggers that may be interested in what were doing. That's be AWESOME!!

Mad Run Ventures: A change of pace for the better and for a lifetime!

story:
Fly BNK to FAM

Having a family member sick is no fun. We'd like to fly Bink out for a family reunion and the surgery later this month, so he can be with his family without worrying about anything on the west coast.

    What We Need & What You Get

    Here's what's up:

    • Flights are about $700 right now
    • We need folks to pitch in fast - he needs to fly out by 6/21, and airfare could go up
    • $50 means I make you truffles. Just sayin'.

    Can't give?

    Just let Bink know you're thinking about him, a caring community makes a big difference.

story:
Venice Football Club Swag

For our non-profit Venice Football Club (VFC) we are starting an additional little fundraiser for the second half of the world cup. Please donate and help us building the club further.


We all do this on a voluntary basis, but need funds to build out the club and make it as much fun as possible. Any surplus this project will generate will be donated to the Athletic Football Club (http://athleticfc.org/) a wonderful soccer program on the west side, that offers scholarships to underprivileged kids to learn and master the game in great team spirit.

The official VFC merchandising will be for VFC members and their friends only. We do not ship the swag, you can only pick it up at the club. T-Shirts and scarves are live-printed today (Sunday June 22nd) at the club.

Printing will be done by our friends from http://familyindustriesla.com/


Forza, Forza, Forza VFC.

Tobi, Eric, Andreas & Marc

story:
Hi everyone. My name is Gina Epps. I am married to my BFF Reggie and we have an incredible little boy named Jax. I've taught high school health and pe the past 15 years until I lost my teaching career for being a cannabis activist. I was pulled over "for an expired license plate sticker" that wasn't expired. I was illegally searched (Moms For Marijuana sticker IN my car was their "probable cause") and arrested during my lunch break while pregnant in January of 2013. The "drug" dog found an empty baggie, a cashed out bowl, rolling papers and a lighter in a bag in my center console. Mind you, this was one block from the high school I worked at.

Long story short, I was forced to resign with threat of stealing my Illinois teaching license indefinitely. I was not even allowed to wait until court. After thousands of dollars, no job and a baby on the way ALL CHARGES WERE DROPPED!! All they did was fuel my fire. I was already determined to spend the rest of my life fighting for a better future for our son Jax. NOW...I am going to make it my mission to make sure medical marijuana patients get their medicine. Unfortunately our home state of Illinois has one of the most strict MMJ laws in the world so we needed to move to Washington. We will finally be legal medical marijuana patients and will be able to grow our own medicine.  Washington MMJ patients are protected through September 2015. There are quite a few obstacles in the future but nothing that can't be fought and won. I have been mentored the past couple years by an amazing man with over 40 years of grow experience. I started a small business at the end of last year called Mamaepps Hemp Oil Soaps where I make 100% natural hemp oil soaps. This gave us the idea for Mamaepps Grow.


At Mamaepps we are dedicated to providing products that create a more natural and healthy lifestyle. To accommodate the medical marijuana patients we continually maintain at least 30 various strains of high quality medical marijuana. With passion and experience Mamaepps will be able to provide the medical marijuana patient with high grade products to help manage several different ailments. We understand that the patient relies on high quality pesticide free medicine to live full and productive lives. It is our honor to offer such a product to the Seattle/Tacoma area patients.


Our products are the flowers from the Indica and Sativa plants, as well as mixtures of 40/60% and 50/50% as indicated by the prescribing physician. We will distribute the medicine wholesale locally. Strains may vary from grow to grow.  At Mamaepps we are as hard working as they come. We are passionate and willing to go the extra mile to get the job done.  We are all in this together and WILL be successful.

Mamaepps will only employ those with the same value and passion for superb plant growth. They will be willing to do whatever it takes to deliver top quality products to the Washington Medical Marijuana patients. We believe to achieve this level of success a respectful and open line of communication is a must.

Mamaepps future is based on the ever changing needs of the industry and the community. Our immediate future will contain edibles for those who cannot or choose not to smoke or vaporize. As a lifelong advocate of a healthier lifestyle and seeker of alternative solutions, Medical Marijuana is the only sensible direction to take our vision of a happier and healthier society.

PLEASE HELP US HELP OTHERS.  

With your support we will be able to help as many people as humanly possible. Cannabis saves lives and to be apart of something like that is indescribable.  

We are trying to raise $10,000 in the next 45 days. We realize that is a large sum of money. It is asking a lot for people to help fund our campaign and put their faith in us. We want to assure you that we WILL make you proud of your donation. It is going to a good cause and every penny will be used to make this vision a reality. We are moving to Washington from the Chicago area to make this happen. We will have two rooms for the grow. One room will be for the veg stage and one room will be for the flower stage. 

We want complete open lines of communication. We will post updates constantly and we will post weekly pictures throughout the grow cycle.  We want everyone to be involved every step of the way.

If for some reason we do not meet our goal of $10,000 we want to assure you that every penny we do raise will still go toward funding our business. We are going to Washington to help assure patients get their medicine.  Anyone that knows us knows that there is NO quit in us.  We will be a part of making this world a better place, one day at a time.


Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign, we appreciate it greatly.  If you are unable to contribute monetarily please share our campaign and send some positive vibes.  You can also help us get the word out by using the Indiegogo share tools. We can't express how grateful we are. We will attach all of the links from everything we are associated with. Please feel free to check out any of the work. Thank you again. If you have any questions or concerns please don't hesitate to contact us at mamaeppshemp@gmail.com



ONE LOVE

We believe to achieve this level of success a respectful and open line of communication is a must.Mamaepps future is based on the ever changing needs of the industry and the community. Our immediate future will contain edibles for those who cannot or choose not to smoke or vaporize. As a lifelong advocate of a healthier lifestyle and seeker of alternative solutions, Medical Marijuana is the only sensible direction to take our vision of a happier and healthier society. PLEASE HELP US HELP OTHERS.  With your support we will be able to help as many people as humanly possible. Cannabis saves lives and to be apart of something like that is indescribable.  We are trying to raise $10,000 in the next 45 days. We realize that is a large sum of money. It is asking a lot for people to help fund our campaign and put their faith in us. We want to assure you that we WILL make you proud of your donation. It is going to a good cause and every penny will be used to make this vision a reality. We are moving to Washington from the Chicago area to make this happen. We will have two rooms for the grow. One room will be for the veg stage and one room will be for the flower stage. We want complete open lines of communication. We will post updates constantly and we will post weekly pictures throughout the grow cycle.  We want everyone to be involved every step of the way.If for some reason we do not meet our goal of $10,000 we want to assure you that every penny we do raise will still go toward funding our business. We are going to Washington to help assure patients get their medicine.  Anyone that knows us knows that there is NO quit in us.  We will be a part of making this world a better place, one day at a time.Thank you for taking the time to read our campaign, we appreciate it greatly.  If you are unable to contribute monetarily please share our campaign and send some positive vibes.  You can also help us get the word out by using the Indiegogo share tools. We can't express how grateful we are. We will attach all of the links from everything we are associated with. Please feel free to check out any of the work. Thank you again. If you have any questions or concerns please don't hesitate to contact us at mamaeppshemp@gmail.comONE LOVE

story:
Short Summary

I moved to FL from the Midwest in 2008, but due to personal reasons I decided that I needed to head back home.

I loaded up my van and my two dogs and left in the spring of last year. As soon as I crossed the state line into GA, I ran into trouble.

My van was initially diagnosed with a faulty water-pump and my estimated repair cost was about 400.00. While I was working to make the money needed to fix the car, one of my dogs became critically ill. She passed away in my arms on Aug 18, 2013. Not long after that my vehicle was shot and destroyed by vandals leaving me completely stranded.

The Impact

I was hit with yet another blow when my surviving dog was diagnosed with cancer in February of this year,  and my own health also began to decline.  I am attempting to raise funds to get back home so I can obtain medical services that I cannot get here. I have a friend who is working hard to make sure that I have both stable housing, and access to those services that I need when I get there. This situation is extremely urgent.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out to as many people as you can - every little bit helps!
  • Don't forget to use the share tools!
  • If you can think of a perk that I should add, and/or want to join my team, let me know! I love the concept of planting trees and volunteering in order to pay it forward.  If you can think of other things in that vein, let me know!

story:
Haircut Fundraiser for Gabe Colston

Hi, my name is Matt Hagen and I am currently living in Detroit spending a year serving the city through Youthworks-Detroit.  I have a lot of hair. I am going to cut it all off sometime this Lenten season, but why not help someone along the way.  With your scissor-friendly donations we can create the opportunity of a lifetime for an excellent young Detoiter.

Youthworks has been running outreach to Detroit youth since 1995.  Much of what makes this work possible is the volunteer service by young men and women from all around the world.  For years, Youth Initiatives has been sending their incredible young people from Belfast, Northern Ireland to serve with us at Youthworks-Detroit.  And with your help this could be the year we send one of our own youth to serve a summer in Belfast!  

What Donors will get

  • Donors of $10 will get pictures including a before, an after, and anything in between.  

  • Donors of $25 will get a lock of my hair!

  • Donors of $100 or more will be able to choose any hairstyle for me to cut and wear my hair in for a full day as I travel around Detroit doing various services.  Mullet, mohawk, bowl, cornrows, whatever!  You could just send me an ugly shape and I will buzz it into that shape.

More about Gabe

Gabe Colston is a highschool Senior who has been a part of our Christian youthgroup and Street Team summer job program for years.  His consistency says a lot about his willingness to commit to the important things in life.  This last year he has grown a lot in maturity and leadership through spending time and building relationships with our summer outreach volunteers(many of whom are from Belfast).  Unfortunately Gabe can't afford to fly across an ocean any time soon, so he needs your help!

Reasonable Questions Answered 

  • This is not a professional fundraiser so donations are NOT tax deductible.  

  • All the funds raised will go directly to me (Matt Hagen) and I will personally deliver them to Gabe so he can support his direct needs this summer.

  • If we do not reach our goal of $1000, we will still collect all donations committed through this site.

  • Right now our goal is tentatively $1000,  this is a rough estimate for his plane ticket, rent, food and anything else he may need for a Belfast summer.  

  • Whatever else Gabe needs after this fundraiser we will raise through other, less hairy endeavors.    


Youth Initiatives http://www.youthinitiatives.com/


*Photo Credit-Yvette Rock

story:
This is the second part of the YWCA of Noyemberyan's campaign to raise funds to replace our rotting windows and doors. Part 1 raised $800 from 3 countries. These funds allowed us to replace 4 windows that didn't have glass allowing us to have classes two months longer than we could have without the assistance. This is a wonderful start and we are so grateful! Now we can clearly see the impact new windows and doors make we are more motivated to finish what we have started and still need your help. 

Here is the link to our past campaign and further details are below:

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ywca-of-armenia-needs-help-staying-warm-this-winter/x/6123240


This campaign is raising funds on behalf of National YWCA of Armenia and Sarkis Zurabyan Kindergarten, regally registered nonprofits (NGOs) in The Republic of Armenia. This campaign has been created by the nonprofit and all contributions will go directly towards the stated purpose.

Who We Are:

We are the National YWCA of Armenia, a 100% volunteer run organization that focuses on improving the quality of life of women and children in Armenia. When we began working in Noyemberyan (a small town in the northeast corner of the country), we were given an old, unused building by the mayor’s office. We work closely with Sarkis Zurabyan Kindergarten, an educational nonprofit for children, and share all our space. We have used this building for 12 years to put on skill-based educational classes to make local women more employable, seminars on health issues, leadership skills and getting women involved in government, and we hold daily educational classes for children that include language, arts and math. We also have a small sewing center that provides income for several women.

What We Need:

  • We need to replace all of our window and doors to insulate our building.
  • The replacement of 20 windows ($154 each) and 10 doors ($192 each) in our building will cost us approximately 2,059,250 dram or $5,000 US dollars factoring in equipment, installation and labor.
  • In Part 1 of our campaign we raised $800, contributed from 3 countries. These funds went a long way and allowed us to replace 4 windows that were in the worst condition. 
  • Since 100% of the money we earn or is donated to us goes directly into programming and materials for our classes, we have very little to contribute to the essential renovations our building needs.

The Impact:

  • These renovations will allow us to continue programing during the long winter months, which we are currently unable to do due to the extreme temperatures inside the building.
  • Replacing all our exterior windows and doors will also help us protect our equipment from the elements and allow us to use them for many years to come.
  • Our organization is 100% volunteer run, which means 100% of the funds raised in this campaign will go directly towards supplies and labor to renovate the building.

How You Can Help:

  • By contributing any amount, you put us closer to keeping our building warm and insulated for many years to come, allowing us to continue our work during the winter.
  • By sharing the link to our campaign and letting others know what we are trying to accomplish, you will help us reach our goal.
  • Follow us on facebook and keep up with our progress on this campaign: http://www.facebook.com/pages/YWCA-Noyemberyan-Armenia/121387264631445
  • Please contact council-ywcaarmenia@rambler.ru and we will be happy to send you more information about what we do and how you can help.

We are forever grateful for your support to our project.

Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

I am Ken Smith, Pastor of a local church in Bridgeport CT. We are a very small organization who have decided to stop watching the news about the poverty and hopelessness in the city and have decided to get off the sidelines and do something about it.

I have witnessed families showing up at locations of the city for help just to get turned away because programs ran out of food and shelter related resources. I have seen families lose their homes and jobs with nowhere to turn. I cannot begin to convey the stories of those who stop by my church to get help only for us to turn them away.  It is the very lack of resources that causes us to tell a family, sorry, we ran out of food, winter coats, clothing, and we cannot help save your home.

Members of my church have put together an audacious plan to impact families by meeting their needs.

The funds received from this campaign will be used as follows: Help purchase a commercial freezer so that we can provide meats and other frozen foods free; expand the food pantry to store more non-perishables items; purchase back-to school bags and supplies for 2013/2104 school year; make special hygiene packages to give to the many who are on skid-row, and purchase machinery to clean up and maintain the neighborhood streets and yards. It will also be used to help purchase bread that’s given to senior homes and those in the community. In addition, we will do a home make-over for a family whose roof got damaged during the winter storms in the Northeast. The damaged roof has rendered one of the rooms unusable.The walls in the home are badly damaged. The three children living in the home are in dire need of beds and their furniture is broken down and unusable.

The Impact

“If you wait until you can do everything for everybody, instead of something for somebody, you’ll end up not doing nothing for nobody.” ~ Malcom Bane

Your contribution will impact and change lives one person at a time. Helping a community starts with helping one first. When people learn that complete strangers care enough to help provide for them, it means the world to them.  When we use your contributions to help people around the community, we do so with NO STRINGS attached. We will never give something and ask for something in return.

Over the past seven years, I have had the privilege of witnessing many lives change as a result of people helping people. We are just a conduit to get the type of resources to people that literally transform their lives. Two years back we ran a program called Angel Food that provided low cost food to anyone who desired to get the food. We witnessed people from the Urban and Suburban communities benefit from the program. When people could not afford the food, we simply went into our pockets and purchased it for them. Over the years we have given tons of clothing, food, school supplies, and one weeks’ worth of groceries to many during Thanksgiving time. Feel rest assured that your contribution will be maximized to its fullest.
