story:
What is TREND?

Something that Philadelphia's LGBT community and its allies need. And, that also means that TREND needs YOU!  We need your thoughts, your content, your ideas, your images, your stories, your help, and, right now, your contributions to embark on one of the most exciting adventures in new media in Philadelphia's history.

Specifically, TREND wants YOU, the LGBT community to be "key stakeholders" in the creation of ethical, representative, and technology-savvy media covering LGBT news, culture, politics, gossip, food, travel, arts and entertainment and events.

Right now, a need exists for contemporary LGBT-focused media in Philadelphia that is representative and responsive to all segments of the city's LGBT community, including: people of color, women, trans individuals, those living with HIV/AIDS, youth and all other individuals making up the richly diverse LGBT community.

Through user-generated content, including picture submissions, news tips, and interviews with community members and community-owned organizations and businesses, TREND will be the premiere source for LGBT focused news and culture.

Using the investigative reporting techniques and good government focus of Executive Editor Josh Kruger with the support of editing and writing staff with many veterans and others familiar to Philadelphia's LGBT community, TREND will add a much-needed voice of honesty and transparency in city's LGBT community. This focus on honesty and fairness will go a long way in welcoming all voices to the discussion and that ethics and accountability are delivered to the community-at-large. These are standards paramount to TREND.  Philly needs a journalistic watchdog with an eye for what's relevant, stylish, and sexy:  that's TREND.

Community Transparency and Accountability

To operate for the inaugural few months before ramping up web-based and email blast advertising to become self-sufficient, TREND needs an initial investment for equipment and start-up capital.

In exchange for community investment in TREND, we promise to all stakeholders: full financial transparency of all expenditures of community-investments in the publication on a monthly basis; monthly reports on the representations of people of color, those living with HIV/AIDS, women, youth, and transgender individuals; and, the best content for and by Philadelphia's LGBT community.

But we can't start this groundbreaking effort without your help right now.

In particular, in order to streamline budget operations and establish financial health for the future, TREND requires capital investments in equipment to operate exclusively via information online. With pictures and content generated entirely in-house, TREND circumvents the costly and prohibitive overhead associated with print. And, with an existing reach of over 34,000 readers, Executive Editor Josh Kruger plans to migrate his existing readership over to TREND and build upon this readership base and keep TREND vibrant, current, and healthy.

Why TREND?  Why should I contribute?

In 2013, we're in the age of full transparency, honesty, and instant information. With a blog that is updated on a daily basis with daily features on small business, politics, events, gossip, food, travel, arts and entertainment, and community-minded efforts, TREND will provide instant information accessible to online readers for FREE. Above all, TREND will be the respected, trusted news source in Philadelphia for its burgeoning LGBT population. By focusing on social media and online efforts, TREND will forge new ground as the primary LGBT news source using social media, user generated content, and news tips to remain current, viable, and relevant.

Over 34,000 readers have shared and read articles that are embarking into new territory in relation to good government, LGBT issues, and media critiques. But, we cannot take the next step and create something new, fresh, and vibrant without your help right now. Our community has a long history of action, starting with marches in the 1960s in front of Independence Hall culminating to today's landmark equality status in the cradle of liberty, Philadelphia. Yet, these efforts required key investments in the beginning to get going.

That's why we're asking for your help right now.

We want to be owned by the community, not beholden to corporations, politicians, political parties or special interest groups. To be truly independent, we need to be owned by the community-at-large through your initial investments. That's why we're doing something fresh and innovative: crowd funding the initial start-up costs to get TREND on its feet for the first three to five months with investments right now.

Watchdog Status

Over the past several months, readers of www.joshkruger.com have repeatedly asked for ways they can help influence the political process to best equip and assist Philadelphia LGBT community reach its goals of true equality and accurate representation in media.  As a result, through uncovering corruption rife in politics, TREND will offer the investigative reporting lost in the past decade due to cutbacks at mainstream media outlets and institutional media.  By focusing on corruption together with a sexy, media savvy, and hip approach, TREND will step in and become the driving force necessary to keep our leaders accountable, our organizations healthy, and our community vibrant.

In the words of Supreme Court Justice Potter Stewart, "In absence of governmental checks and balances, the only effective restraint upon executive policy and power may lie in an enlightened citizenry - in an informed and critical public opinion which alone can here protect the values of democratic government."

Make a contribution today to start something Philadelphia has never seen before:  community media started with community content, funds, and accountability.  Become a TRENDSETTER today by selecting any of the many levels of giving and kickstarting one of the most adventurous and exciting media endeavors in Philly history.

Make a contribution today to start something Philadelphia has never seen before:  community media started with community content, funds, and accountability.  Become a TRENDSETTER today by selecting any of the many levels of giving and kickstarting one of the most adventurous and exciting media endeavors in Philly history.

story:
The Challenge

In 2010, we discovered that our son, Dag*, was being sexually molested.  We have been working hard to help him heal and grow past this, but it has been a very difficult few years. 

Dag has many special needs and is now unable to attend regular camps like most children are able to... and it's breaking his heart.  After months of searching, we have found a special camp that is specifically designed for boys who are sexual abuse survivors.

The camp's Board of Directors has offered to allow Dag to attend the camp for free and we are very excited and grateful!  Now the challenge... We live in Fort Wayne, Indiana and the camp is based out of Astoria, Oregon.   

The Solution

Here's the plan: Dag and Mom fly out to Oregon together and arrive the day before the camp.  Mom and Dag stay that first night in a hotel together, then Mom rents a car and drives two hours to the camp to drop him off.  During Dag's stay at camp, Mom finds someone's couch to sleep on (thanks https://www.couchsurfing.org/).  After camp ends, Mom and Dag stay one more night in a hotel, then leave out the next morning. 

Airfare (2 Round Trip Tickets for Mom and Son) - appx. $900

Rental Car - appx. $300

Hotel (2 Nights) - appx. $100

Food and Incidentals - appx. $200

The Impact

A child with Autism and now Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder, Dag has restrictions that most children will never face, for his health, safety and emotional development.  He can't go to regular camps.  He can't have sleepovers with his friends.  He can't even walk down the street alone to see if a friend can play. 

Imagine the experience that this will be for Dag!  Not only will he be able to share the camaraderie of other children in a camp environment, but he will be in a safe environment, where the counselors and therapists are specially trained to handle every challenge he comes with.  He will be in a camp with a one-on-one assistant and (for the first time) he will meet other children who have gone through what he has gone through.

This experience for Dag will surely be one of the most memorable of his childhood and his entire life.  Please help us realize this dream with him. 

 

*Dag is a nickname for our son.  For his privacy, we're sure you understand why we will not disclose his name or Mom's name publicly.

  

Want to share the Facebook event with your friends?  Go here:

https://www.facebook.com/events/550820934955750/

story:
Our Story

Wish Granters is a non-profit organization in the Boise area that grants wishes to adults with terminal illnesses. Here at Knife River we heard about this awesome organization earlier this year. We got involved with a fundraiser to send a young man with kidney failure to New York with his wife. 


After putting out a donation jar with a copy of all the new wishes we were notified that one of the people on the list was actually a relative of a Knife River employee. We'd like to make his wish happen. His name is Terry and he has cancer. His last wish is only to see Arlington National Cemetery. He's been involved with the National Guard and patriotism has always been important to him.


What We Need 

The cost to make the wish happen is $2,500. We are thrilled to announce that Knife River will be matching contributions up to $500!

story:
Our Story

We all know someone that is always there to help. That person will drop what they are doing, or add it to their already huge workload and give you their all. Without question or without thought of payback or compensation.

That person is known as the Phoenix. She got this name from her ability to, when knocked down, to get back up again. And again... She has the heart of a lion and the will of steel. Now, I am afraid, she needs your help.She would never ask for it. That is why I am doing this.

Phoenix was first diagnosed with Breast Cancer in 2000. She had chemo and radiation and moved on. It returned again in 2006. Again, more chemo, a double masectomy, hysterectomy and countless other surgeries. It returned again last year. It is now Stage IV.

She was raised in Setauket ,LI, NY in the area of the largest concentration of breat cancer on LI, I think in NY ,too. Her sister died at the age of 27 from Leukemia. Both of her parents are deceased. Sjhe has no known relatives. My immediate family cannot or will not help her. There are new medicines available, new pain medications, but our insurance plan doesn't cover those. We already pay thousands of dollars a month for medicines, treatments, etc. Since she is in continous pain, we are always looking for new medicines. We heard of a new one but it costs $800.00 a month extra. A new oral chemo drug  the Dr. suggested is $600.00 plus a month. This is on top of all the other treatments and medicines. She just got out of the hospital after 5 days. Her white blood cell count dropped so low, she had developed fever/infection/neutropena.

Phoenix has helped out friends and strangers alike. Please find it in your heart to help her now when she needs you.


The Impact

By helping Phoenix, you are helping many people, and animals too. Phoenix has been a Vegan for over 22 years and rescues, feeds and loves all animals and pets. Help Phoenix so she can continue what she does best. Helping others.


What We Need & What You Get

I figure she needs about $12,500.00 tro get her new medicines, and other things. Vitamins, supplements and other nutritional products. Also, she has had accupuncture in the past and it has helped ease her suffering temporarily and given her energy. As she has Lymphodyema in her left arm, she should also be having regular massage and body therapies for that.

I am looking into some things to offer for donations but I haven't gotten that far yet. I would like to offer at least a Tshirt or other item in return. I will post as soon as I have made arrangements.


Other Ways You Can Help

Feel free to share this with others. I avoided putting this on Facebook so I don't upset our children.

story:
Coffee Liqueur - Pursuing the Passion (made in America!)

The Farish-Georges Coffee Company is about to head off on an amazing path with my very own premium Coffee Liqueur Pre-Mix.  But this is not the beginning of my journey.  I have been diligently pursuing the perfect coffee product for over a decade.

Made entirely of American ingredients, including 100% pure Kona Coffee from Hawai'i (the only state in the USA where coffee is grown), the Coffee Liqueur Pre-Mix is a product that is mixed with vodka to produce a fabulous coffee liqueur with zero wait time!  No other coffee liqueur product on the market today can make the same claims that I am most proud of:

  • Uses 100% pure Kona Coffee (finest coffee in the world) grown in America
  • The coffee ingredient is prepared using an ages-old cold filtration process that produces a wonderfully smooth flavor with less acidity
  • Produced entirely in America with American ingredients
  • Mixes immediately with your favorite vodka to produce a fine coffee liqueur that is unmatched in quality and flavor

The Coffee Liqueur Pre-Mix is the result of hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars in product development carried out and born solely by me.  This was the only way to ensure the absolute finest quality.  From the time I began working directly with small farm coffee growers over 10 years ago on their marketing and sales efforts, through my own coffee sales over the Internet, up until today, I produced several different coffee products.  All products were based exclusively on Kona Coffee, and were prepared and sold locally.  By the very nature of Kona Coffee being the finest gourmet coffee in the world, these products were appreciated throughout the region.  The culmination of years of work in these various activities brings me to this highly critical point in the future of the Farish-Georges Coffee Company. 

PROJECT: The formal introduction of my coffee liqueur pre-mix will actually occur in two phases.  The first phase will be as one of the primary ingredients in a premium coffee liqueur product from an American distillery.  This is where I am in need of funding assistance.  The distillery I am working with will require a significant volume of the coffee liqueur pre-mix.  I need to purchase ingredients, rent commercial kitchen time and equipment, and deliver the product within the next 30 days to meet the volume requirements of the initial batch of coffee liqueur.

The project goal amount listed is the bare minimum I need to deliver a first batch to the distillery.  I would like to exceed that goal in order to deliver a double amount to the distillery.

A second phase (timing is dependent on the success of the first phase) will be the preparation and packaging of the coffee liqueur pre-mix to be sold as a standalone product over the internet as well as in retail settings.  The only product development work to be done is related to the final packaging.  If needed, funding is expected to come from a portion of the profits from the first phase.

The sole focus today is to deliver the best coffee liqueur ingredient to the distillery.  That is where America and the rest of the world will be introduced to an amazing coffee liqueur.

All along the way, this journey has introduced me to so many wonderful people: small farm coffee growers, the people who lovingly tend their land, micro-roasters, ingredient manufacturers, micro-distillers, and all the people who have enjoyed my products.....the customers.  This business is really all about people connections and providing an enhancement to interactions between each other.

Thank you for taking the time to review about my project.  Please support this work.  I will keep you informed of the progress, in addition to the rewards described on this page.  Know that I am passionate about my work, diligent and resolute, and unrelenting in my pursuit of excellence.  And if there was ever any question about my loyalty, one only needs to look at my faith (a lifetime), my "day job" (34+ years with the same company), and my marriage (27+ years with the same beautiful woman).  This will be successful, and will become a bright legacy for my children.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Updated 9/25/13

  1. Indiegogo is a crowdfunding site—and we are here to raise funds for BannerSeason. We need your financial support.
  2. BannerSeason will use all donations to improve our current website and process.
  3. Groups and teams will then be able to use a more robust bannerseason.com to run a profitable fundraising campaign.

Contact us if you need further clarification. Please read on...

WHO WE ARE:

Hi, my name is Rich Hansen and I'm a sports dad. I've had two sons play baseball and my daughter is a swimmer. All three kids participated in youth sports and then made their respective high school teams. My wife and I were introduced to the concept of "additional funds" necessary for our kids' participation early on. Teams do their best to hold fundraisers, but the results are seldom enough and who pays? Parents.

When the economy took a turn in 2008, my son's team struggled to sell sponsorships on expensive outfield signs. I've spent my career in advertising and design, so I had this idea and created the Walk-Up Pennant™—an over-sized (24" x 54") vinyl pennant based on traditional felt pennants. Sponsorships are now sold with tiered pricing (gold, silver, and bronze) which allows for a broad range of sponsors. Plus teams have flexibility to set their own pricing.

But it wasn't all about raising funds. I really wanted to celebrate the athletes (who often don't have another sports experience beyond high school). Walk-Up Pennants featuring the athletes are created and displayed alongside sponsors and it's terrific recognition.

I've since created other fundraising and recognition products—as well as an online store. Teams and individuals can create a variety of items to sell or just enjoy.

WHAT WE'VE DONE:

We call our company BannerSeason. We can help you have a successful and memorable season—on and off the field. This is what we've done to make that happen:

  • Designed professional looking products—and you set your own resale pricing
  • Tested products and selected quality partners
  • Launched our website and introduced the fundraising program (bannerseason.com)
  • Helped teams and groups raise thousands of dollars
  • Created an online store where you can create additional recognition products—for fun or profit (bannerseasonshop.com)

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP:

We are pleased with our company's growth and success—and now would like to offer our products and fundraising assistance to teams and groups nationwide. To do so, we'll need to make some upgrades and improvements. With your contribution and those of your friends, we can implement the following:

  • Create instructional videos throughout the website—to guide you through our fundraising process
  • Improve customer relations with email campaigns—keeping your fundraising on track and offering tips and discounts
  • Beef up our tracking and reporting process (your BannerSeason dashboard)—where you manage "who sold what to whom"
  • Implement a sales incentive program, where athletes can earn a FREE player pennant
  • Develop additional designs for fundraising and recognition products
  • Attend trade shows and events throughout the country to introduce our solutions to groups like yours
  • And much more

If funded, we anticipate these improvements to be in place by January 2014.

Our products can be used to raise funds for a variety of sports. Everything from baseball to lacrosse, football to hockey—boys and girls sports. There's even dance, cheer, and band! Apply our program to your needs as you see fit:

  • High School teams and groups
  • Junior High/Middle School teams and groups
  • Competitive/Travel teams
  • AAU teams
  • Little League teams
  • Many more!

Whether you're a parent of an athlete, a coach, school or league administrator, sponsor or interested crowdfunder, we need your help. We ask for your support as we look to improve our website, our process, and customer service. Help us take our company nationwide. We offer several levels of rewards and ask you to review them and contribute.

After contributing, please "fund and forward"—which is simply telling your family, friends, and fellow sports parents about the great fundraising program and products BannerSeason offers. Let them see the benefit and add their support—so we all can enjoy a banner season!

PLEASE NOTE: Contributors creating a custom reward (car flag, phone case, canvas print, etc.) will receive their coupon code after the completion of our crowdfunding campaign. Products will be produced and mailed within 2-3 weeks of ordering. We're including FREE SHIPPING within the United States. Coupon codes will be valid for six months.

CHALLENGES ABOUND.

As you'll see in the following articles*, funding youth athletics at all levels is more challenging every year—no matter wherever you live. Help us bring financial relief to teams across the nation.

(Some links may not be clickable, as the articles may be archived. However, they work fine when copied and pasted into a new browser.)

National Federation of State High School Associations cover story (view article on pages 12-14): www.nfhs.org/uploadedfiles/3dissue/HSToday/2013issues/january2013/index.html

"Pay to participate" becoming the norm: http://annarbor.com/sports/high-school/pay-to-participate-story/

Tight budgets plague athletic programs: http://www.tampabay.com/sports/footballpreps/tight-budgets-skimpy-stipends-plague-high-school-athletic-programs/2131325

Here's one coach's humorous and painful solution to raise funds: http://www.athleticbusiness.com/articles/article.aspx?articleid=1449&zoneid=35

*These articles are for reference only and do not constitute an endorsement for BannerSeason, it's fundraising program or products.

story:
Mito and his boat

Hi, my name is Josh. I volunteer for Sailcycletrek.org an NGO which works in support other NGOs. I also come across amazing people during my travel missions, people with with dreams, and a desire to help others. I help them along with making those dreams a reality.

I met Mito on the beach in Vilankulos, Mozambique. We struck up a friendship. He told me about his boat which he has almost finished, but couldn't as he lacks the funding to make it happen.

Thats why he needs your help. 

If he can finish the boat, he can use it to create an income for himself and his family. Also, in exchange for my help (the creation of this Indiegogo campaign) he is going to teach me how to sail - a skill I will need to accomplish a much larger fundraiser I am embarking on next year January. (see Amazon Mission on sailcycletrek.org website)

What We Need 

Mito needs $ 200 (usd) to finish off his boat. (The campaign is set at $ 500 (usd) as this is the minimum available on Indiegogo). Any excess funds will be stored for further Sailcycletrek.org community projects.

the breakdown of the use of the $ 200 (usd) is as follows:

$50 to pay for work done on the boat so far.

$50 final waterproofing and paint to coat the outside of the boat

$50 Building the mast and other rigging needed for the sail

$25 Making the Sail

$25 Building the inner seating and storage of the boat.

I draw no personal funding from this or any of my other involvement with Sailcycletrek.org (I save my own earnings to use to volunteer in upstanding NGOs)

What You Get

To be a part of making a real change in a great guys life. A real change you can witness on the Sailcycletrek facebook page (He will need my help in the actual process of completing the boat and setting it on its maiden sail)
Depending on your level of involvement, you will receive the perk which corresponds to your commitment.

The Impact

I am working towards becoming a professional fundraiser for NGOs and individuals who are working towards effecting their environment with positive, active, and meaningful change.

This is my first Indiegogo.com fundraising attempt and I hope to learn more about this process and how I can achieve my goal of helping an NGO called faunaforever.org raise  $ 500 000 next year. It is a big dream, but hey, isnt our ability to dream the force which drives us to greater experiences. 

So far my volunteering with NGOs such as Greenpop.org, Lion Encounter, faunaforever.org and many more individuals, has changed my life and brought about a drastic improvement in my appreciation of my purpose. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute funds, your help is still most definitely needed.

Sailcycletrek.org is working towards at least 1000 likes its Facebook page before I set sail from Cape Town, South Africa to Rio De Janeiro, Brazil in January 2014 (again, check out sailcycletrek.org for more details). So please head over there and like the page, and share it if you think your friends would like it too.

For more information please check out Sailcycletrek.org and feel free to contact me if you would like to get involved.
story_txt:
Mito and his boat
Hi, my name is Josh. I volunteer for Sailcycletrek.org an NGO which works in support other NGOs. I also come across amazing people during my travel missions, people with with dreams, and a desire to help others. I help them along with making those dreams a reality.
I met Mito on the beach in Vilankulos, Mozambique. We struck up a friendship. He told me about his boat which he has almost finished, but couldn't as he lacks the funding to make it happen.
Thats why he needs your help. 
If he can finish the boat, he can use it to create an income for himself and his family. Also, in exchange for my help (the creation of this Indiegogo campaign) he is going to teach me how to sail - a skill I will need to accomplish a much larger fundraiser I am embarking on next year January. (see Amazon Mission on sailcycletrek.org website)


What We Need 
Mito needs $ 200 (usd) to finish off his boat. (The campaign is set at $ 500 (usd) as this is the minimum available on Indiegogo). Any excess funds will be stored for further Sailcycletrek.org community projects.
the breakdown of the use of the $ 200 (usd) is as follows:
$50 to pay for work done on the boat so far.
$50 final waterproofing and paint to coat the outside of the boat
$50 Building the mast and other rigging needed for the sail
$25 Making the Sail
$25 Building the inner seating and storage of the boat.
I draw no personal funding from this or any of my other involvement with Sailcycletrek.org (I save my own earnings to use to volunteer in upstanding NGOs)

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I’m Linda McClure, a technology librarian, from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada, recently laid off work due to budget cuts. I want to embark on a career as a professional website minion, helping individuals and small businesses by freeing them from the annoyingly time-consuming administrivia of running a website. The biggest need I have right now is to create a home office and file the necessary paperwork to make this dream a reality. But I need your help.

I need to raise $3750 to cover the cost of decent furniture, necessary software, and legally required licensing fees, so I’m turning to my strongest supporters to ask for help. In exchange, I’m offering groveling, gratitude, and public recognition of your awesomeness, plus a bit of cool swag. Your contribution will help me create a functional home office, and further, it will help launch a website minion on the path to independence. Thanks!

What We Need & What You Get

Your generous support will provide the resources for:

  • Desk that isn’t falling apart, w/hutch - $450
  • Chair that won’t cause permanent lumbar damage - $130
  • Filing cabinets not by Rubbermaid - $250
  • Reliable accounting software - $150
  • Monitor that weighs less than I do - $350
  • Analog wall organizer - $50
  • Toner to make laser jet more than decorative - $400
  • Tax software to remain audit-proof - $100
  • Business license to make it legal - $500
  • Business cards without crayon - $100 
  • Laptop battery so I don't need to sit near a plug in public - $100
  • Computer that doesn’t need a table fan for cooling - $800
  • Shelving that doesn’t look at home in a garage - $350

In return, you'll get all kinds of fun perks and funky swag (funky in a good way, that is), plus a happy, warm feeling of having done something to support an aspiring minion.

The Impact

Your contribution will help to cover the burden of initial start-up costs, and will thereby make the success of this enterprise more attainable. Your generosity will allow me to focus my time and energy on building the business rather than on the administrivia of scraping together funding to cover the one-time costs to pursue a business opportunity that presented itself somewhat more suddenly than I'd expected.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to make a financial contribution due to the demands of the festive season, please spread the word about either the campaign, or the pending availability of a website minion to those you think might be interested. (Of course, y'know, you can also feel free to do this even if you are able to contribute financially.)

THANK YOU!!

story:
Good Peoples: WE DID IT!!

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!


original fundraising text below---


We write to you with serious and sobering news. Despite all our efforts it has come to pass that we no longer have sufficient finances to keep Food For Thought Books open. Without a drastic change in circumstance and situation, we will be closing by the end of the year 2013. 


How can this be? 

Our events are frequent, usually unique, and well-attended. We've had people join our membership program - even had a few choose the lifetime option. We have local groups and organizations reaching out to us for collaborations. We have media groups requesting interviews with us to talk about worker collectives. We have had donations of money and supplies. We know people still value the work we do. We hear and receive that support every day. 

The main problem is the financial debt incurred by the massive drop in textbook sales over the past couple years - a legacy we are still trying to leave behind. 

Were it not for this debt, we would be doing fine - the same Food For Thought Books you've always known. But with it, we are bled dry every month. You've all probably noticed it - hard not to. Our shelves have dwindled and thinned, poster and card racks too. This is because we have not had money to invest in new stock. Except for special orders, customers ordering specific titles (money we knew we could quickly recoup), it has all gone to the debt. As a result, the store is becoming a ghost of itself. 

So, here we are: at the end of our rope. 

Maybe it is time to call it a day. We've been around for a good run: 37 years is no small thing. 

But really, we're not going to go down without one last effort, one last try. 

We think Food For Thought Books is worth it. And we think that the Valley still needs Food For Thought Books. There is no other place like it, and no other place that offers what it offers. Where is there another community space like ours in the Valley? Another public queer space? Another feminist space? Another radical space? 

Here's the thing: There is a possibility for Food For Thought Books to make it to and through its 38th year. 

It will require a lot of work and a lot of support but it can be done, with your help. We have spoken to our landlord who has agreed to help us reduce our store space by half. In the long run, we feel confident that Food For Thought Books could sustain itself with this new size and rental cost. Many of you remember when we were half our size years ago and that we still did many events, so that can all continue. 

The problem is in getting there. 

To reduce the store, we'll need to wait until after the holiday season. And then the store will need to be closed for anywhere from 3-4 weeks while reconstruction takes place. During this time we will still need to be paying all our regular expenses. With where we are at right now, there is no way we can do this, no way we can keep going for that long without any income to support us. 

So, what we need is support. 

What we need is support for the years we have been here and for the year to come. We are trying to raise $38,000 by the end of the year - a thousand for every year we've been open and a thousand for the year to come. If we can do so, we will be able to get to a more sustainable space for the future. 

Each Year a Grand Year = $38K

Why $38,000 ?? Good question. When we faced the prospect of closing we just couldn't accept it. So we asked ourselves: How much money would we need to reduce the store by half (back to what we used to be), cover our expenses while doing so, and land in a place where the debt from textbooks isn't bleeding us dry every month. When we constructed a number of financial scenarios it became clear we needed something like $37-40K. So, as we are entering our 38th year since opening we decided $38,000 was the number to shoot for.

Here's the thing: Food For Thought Books has always been a not-for-profit business. What does this mean? To be a "not-for-profit" business means we take whatever profits we make over & above basic expenses (e.g., rent, utilities, payroll) and we funnel that back to our community through donating money & resources to local non-profit organizations. None of the workers here receive anything like dividends or end-of-the-year distributions of profit. Food For Thought Books does not profit off the community/communities that gives it life - this is one of our fundamental precepts.

Over the years, Food For Thought Books has donated thousands of dollars to local, progressive/radical groups such as these: Youth Action Coalition, the Prison Birth Project, MotherWoman, Pioneer Valley Local First, Food Not Bombs, the Stonewall Center at UMass, the Prison Book Project, and many others.

What will this money go toward? 

  • It will help cover rent while we are closed and transitioning to a new and smaller space.
  • It will help cover pay for the workers who will do the work of moving and reconstructing the store.
  • It will pay for the necessary materials needed to make the transition and reconstruction. 
  • It will help bring new & awesome books/media into the store.
  • It will help secure a line of credit that we are negotiating with Cooperative Fund of New England.
  • And it will keep at bay the debt payments that need to be made while we have no income while being closed. 


We believe that if we can make this transition then Food For Thought Books can continue to serve the Amherst community and the greater Pioneer Valley as it always has - as a bookstore full of books you can't find anywhere else, as a community center for all manner of social justice and progressive communities, and as a safe space for those for who much of the world is still not a safe space. 


We need to raise $5K by the end of November, and the remaining $33K by the end of December, so time is of the essence! Please give now and spread the word to your family and friends. 


Can we do it? We want to believe we can!


Food For Thought Books Collective is an independent, not-for-profit, workers' collective project dedicated to the dissemination of radical & progressive media in all its various forms. We stand in solidarity with all struggles for justice, peace and equality and allies itself with all peoples resisting violence and oppression. We believe in media as a means toward the realization of social justice and liberation. We seek to provide a space where voices, people and ideas silenced and ignored by the mainstream media are given room to be heard, to be seen, to be supported and to be realized. We see ourselves as a hub for radical and progressive exchange and aim to provide a physical space in the community that is grounded in liberation for all.

story:
Who is my mom?

My mom's name is Nancy Zwiebel.  She is 56 years old retired teacher and fantastic mother!  She worked as a teacher for 15 years and really loved her job when she was working.

She recently got a kidney transplant because of her diabetes which she barely had enough money to raise through loans.  She is married to my amazing dad who has been helping her a lot, whether it be working over time at his job, or taking weeks off to help her with her sickness.

Some of her favorite hobbies are reading, cleaning, cooking, and being a mother.  She couldn't be the woman she is today without those.


                                          Why am I starting this campaign?

Ever since August 2nd, 1992, my mom has been diagnosed with diabetes and has been struggling through her sickness ever since.  She was able to get a kidney transplant though through the kindness of many and a lucky short time job she was able to find. 

One of the scariest moments my mom has had was when I was 12.  My mom was perfectly fine for a lot of the morning and part of the afternoon, but when I went in to check on my mom, she was laying there passed out on the bed.  I tried to get her to sit up, but every time I tried she would just fall face first into the bed.  I was scared, there was no one else in the house except for her and I.  I tried to bring her some water, so I sat her up put the water up to her mouth to see if she could drink it, but the water would just come dripping out of her mouth, not able to swallow.  I was scared to call the police or the ambulance because I had no idea if they would take her away for weeks, possibly months.

 But I couldn't figure out anything else to do so I dialed the numbers, 9-1-1.  

I sat down on our couch and told them everything that happened, within ten minutes of me calling I saw an ambulance outside my house rushing in to grab my mom and take her where she needed to go.

Fast forwarding to now

My mom has tried everything to keep her blood sugar up and stay as healthy as she can, but I am afraid of losing her at any time.


                                         What is the money going towards?

This money is going towards my mom to get treated for her intestinal problems since she can't eat very many things because of her diabetes.  So having this money to spend on hotels, gas, out of pocket expenses, and everything else that may be needed will be a big help.  Because sometimes insurance may just not be able to cover everything.

So being able to get this treatment will not only put a smile on her face, but you will let a guy keep his mom for possibly a little longer.


                                                Other ways you can help!

If you are not able to donate any money, an easy way of helping is sharing the link to friends, family, or the internet.

Any place is good as long as people can see it!

story:
Rawr Bars

VegThisWay now gives you the opportunity to snack healthily without having to give up flavor through the creation of Rawr Bars, an all-natural dried vegetable strip. Every Rawr Bar has been perfected by selecting hearty vegetables and complimentary fruits to enhance the natural flavor of the vegetable. Explore the benefits of Rawr Bars:

  • ½ serving of vegetables
  • all-natural
  • high in vitamins and minerals
  • no sugar added
  • no preservatives
  • fat free
  • gluten free
  • vegan

Rawr Bars come in two signature flavors as of now, Super Sweet Potato and Beet-A-Peel. Each flavor offers a unique flavor profile with great health benefits.

Our Story: VegThisWay

VegThisWay began at Cal Poly, San Luis Obispo, where we combined our love of food with our passion to make healthy living easier for everyone. In search of the ultimate way to get kids to eat their vegetables, Rawr Bars were born! With our team of dedicated food science and business members, we have worked hard to create a healthy snack with a high quality taste that kids will want to eat. Along the way we have had an immense amount of help from mentors and community members through the Center for Innovation and Entrepreneurship’s HotHouse Accelerator and Incubator programs. With all of the support we have received we are continuing to turn our vision of healthy living made easy into a reality. As we continue to grow our story we look forward to turning the world into a healthier place, one Rawr Bar at a time!

Learn more about us by visiting our website!

Where Are We Now

We have worked extremely hard to make sure that we are delivering the best product possible to you! Through looking at what our customers want and what their needs are, we have developed Rawr Bars into a delicious and healthy snack. We have done many samplings of our product and after getting great feedback on the taste and texture; we decided it was time to take the next step and start selling our product.

We started selling Rawr Bars at local farmers markets and events in the San Luis Obispo, CA area to help get our product in peoples hands. This has allowed us to begin to build a local following for VegThisWay. Through this we have noticed that Rawr Bars are something that people want! This has been great validation to help us get to the next step in our story, which is to start selling Rawr Bars in retail stores so that we can reach a larger audience.

Why We Need Your Help! 

We are asking for your help because Rawr Bars should be on the shelves near you! To do that, we need to scale up our manufacturing process in order to keep up with demand.  As of now we are manufacturing Rawr Bars in a commercial kitchen with limited equipment. We need to buy convection ovens for us to produce more than twice the amount of Rawr Bars that we are currently able to produce. This $20,114 will go towards equipment, ingredients, packaging, and marketing costs, which will take Rawr Bars into trade shows and retail stores.  With your donation you can help our dream become a reality by promoting a healthier and more productive world.

Some eat to live, but here at VegThisWay we live to eat!

Thank You!

Our team at VegThisWay would like to extend a huge “Thank You” to all of our friends, family and supporters who have extended their generosity to help turn our journey into a success.

We VegThisWay and you should too!!

Like us on facebook, twitter, and instagram!

vegan
Rawr Bars come in two signature flavors as of now, Super Sweet Potato and Beet-A-Peel. Each flavor offers a unique flavor profile with great health benefits.Our Story: VegThisWayVegThisWay began at Cal Poly, San Luis Obispo, where we combined our love of food with our passion to make healthy living easier for everyone. In search of the ultimate way to get kids to eat their vegetables, Rawr Bars were born! With our team of dedicated food science and business members, we have worked hard to create a healthy snack with a high quality taste that kids will want to eat. Along the way we have had an immense amount of help from mentors and community members through the Center for Innovation and Entrepreneurship’s HotHouse Accelerator and Incubator programs. With all of the support we have received we are continuing to turn our vision of healthy living made easy into a reality. As we continue to grow our story we look forward to turning the world into a healthier place, one Rawr Bar at a time!Learn more about us by visiting our website!Where Are We NowWe have worked extremely hard to make sure that we are delivering the best product possible to you! Through looking at what our customers want and what their needs are, we have developed Rawr Bars into a delicious and healthy snack. We have done many samplings of our product and after getting great feedback on the taste and texture; we decided it was time to take the next step and start selling our product.We started selling Rawr Bars at local farmers markets and events in the San Luis Obispo, CA area to help get our product in peoples hands. This has allowed us to begin to build a local following for VegThisWay. Through this we have noticed that Rawr Bars are something that people want! This has been great validation to help us get to the next step in our story, which is to start selling Rawr Bars in retail stores so that we can reach a larger audience.Why We Need Your Help! We are asking for your help because Rawr Bars should be on the shelves near you! To do that, we need to scale up our manufacturing process in order to keep up with demand.  As of now we are manufacturing Rawr Bars in a commercial kitchen with limited equipment. We need to buy convection ovens for us to produce more than twice the amount of Rawr Bars that we are currently able to produce. This $20,114 will go towards equipment, ingredients, packaging, and marketing costs, which will take Rawr Bars into trade shows and retail stores.  With your donation you can help our dream become a reality by promoting a healthier and more productive world.Some eat to live, but here at VegThisWay we live to eat!Thank You!Our team at VegThisWay would like to extend a huge “Thank You” to all of our friends, family and supporters who have extended their generosity to help turn our journey into a success.We VegThisWay and you should too!!Like us on facebook, twitter, and instagram!

story:
Welcome!

My name is Vadym Biriukovych and I am from Kyiv, Ukraine. Sailing and construction of ferrocement yachts is not just a hobby for me, it’s a family tradition!

 

 

 

My grandpa Dmytro Biriukovych has built several tall ships (“Tsemental”, “Batkivschshyna”, “Pochayna” an others) including the first ferrocement yacht in the Soviet Union and started the first private yacht club in the former Soviet Union in 1967.

 You can see the pictures here:

“Tsemental” - the first ferrocement yacht in the Soviet Union

 

Schooner “Batkivschshyna”

 

Brigantine “Pochayna”

 

Grandpa has been taking part in Sail Training events around the world for many years.

Captain Dmytro Biriukovych at the parade of Sails in New York City during OpSail 2000

This is what it was like during the parade of Sails in New York City during OpSail 2000.

 

I grew up around the boats and been sailing since I was a little kid. As a teenager I participated in OpSail 2000 and Tall Ships 2000 on the east coast of North America. I was the youngest crew member on Ukrainian tall ship “Batkivschshyna. And in 2001 I took part in the American Sail Training Tall Ship event in the Great Lakes.

Sailing down the Dnipro river with my mom and dad when I was 1 year old.

 

Grandpa and I are enjoying a nice day in the Atlantic

I inherited my grandpa’s passion to sailing and looking to make a journey of a life time.

For the last 4 years we have been constructing a brigantine, which is 21 meters long (68.8 feet). Now I need your assistance to finish this ship, which we are calling “Batkivshchyna 2”.

Photo of “Batkivshchyna 2” from last summer

My dream is to launch “Batkivshchyna 2” in May 2013. I hope to have everything finished by the summer of 2013 with your donations and plan to take part in The Mediterranean Regatta 2013, which features visits to ports in Spain, France and Italy.

Barcelona, Spain        Sat 21 to Tues 24 September 

Toulon, France           Fri 27 to Mon 30 September 

La Spezia, Italy           Fri 4 to Mon 7 October 

I am very excited to reach my Indigogo goal of $15,000. We have the masts and the sails but we need funds to purchase marine diesel engine, which is extremely vital. In order to launch the ship in time we will need the funds by March 15th.

With your donation, we will be able to provide you with a special opportunity to participate on board during a Tall Ship event or more importantly to learn the joy of sailing.

This is what it was like to sail down the Dnipro river:

The SCF Black Sea Tall Ship Regatta will take place from Varna, Bulgaria from 30th of April to May 3rd. Then we will sail across the Black Sea to Novorossiysk, Russia to attend their event from May 9th – 12th 2014.

Then we will cruise in company for three days with all the other Tall Ships to Sochi, Russia for their event from May 15 – 18th.

Then it is back across the Black Sea again to Constanta, Romania. There event takes place from the 25th till the 28th of May.

To get to these events we will also be inviting you to sail with us on the 3rd longest river in Europe down the Dnipro River from Kyiv, Ukraine all the way to Sevastopol on the Black Sea.

Come for the launch and sail on the Dnipro River this summer!

story:
About Heads Will Roll Beauty Salon

UPDATE: We are very close to securing an amazing location in downtown Las Vegas! Only $4,000.00 is needed for leasing and additional fees. Below is the floor plan. It is also right next to a new bar and brewery! 


Dottie Vee's Heads Will Roll Beauty Salon (Heads Will Roll or HWR for short) is a vintage themed salon coming to Downtown Las Vegas in 2013. Our focus is our clients, education and the community! Heads Will Roll Beauty Salon was created in January of 2013 by Dottie Vee who is a respected hair stylist and makeup artist in the Las Vegas community. Quickly her idea and passion turned into a business. We are almost ready to open but we need your help!

Dottie Vee of Heads Will Roll Beauty Salon

Heads Will Roll is the first of its kind in Las Vegas. It will offer the unique experience of a vintage beauty salon. We will not only be a full service salon offering cuts, men's cuts and styling, color, color correction, extensions, hair treatments, and products. Our team of hair stylist and makeup artists are experienced in everything from classic vintage looks to weddings and everything in between. We'll make heads roll on your special day, event, party, or photo shoot!

Coming to the exciting Downtown Las Vegas!

Heads Will Roll will offer an in house boutique featuring exclusive designs from Elle Heavin Clothing. Need the perfect dress to go with your new do? Heads Will Roll will have a variety of retro inspired dresses and separates right at your finger tips. Have a dream dress in mind? No problem! Elle Heavin Clothing also provides custom designs, consultations, and private fittings.

Our focus is on our clients, education, and the community! What does that exactly mean and why is it important?

Clients: The HWR team is made up of hardworking and passionate individuals. Our goal is to make our clients 100% happy every time they come in and out of our doors. We strive to build lasting relationships with each and everyone of our clients by offering the best service.

Education: Our team at HWR is experienced and trained, but education is never ending! Our team will receive monthly and annual education on the newest trends and techniques for products, styling, hair cutting, and color. We will also offer education to the community! Classes will feature everything from basic hair care and styling to advanced vintage styling and makeup techniques! Furthering our education will help us succeed in delivering the best service to our clients.

Community: HWR would be nothing without our amazing community! Our goal is to bring the community together and be a positive presence. In addition to the full service salon and boutique, HWR will participate in local events such as First Friday and Viva Las Vegas and work with local charities. We will also have our own events to showcase the ever growing Downtown Las Vegas, local charities, local families, residents, artists, photographers, stylists, models, designers, and small business owners the make up our diverse community.

What We Need & What You Get

We are very close to securing a location, starting construction, designing and preparing for our grand opening. However, expensive city regulation fees, construction, and leasing is putting us behind. With your help we can reach our goal and open to the public by November 2013! 

We are very close to securing a location! Only $4000.00 needed for leasing and taxes!  
Your generous donations will go towards the following: Drains, bowls, city fees on the number sinks in salons, leasing, and construction

We have some amazing perks for your generosity and support! 

UPDATE 08/15/13: New perks added and prices lowered! Get the new pin curl perk for only $10 and receive a complimentary hair cut at Heads Will Roll Beauty Salon! Limited Edition Heads Will Roll Beauty Salon T-shirts are now only $25! Plus big discounts for HWR, Elle Heavin Clothing and HWR product goodie bags added to all perks $25 and above! 

Makeovers by Owner and Head Stylist Dottie Vee! We have a few perks offering services from Dottie Vee featuring a new cut and style or a complete makeover with cut, color, style and makeup application! Here is a sampling of her work! 

Discounts and custom dresses from our boutique designer Elle Heavin Clothing!  Discover Elle Heavin Clothing, an authentic, trendy line of vintage inspired garments. Each piece delicately incorporates the designers edgy yet girly style. Elle Heavin features handcrafted detailing and chic cuts making this line desirable to many.

Elle Heavin has been sewing for the past 16 years and started designing 8 years ago. Every season Elle Heavin has been very diverse in her designs. Summer she seems to show a flirty silhouette in her design while in Autumn she tends to be a bit edgier in the shape and cut of the garment always leaving an element of surprise!

 Elle of Elle Heavin Clothing

 


 

 

 

The first ever limited edition HWR Logo T-shirt! Made especially for our Indiegogo campaign. In both men and women's sizes! 

Become a pinup girl for a day! We have put together some amazing photo shoot package perks with Radiant Inc! You could even be flown out to Las Vegas and get the V.I.P treatment! Air fare, 2 night hotel stay on the strip, complete makeover, and the deluxe pinup girl for a day photo shoot! View more of Radiant Inc's work at www.radiantinc.net 

 

Discounts and lifetime savings! Many of our perks include discounts for all of our services at HWR and for Elle Heavin Clothing! We also are offering discounts of 20% and 30% off for life! 

The Impact

We want to share our passion and vision with the Las Vegas community and the world! Not only will HWR benefit our community by offering new jobs but we will provide a unique experience, professional services, and one of kind designs to our clients in the community and to the millions of people who visit Las Vegas every year. 

We want to showcase the beauty, class and appeal of the pinup girl, the glamourous movie starlets and the handsome leading men of the 1940's and 50's. All with a modern twist featuring the latest trends and techniques! Feeling confident and beautiful never goes out of style! 

Your contributions will help bring our vision to life! We are very close to making our hard work, passions, and dreams a reality. But we need your help to get there! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone is able to make a finincial contribution. HWR started with networking and the power of social media! Become a fan and friend of our Facebook page and profile, follow us on Twitter and Instagram. Share our campaign on your social media network and with your favorite blogs! 

It could be a contributation of $1 or sharing our campiagn on your Facebook page everything counts and helps us reach our goal! 

www.facebook.com/headswillrollsalon

www.facebook.com/HWRBeautySalon

https://twitter.com/HeadsWillRollLV

http://instagram.com/headswillrollsalon

 

Thank you for taking the time to read our story!

story:
(scroll down for english)

Le concept de cette entreprise est de développer un Hexacopter avec une charge d'environ 5 à 6 kg afin de pouvoir embarquer tous types de caméras vidéo professionnelles. Il transmet également de la vidéo sur une deuxième télécommande qui pilote les axes de la camera

Le développement consiste à assembler les différentes pièces existantes et celles qui n'existent pas encore seront à inventer.

Le but de l'entreprise sera d'offrir nos services à l'industrie du film, tourner des vidéos de promotion pour les agences immobilières ou autres entreprises, des couvreurs ou autres métiers afin d'inspecter un toit ou d’autre construction sans devoir y monter, ce qui économise du temps et des éventuels dangers.

Un autre but de l'entreprise est de développer et de fabriquer les Hexacopter pour la vente à un prix plus bas que les Hexacopter actuels sur le marché. Le prix de vente devrais tourner autour de CHF 4000.- à 4500.- (sans camera)

Je vous remercie d'avance pour votre soutien

www.copter-clip.com

 

 --------------------------------

 

The concept is to build a Hexacopter which is able to lift about 5-6 kg to transport professional camcorders. It also transmits live pictures to a separate remote control of the camera.

The development consists to build this Hexacopter with existing and not existing spare part cheaper than existing Hexacopters.

The goal of this company is to provide services of aerial videos for film producers, advertising of real estate companies, roofer companies to inspect roofs safely and fast.

The second goal is to build complete Hexacopter's for sale including video transmitter and second remote control as cheap as possible. The final Sales Price should arrive between CHF 4000.- and 4500.- (without camera)

Thank you very much for your help

www.copter-clip.com

story:
Short Summary

Washington, DC has developed a broad cycling culture and we feel that this passion should not be bound by age or income. Many kids in the DC area will go without presents this year, so what better gift than one that will both empower and promote a healthy lifestyle?

On Monday, December 17th, we will be pedaling for a purpose...and we want you to join us!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to achieve our goal of providing bikes to kids, we will need YOUR generous support! Funds raised here will be used to support the functions of fixing used bikes that will then be donated. We will also be purchasing some new/used bikes with whatever extra funding we are able to raise. 

Our goal is to raise $500 to donate to VeloCity, a bicycle-centric nonprofit that is working extra hard this holiday season to provide local youth with a (recycled) set of wheels. Learn more about VeloCity's noble endeavors here: http://velocitycoop.org

Your donation of any amount will admit you to be included on our post-event email list, which will detail our success and display pictures of how festive riders looked in their holiday garb!

Larger donators will receive special gifts from participating local businesses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends about our fundraiser and feel free to share via email, Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/events/414425188630046/?fref=ts), Twitter (#PedalforPresents) or other means.

story:
Our Pitch

Many people search for the steak that is cooked to perfection, the burger with just the right amount of moist and char, the donut with just the right ratio of melt in their mouth to sweetness. We are on a mission of creating the unforgettable hot wing. Our wings will be moist, and yet crispy on the outside, doused in just the right amount of one of our ten delicious sauces.

AJ’s Wings is YOUR Eastern New Mexico chicken wing restaurant :great food, excellent service and fun, friendly atmosphere.

Portales is in need of a unique quick service restaurant and that is exactly what we have in mind with AJ's Wings. We feel the family friendly environment and great food will keep customers coming back for more, whether to enjoy the friendly service, the anticipated downtown patio seating area or just our great food.

After being laid off in March of this year, I have been looking for a new job/career in order to support my family of 6. Numerous attempts to get my foot in the door have led to nothing but rejection emails and frustration. Not knowing where to turn and not sure if we should uproot the family or not, I began pondering different ideas that would allow me to feed my family AND my entrepreneurial spirit, while keeping our kids in the town they have come to call home.

I believe the key to a successful business plan is doing something that you love and have a passion for. When I first moved to Portales in 2009 I felt that there was a need for a good wings place in town. Since that time, we have tried every possible wing option from the local establishments and have yet to find a place that serves something that makes us crave more and want to return again and again. At the risk of sounding like a glutton, chicken wings are something I am passionate about and I have always wanted to be my own boss. Being a college town, Portales is prime for a good wings restaurant.

My wife, Jo, is a third year culinary student, and, having spent a time in Louisiana, is also passionate about great food and hospitality. It is Jo's desire to serve great food, along with her joy of hosting large groups, that will help AJ's thrive. With Jo's expertise and experience in the kitchen, this venture can't help but succeed.

Why AJ's

One thing that Portales lacks is a quick service chicken wing establishment. There is simply nowhere to get a good chicken wing. However, AJ's will not stop at just good. We will not stop until we reach great. We have a passion for providing great food and an inviting atmosphere.

AJ's Wings will specialize in just that, Wings! Wings are great for any occasion...to celebrate a birthday, while watching your favorite sporting event, a casual get-together with friends, or just to feel a slight burn on a weekday afternoon. Whichever craving you have, AJ's will satisfy it with our amazing wings, delicious side dishes and refreshing lighter menu items such as salads and wraps.

Our opening day menu will consist of the following:

We will also take a slight spin on the traditional quick service restaurant by adding an outdoor patio area where our clients can dine and enjoy the sights and sounds of the downtown area,

either in the sun or under the stars. This area will be used for general dining, local gatherings, live music and, of course, hanging with friends. The downtown area of Portales is in dire need of something new and we feel that by creating a patio where locals can hang out and enjoy great food, amazing service and just feel at home, we will be serving a need that is being left unfilled by other businesses in the area. Our patio will include a sound wall to for noise control as well as a built-in fire pit to set the cozy and inviting mood that we want to provide for our customers.

Our Need, Your Reward

Traditional financing is not an option for Aaron and me. We feel that corporate banks couldn't care less about the little people and only care too much about the bottom line and how much they will make on a deal. This is why we feel that finding investors who genuinely want to try our product and have an interest in seeing us succeed is such a great option.

Our available initial investment is not enough to begin operations, but will be added to the funding received.

In order for us to open our doors we will need to strive for the following funding levels:


Feel free to give early and often. Your total investment will dictate your reward level. Every funder at the $50 level (and up) will receive a custom AJ's Wings t-shirt

Additionally, most funders will receive free meal combos redeemable after we have been established for a period of time.

Please note that funders who are not part of the local community will be offered additional t-shirts and merchandise in lieu of free lunch combos. We are working on a couple limited edition shirts that will only be available to our funders.

This Eye Heart Wings tee will only be available for funders who are not in the local area and donate $25 or more to our project:


This We Like It Saucy tee will be used as our promotional tee for all funders who qualify:

Our top funders will receive VIP cards good for discount off our menu items. This discount will be good for a period of 3 years. Top funders will also receive a commemorative engraved stone, which will be used in the building of our patio. These stones will forever recognize the contributions made by our funders and local community.

Other items such as soft opening invites, patio opening invites

and private parties/catered events are also available. We are even offering funders the opportunity to create and name their own sauce.

Rewards redeemable after 3 months of operations. Lunch certificates and VIP card will be mailed to backers. Limit 1 free lunch per month. *VIP card good once per day. **Alcohol not included if available. Event not to exceed 2 hours and is limited to schedule availability

Giving Back 

We realize that we cannot do this alone, which is why we have created this page, and we want to give back to our community. Having lived paycheck to paycheck for most of our lives, we understand the importance of being able to get out from under financial burdens. This is why within 6 months of opening our doors, AJ's will generate 2 part-time positions in the Portales community with wages above minimum wage. Our employees will share in our vision for great food, excellent service and community outreach.

Additionally, AJ's Wings will give 2% of its first year revenues to charity. Specifically, we would like to give to Chive Charities as we have seen the wonderful things that the Chive has done for so many people. It is an amazing community of selfless people who truly care about bettering other people's lives. We will aim to raise the amount given every year, but it will never drop below 2%. Chive Charities is an amazing foundation and they deserve all the help they can get. KCCO

To learn more about Chive Charities, please click here

Other Ways to Help 

We understand that not everybody can contribute, but they will still want to share in our journey.  You can help us by liking and sharing this link with your friends and family.  Also, if you use social media like we do, share our link with your network.

Our link is igg.me/at/wingery

We appreciate your time in looking at our project and look forward to serving you in the future.

Thank You for Your Support
story_txt:
Our
Pitch

Many people search for the steak that is cooked to perfection, the burger with just the right amount of moist and char, the donut with just the right ratio of melt in their mouth to sweetness. We are on a mission of creating the unforgettable hot wing. Our wings will be moist, and yet crispy on the outside, doused in just the right amount of one of our ten delicious sauces.
AJ’s Wings is YOUR Eastern New Mexico chicken wing restaurant :great food, excellent service and fun, friendly atmosphere.
Portales is in need of a unique quick service restaurant and that is exactly what we have in mind with AJ's Wings. We feel the family friendly environment and great food will keep customers coming back for more, whether to enjoy the friendly service, the anticipated downtown patio seating area or just our great food.
After being laid off in March of this year, I have been looking for a new job/career in order to support my family of 6. Numerous attempts to get my foot in the door have led to nothing but rejection emails and frustration. Not knowing where to turn and not sure if we should uproot the family or not, I began pondering different ideas that would allow me to feed my family AND my entrepreneurial spirit, while keeping our kids in the town they have come to call home.
I believe the key to a successful business plan is doing something that you love and have a passion for. When I first moved to Portales in 2009 I felt that there was a need for a good wings place in town. Since that time, we have tried every possible wing option from the local establishments and have yet to find a place that serves something that makes us crave more and want to return again and again. At the risk of sounding like a glutton, chicken wings are something I am passionate about and I have always wanted to be my own boss. Being a college town, Portales is prime for a good wings restaurant.
My wife, Jo, is a third year culinary student, and, having spent a time in Louisiana, is also passionate about great food and hospitality. It is Jo's desire to serve great food, along with her joy of hosting large groups, that will help AJ's thrive. With Jo's expertise and experience in the kitchen, this venture can't help but succeed.

Why AJ's

One thing that Portales lacks is a quick service chicken wing establishment. There is simply nowhere to get a good chicken wing. However, AJ's will not stop at just good. We will not stop until we reach great. We have a passion for providing great food and an inviting atmosphere.
AJ's Wings will specialize in just that, Wings! Wings are great for any occasion...to celebrate a birthday, while watching your favorite sporting event, a casual get-together with friends, or just to feel a slight burn on a weekday afternoon. Whichever craving you have, AJ's will satisfy it with our amazing wings, delicious side dishes and refreshing lighter menu items such as salads and wraps.

story:
I need help. Not that kind. I might need a psychiatrist but that will have to be later.  The bank is on the brink of foreclosing on my home and I don’t know what else I can do to stop it.  I am not working, although I used to.  I worked for the government for years and years and years and years.  You get the idea.  Until I could work there no more.  So I retired.  I thought I could live on my retirement.  Frugally but still live.  I was wrong. After taxes and insurance my little retirement package dwindled down to next to nothing. I certainly can’t live on that.  I mean really, who could?  So I tried starting my own business but nobody hired me.  So then I went to refurbishing furniture. Nobody bought it. I wrote a book. Nobody read it.  Have you ever read Shel Silverstein’s “Nobody ”? I’m the person with no peaches’ or pears.

In the last 2 months I have applied for over 50 jobs and I got 3 interviews.  The 1st one, a thrift store, said I couldn’t lift the weight.  The 2nd one, a dollar store said I wasn’t qualified. The 3rd one said they hired someone on Friday. My interview was on Monday.  They were so sorry they forgot to call me.

It’s not that things weren’t bad enough as I started scouting out bridges and underpasses for my next home but I took in my elderly crazy sister.  My cuz called me and said do you know your sister is homeless? I didn’t.  Next thing I know she’s living here.  Who’s crazy now? This might sound like a humanitarian act.  It wasn’t.  I weighed which option would cause me less stress. Her living with me or her living out on the street.  Her living with me won.  I’m now having doubts on my choice.  Apparently she doesn’t shower. She can’t use a vacuum cleaner, washing machine or dishwasher.  Although she has no problems with the TV, stove or microwave.  So she is not technology challenged. She has managed to turn me into her servant.  So maybe she’s not so crazy after all.  But I got to tell you.  If I end up living under a bridge she’s not coming with me.  She’s going to have to find her own bridge.

But I digress.  I’m doing this out of sheer desperation because I’m losing my home.  The home I grew my kids in.  The home that I have made my own with the weird little touches only I would do.  The place my miniature dachshund guards.  And I want to keep it. I want it to be the place I lay my head at night and cook my oatmeal in in the morning.  Crowdfunding seems to have worked for others and I know it seems only one step above holding up a sign “Help The Poor” in a Walmart parking lot.  But with just little help from a lot of you this crazy cat lady can live out her life in peace and harmony.

So look around you.  What if this was you and you were in my shoes?  Just like me everything you own of value would be up for sale on Ebay.  Your car would be for sale.  You too would quit eating and consider food a luxury.  And isn’t it amazing that Ramen, which has no food value, is so fattening?  Now do what I would do if I were in your shoes and make a contribution to my cause.  Five, ten, twenty, a thousand, a trillion.  Just whatever you feel you can afford.  It will all be equally appreciated. And you can go to sleep tonight knowing you did your good deed for the day.

And I’m thanking you in advance because I know you’re going to help.  I just know it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Nix Trikes

Hopefully, I will have two babies coming in July. One is Nix Trikes; the other is my little girl. A new baby and a new business is a fun adventure! I have gone to Alaska for summer work, but this summer I would love to open the doors to Nix Trikes and be home with my wife when she brings our new girl into the world. 

The business needs a commercial location and to bring in new brands for rentals and sales, this would put us on track to fulfill our goal of becoming a unique, niche, one of a kind rental outfit. 

Experience the beauty of Zion National and St, George, UT on all the Red Rock Bike Trails of this beautiful area.

We already have contracts in place to buy trikes, both adult and child models. This is where you come in. Help us so we can be one of the first companies in a young growing industry. Currently, there are only a handful of recumbent trike rental companies in the United States. With your help we hope to make that number grow. We would aim to build a trike track for riding and racing as well as options for family fun events. Such as family night discounts, kid day racing, and a trike-in movie.

•  All of this can only be accomplished with your help!

In order to keep working towards opening Nix Trikes, I need your help. I want to enhance Southern Utah by creating a fun, exciting recreational activity for the kid in all of us.

You shouldn't just hand over piles of money without any benefit (unless you want to of course!)

*GIVING IS RECEIVING!

•  With a gift of any amount, you'll be making a huge impact!

•  Use this as a way for you to pre-purchase from the shop. Gifts can turn into in-store credit for discounts and rental time.

•  Sweet stickers, t-shirts etc.

•  Putting your name on our funding wall is another way we will thank you for helping this dream move forward. 


We're throwing a thank you party at the Grand Opening with food, games & prizes!

Even if we don't meet the higher goal, every penny will go toward supporting this vision and keeping the project on track.

 Other Ways You Can Help

So maybe you like the idea of helping but are a little low on cash yourself.  What can you do to help instead of a financial contribution?

•  Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.  Share share share!

•  You can use the Indiegogo share tools. You can go tell a friend via Facebook, Twitter, e-mail, snail mail or just shout from rooftops!

**we will be giving OUT PRIZES for two things.

1.  The top campaigner, Win for just sharing my campaign.

2.  The person that brings in the most funding money they give will help you win.

( if you share the most and they give the most you could win both prizes… don’t forget to login.)

*TRUST ME, THE PRIZES WILL BE AWESOME!!!

Updates will be coming as we have them.  Thanks in advance, no matter what form your support takes.  Every little bit means the world to us!

Nix Trikes invites you to participate in this new and exciting business. If you wish to become a part of our story, or would just like to ride a trike, then please help this dream become a reality.

Thank you for your time!

**Important Note: A fan can only be tracked as a "Campaigner" in the Campaign Stats section if the Fan is logged into an Indiegogo account when they use any of the Share Tools on your campaign. A fan can also copy and paste the campaign URL displaying in their browser's address bar, as long as they are copying the URL that displays when they are logged into their Indiegogo account.

**Any user that does not have an Indiegogo account can still have their referrals tracked on this campaign's Referrals tab once they've contributed to the campaign. Contributors will be presented with a special URL immediately after contributing (on the completed contribution landing page, under "Spread the word!") that they can copy and share with their network.

*Shipping and Handling Charges will be added, for all out of area shipping cost.
